loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is married and has two children. She has received schooling through primary school. Christiana sells rice in Apowa near Takoradi, which she has done for five years. Her husband is a supervisor at a local business. 

Christiana uses her income to help pay her husband's and children's expenses. Christiana will use the loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice to sell in the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christiana plans to grow her rice selling business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice to sell in the market.

loans.name: Raheela's Group

texts.en: Shagufta and Raheela live in Rawalpindi and are both married. Both have a tailoring business and are self employed. They belong to the same group, Shagufta being the group leader. Shagufta is married, aged 35 and a mother of one. She started stitching when she was only 15. Her group member Raheela is also a young lady of 29 years and a mother of three children. Given the increase in demand for tailored products they have applied for a group loan from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to help them increase their business to generate more income. This loan will make them more empowered by helping them increase their income and increase the standard of living for their family.

loans.use: To increase their tailoring business

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Kericho remain underserved by financial institutions. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this remote town and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. Meet Sally, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest mother who is 30 years of age! She hails from the Kericho area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of 3 lovely, school-going children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. Sally’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout she has never regretted going into farming. Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been good. She faces financial challenges, and because the Kericho area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereal for re-sale and thus improve her income. Sally’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. But this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Sally has received training and proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Sally is quite visionary and - with her accumulated profits - hopes she will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereal for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add on stock.

loans.name: Vilma Leonor

texts.en:
One of the most common accompaniments for meal in our country is the tortilla, and every meal three times a day, should have hot and delicious tortillas with it. I have several years experience making tortillas which has created enough income to help my family and now that my children have grown, and are going to secondary school, their education costs have doubled. I need to buy more material to make tortillas so that I can increase sales and to continue supporting my children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Uno de los acompañantes de cada comida en nuestro pais son las tortillas, los tres tiempos de comida deben acompañarse con las ricas y calientes tortillas. Tengo varios años de dedicarme a la fabricacion de tortillas y me ha generado ganancias suficientes para ayudar a mi familia, ahora mis hijos han crecido y van a la secundaria por lo que la inversion en sus estudios es el doble. Necesito comprar material para las tortillas e incrementar mis ventas para seguir apoyandoles.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make tortillas.

loans.name: Anival

texts.en:
Mr. Suárez has a workshop that offers auto repair and painting services on the east side of the city. Because he has been in that area for a long time and because of his good customer service, Mr. Suárez cannot keep pace with the growing demand. He says "I have started to think about expanding my business, thus I need $1,200 to hire two employees and buy enough material and equipment."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Suárez tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura en el oriente de la ciudad, por la antigüedad en ese sector y su buena atención a los clientes no se da abasto. "Ha llegado el momento de pensar en extenderme y para esto necesito dar empleo a 2 personas y comprar suficiente material y herramienta, con 1,200.00 dlls.

loans.use: Para extender su negocio.

loans.name: Porn

texts.en: Porn M. is 29 years old and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She is a grocer and earns around 2.5 dollars a day. Her husband is a construction foreman and also makes wine. He earns 5 dollars a day. They have 3 children who are students.  She wants to purchase tools to expand her husband's wine business. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase tools to make more wine

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is 46 years old, married with two children, ages 14 and 21. Her husband has his own business, but because he does not receive a reliable income at all times the family has been through some hard times. So in order to get some additional income and help out their children with school, Maria started selling sweets and hamburgers. Little by little her business has improved and the number of clients has grown. Maria is an enthusiastic woman and thanks to her personality she has been able to help her business and her family move forward.

At this time Maria is asking for a loan of $375 dollars that will be used to purchase additional consumables to serve along with her hamburgers due to the increased demands of her clients and Maria’s desire to be able to meet these demands. She has promised to repay the loan within 6 months. Please become an important part of this family’s life and in the development of their business, they very much appreciate your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Maria del Carmen tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 14 y 21 años. Su esposo tiene un negocio propio por lo que no recibe un ingreso seguro pero y en ocasiones pasa por momentos difíciles, para poder obtener un ingreso extra y ayudar a que sus hijos continúen sus estudios Maria inició la venta de dulces y hamburguesas, poco a poco ha estado surtiendo mejor su negocio e incrementando su número de clientes, Maria es una mujer entusiasta y gracias a su carácter ha sacado adelante su negocio y a su familia.

En estos momentos Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que necesita en la elaboración de las hamburguesas porque su demanda se ha incrementado y desea poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia y en el desarrollo de su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Reina Marcelina

texts.en:
Reina Marcelina D. E. belongs to the village bank “Los Laureles,” which is a Spanish word for “The Laurels.”

Sunday through Saturday, from 5:00 am to 7:00 am, Reina can be found behind her display of delicious handmade fresh breads of several varieties. Located in front of the Santa Clara Catholic Church, Reina’s bread stand, “Pan Jose,” sells French bread, and also traditional Peruvian breads such as “chapla” and “bizcoch,” which she says are her big sellers.

Reina got her start baking bread eight years ago when she married her husband Jose, whose family boasts many generations of bakers. Together, Jose and Reina have three children ages eight, six, and one. Apart from selling her breads from the stand every morning, Reina also provides bread commercially to several local “tiendas” or grocery stores in the local neighborhood. A typical business day for Reina begins at 7:00 pm when she and her husband begin baking the bread to be sold the next morning. All the baking is done in their house and lasts all night until 3:00 am the next morning.

Reina says she is very happy to be a part of her village bank, which she credits for many of the opportunities she has received in order to increase the size of her business. She is asking for a $600 loan, with which she will be able to buy flour, eggs, spices, and other materials needed to continue baking fresh bread every day.

loans.use: She is asking for a $600 loan, with which she will be able to buy flour, eggs, spices, and other materials needed to continue baking fresh bread every day.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Mrs. Helen A. is a 52-year-old widow with 10 children, who lives in Benin City. She makes and sells bean cakes (Akara).

She is seeking a loan of $875 to buy more beans for preparing bean cakes (Akara). She learned this business from her mother. She has been a LAPO member for 4 years

loans.use: Buy more supplies to make Akara to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The foresight and insight of people who have never received any training in business management can be amazing. Stationery sales is a business where such wisdom is demonstrated, with most sellers strategically placing their shops, stalls, tables or bodies strategically near to post offices, banks, schools and universities.

Jane M. is no exception. In 2006 she established a business selling stationery, which continues to provide her with a steady income. She now requires a loan of $275 to purchase additional stock, such as paper, envelopes, tape, pens and papers.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback."

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of stationery

loans.name: Gualberta

texts.es:
Doña Gualberta is 36 years old, her activity is craftwork producing accessories for clothing and she also has a grocery store at her home. Her family consists of the parents and 4 children, the older daughter works while she is on vacation. Gualberta keeps her mini workshop in her bedroom where she has been manufacturing the fabrics which later are turned into wallets, bags, and purses for the past 4 years.

Gualberta is a partner of a group of craftswomen and they work sales taking shifts as guests at craftwork fairs. In her activity area there are three groups of partners, this specific group is very united and therefore more competitive as they cover a larger group of clients. The present application for a loan will be used to expand the variety of products offered at her grocery store which keeps in stock different kinds of merchandise at different prices and quality. Doña Gualberta’s credit history is very good as few late payments have been reported.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Gualberta es una señora de 36 años de edad que realiza artesanías de accesorios de prendas de vestir y también cuenta con una venta de abarrotes en su domicilio. Su familia consta de los 2 padres y 4 hijos, la hija mayor trabaja cuando está de vacaciones. Gualberta tiene su mini taller en su cuarto, allí realiza los tejidos que posteriormente los convierte en carteras, bolsones y monederos. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad alrededor de 4 años.

Gualberta es socia de un grupo artesanal de mujeres donde se realizan las ventas de forma intercalada, son invitadas a ferias para este efecto, en su área de actividad existen tres grupos de socias, este grupo es bastante unido y es así que pueden competir de mejor manera porque cubren a mayor parte de los demandantes por este tipo de productos. La presente solicitud es para ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su tienda de abarrotes, que tiene diferentes tipos de precios dependiendo del artículo y su calidad. El historial crediticio de Gualberta es muy bueno ya que mantiene niveles muy bajos de mora.

loans.use: Purchase more and varied merchandise for a general store.

loans.name: Mwasafari's Muungano Group

texts.en:
Mwasafari is 40 years old. She is a widow with one child, aged fifteen. She also takes care of two other children, ages seven and eight.

Mwasafari sells charcoal. She started her business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.00 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in which they sell charcoal or shoes and clothing.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for their business

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Sra. Estela M. A. is originally from the city of Bluefields. She's 38 years old and she's married to Sr. Antonio Ramirez. They have 5 young children. Sra M. is the owner of a small grocery store for more than 4 years. Her clientele consists of all the people in the neighborhood who like her store for all the variety of products it has.

At this time, she needs to purchase 2 kgs of rice which is $45 per kg, 2 kgs of sugar which is $36 per kg, 2 steel drums of cooking oil at $40 per drum, 2 big bags of toilet paper at $12 per bag, 2 boxes of laundry soap at $18 per box, 1 bale of salt at $7 per bale, 3 boxes of eggs at $4 per box, 25 lbs of cheese at $2 per lb., 15 lbs. of creme cheese at .80 cents per lb., 50 lbs of chicken at $1 a lb. and 2 baskets full of vegetables at $49 per basket.

With this purchase she will increase her inventory and satisfy demand which keeps increasing each day.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Estela M. A. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 38 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Antonio Ramírez ambos tienen 5 hijos menores de edad. La Sra. M. es propietaria de una pulpería por mas de 4 años sus clientes son los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer variedad de productos, en estos momentos necesita comprar 2 quintales de arroz a $ 45. 00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 36.00 dólares el quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a $ 40.00 dólares el bidón, 2 bolsones de papel higiénico a $ 12.00 dólares el bolsón, 2 cajas de jabón de lavar ropa a $ 18.00 dólares la caja, 1 paca de sal a $ 7.00 dólares la paca, 3 cajillas de huevo a $ 4.00 dólares cada cajilla, 25 libras de queso a $ 2.00 dólares la libra, 15 libras de crema a $ 0.80 centavos dólar la libra, 50 libra de pollo a $ 1.00 dólar la libra y 2 canastas de verduras a $ 49.00 dólares la canasta con esta compra podrá aumentar su inventario y de esta manera podrá satisfacer su demanda que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, toilet paper, laundry soap, femenie hygiene products, salt, eggs, cheese, chickens and vegetables

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
I have had my optical business for 9 years selling lenses and giving vision tests. This business, in which my wife and I work, is the source of income for my family. I currently need a more modern chair for vision tests. For this reason I am requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a more current special vision test chair so that I can give a much better service to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 9 años con el negocio de la óptica vendo lentes y realizo examen de la vista. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia en trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Me esta haciendo falta un sillón mas moderno para ser la evaluación de la vista. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $ 1,000.00 dlls para la comprar de un sillón especial para las evaluaciones de la vista y más actualizado y así darles un servicio mucho mejor a mis clientes.

loans.use: Purchase a special optical chair

loans.name: Nayla Fiorela

texts.es:
Nayla is 21 years old. She is married and lives in the district of Florencia de Mora, in the provence of Trujillo. She completed her secondary schooling and has one small child. She sells china, as well as plastic and glassware from a small stall she rents in the market of Hermelinda. The income she earns helps with her household costs

Nayla began her business 3 years ago with her first loan, buying kettles, plates and napkins. With an invitation from her mother and several neighbors, she became a member of the communal bank "Unidas Para Un Futuro Mejor" or, United for a Better Future. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in more stock for her business.

Nayla hopes to have her own shop one day, instead of the rented space she currently uses, which is uncomfortable and poorly suited for her merchandise.

La señora Nayla tiene 21 años de edad, es casada vive en el Distrito de Florencia de Mora, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad; estudió hasta el cuarto de secundaria, tiene 01 hijo pequeño. Nayla se dedica a la venta de loza y de servicio en vidrio y plástico, por pedidos en el mercado La Hermelinda, en un pequeño puesto alquilado, con estos ingresos se ayuda para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Ella se inicio en este negocio hace 03 años y con el primer préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos, el año pasado el cual fue de S/.300. nuevos soles,compró servicio como platos, ollas, cubiertos, para surtir el puesto y hacer algunas entregas a pedidos La señora Nayla ingresa al Banco Comunal “Unidas Para Un Futuro Mejor ” por invitación de mamá y de algunas vecinas; Con el préstamo de S/.700.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invirtirá en la compra de servicio como ollas y cubiertos. Ella aspira tener un puesto propio ya que el que tiene es alquilado y muy incomodo para poder colocar la mercadería que tiene.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HER BUSINESS AND SAVE UP FOR HER OWN SHOP ONE DAY

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 32 years old, had a shop for repairing motorbikes. Yet, at that time, she did not have enough funding. As a result, her business did not go very well. In 2002, she joined the TYM Fund. At first, she borrowed 40 USD to invest in her repairing shop. After 8 years of membership, she now owns a large motorbike-repairing shop with lots of customers. Her husband is very experienced and dedicated to working at the shop. She also has to pay 100 USD/month for 2 workers to help with the shop. Her 2 children are going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 1025 USD to buy motorbike accessories. Her average income is 425 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị D. 32 tuổi, khi chưa tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị có cửa hàng sửa chữa xe máy, do thiếu vốn nên việc kinh doanh của gia đình chưa đạt nhiều hiệu quả. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ vòng vốn ban đầu gia đình chị xin vay 500.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng xe máy. Sau 8 năm tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn đến nay gia đình chị đã có cửa hiệu xe máy với quy mô lớn và tạo dựng được uy tín trong vùng, chồng chị là người có nhiều kinh nghiệm và có tinh thần phục vụ khách hàng tốt nên cửa hàng nhà chị rất đông khách vì vậy gia đình chị đã phải thuê 2 công nhân tay nghề giỏi với mức lương 1.500.000đ/ tháng, chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 17.000.000đ mua phụ tùng xe máy. Thu nhâp bình quân.7.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy motorbike accessories

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a 33-year-old widow who has three children ages 17, 16 and 10. In 2006, she went into business selling clothing. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70.

Deborah has applied for a loan to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mr. Phon S. is a 47 year old fisherman. He fishes at Tunle Sap Lake, earning about US$3.00 per day. His wife, Mrs. Y Seat is 50, and is a farmer, earning about US$1.60 per day. Phon has four children, one of whom is married. They live in Anglung Samnor Commune, Siem Reap Province. Phon is seeking a loan of US$375 to buy fishing equipment. The loan will improve his fishing business and increase their family's income. Phon's wife is pictured because Phon was unavailable.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Zahrojon

texts.en:
S. Zahrojon is 55 years old. She’s married with four children. 

The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life have made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 5 years, she and her husband (who appears in the photo) have been purchasing the young cattle in the local market, fattening them, and selling them. 

Mrs. Zahrojon is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and to educate her children, who are working adults, thanks to her example. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. Mrs. Zahrojon wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. 

Now she is requesting a loan of $600 USD for 9 months to buy calves to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change her life.

loans.use: To buy calves to raise.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama has owned a small shop in Zanzibar for two years. She sells a variety of goods including perfumes, bed sheets and small food items. She works every day from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. and is able to earn approximately $65 each month. With her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, Salama hopes to buy more inventory for her shop so that she can increase her profit.

Salama is 31 years old, divorced, and has three children, ages 5, 11 and 15.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her small shop.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La señora Clara pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Progreso ubicado en la Av. Sáenz Peña Nº 1109, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad y es madre soltera de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y 1 que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de comida. De lunes a viernes vende de 5 a.m. a 5 p.m. con la ayuda de su hija.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 8 kilos de arroz, 5 pollos, 4 kilos de carne, verduras, plátano, etc. 

Clara es una mujer que trabaja con mucho entusiasmo para darle una mejor educación a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clara is a member of the Communal Bank 'Mujeres del Progreso', located at Av. Sáenz Peña # 1109, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, in the region of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and is a single mother of 3 children; 2 are grown up and one is still dependent upon her. With the first loan of 300 Soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in clothing to sell. She has now been a member of the bank for five years. Now a days, she sells food from monday to friday, 5am to 5pm, with the help of her daughter. With this loan of $650 USD, which will be paid back in 5 months, she will purchase 8 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 4 kilos of beef, vegetables, banana, etc. Clara is a woman who works with a lot of enthusiasm in order to give a better education to her youngest son.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 8 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 4 kilos of beef, vegetables, banana, etc.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Doña Karla tiene 24 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años años de edad,  los dos los tiene estudiando la primaria en el colegio del barrio, su esposo se desempeña como pintor automotriz, y su negocio de ella es la venta de ropa desde hace cuatro años, inicio con prestamos en bancos comunales, y hasta ahora he salido adelante con mi negocio la dificultad es cuando esta malas las ventas, oh cuando me quedo con poco inventario, esta es mi cuarta solicitud en afodenic lo cual ha sido de gran beneficio para mi familia ya que hemos podido hacer mejoras a nuestra casa, con este préstamo voy a cambiar el techo que esta en mal estado. A futuro es poder tener una tienda grande de ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
Ms. Karla J. is a 24-year-old woman who lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Norte in the capital city of Managua. She has two children, ages 8 and 10, who both attend the neighborhood school. Her husband works in auto painting, and she has had a clothing business for four years. She started her business with loans from microfinance institutes, and up to now she has moved her business forward. The problem is when sales are down, or when she is left with only a small inventory. This is her fourth loan request with Afodenic, which has greatly benefited her family since that have been able to make home improvements. With this loan, she will replace the roof, which is in disrepair. In the future, she would like to have a big clothing and footwear store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to replace roof

loans.name: 07- Dong Son Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 7 consists of 5 poor women, all of whom live in the Dong Son ward, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Thanh is the lead borrower of the group. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children: a 19-year-old son who is studying physical education and a 14-year-old daughter who is at secondary school.

This is Mrs. Thanh's first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women ("FPW") and she will use it to buy the ingredients with which to make bun pho, a popular dish in northern Vietnam made with chicken, beef, or pork. She will sell the bun pho on the street outside her house. With the profits from her loan, Mrs. Thanh will pay her children's school fees and provide for her family.

The loan will be split equally among all 5 borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows:

* Mrs. Duy is borrowing 1,626,900 Vietnamese Dong (~ US$ 93) to buy various foods for her stall: onions, garlic, ginger, mushrooms, peanuts, sugar, sauce, etc.

* Mrs. Ty will use her share of the loan to buy beans to make tofu that she'll sell from her house.

* Mrs. Binh will use her share of the loan to buy lots of small items that she'll sell from the front room of her house: candy, cookies, beer, sugar, cigarettes, bread, and other such items.

* Mrs. Doai will buy 2 small pigs to raise that she will then re-sell.

loans.use: buying pork, beef, beans, rice to cook and sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: A sus cortos 19 años, Carlos se ha dada cuenta, que para forjarse un futuro mejor, tiene que trabajar arduamente, vive alquilado en un cuarto de manera independiente, puesto que ya no quiere ser una carga más para sus padres. Son ya 2 años vendiendo celulares, los que lleva Carlos. Esta actividad le a traído muchas satisfacciones, sobre todo el poder mantenerse por sí mismo, él disfruta de informar a sus clientes sobre los beneficios de los nuevos equipos celulares que adquiere, puesto que siempre está informándose sobre los nuevos modelos y su funcionamiento, Carlos tiene ya muchos contactos y por eso es siempre el vendedor que tiene los modelos de celulares más buscados del mercado. Carlos trabaja solo y lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo, es decirle a sus clientes que ya no tiene el equipo celular que están buscando. En un futuro próximo, desea incrementar la cantidad de equipos celulares que compra, para siempre tener su negocio lleno y poder tener un mejor ingreso económico. Carlos se encuentra en su primer préstamo y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, ya que al ser uno de los pocos varones en su banco comunal trata continuamente de ser responsable y respetuoso. Con el préstamo que solicita comprará nuevos y adecuados muebles (escritorios, asientos, etc), para atender mejor a sus clientes, muebles que tendrán un costo aproximado de 1000 nuevos soles, motivo por el cual Carlos aportará 300 nuevos soles de sus ahorros personales.
texts.en:
Young 19-year-old Carlos knows that in order to have a better future, he needs to work hard. He lives at a rented room alone, as he doesn’t want to be burden for his parents any longer. He’s been selling cell phones for 2 years. This activity had brought him many satisfactions, especially because it let him support himself. She enjoys helping his customers about new models and features. Carlos has many contacts, so he always offers the hottest cell phone models. He works alone, and the thing he enjoys the least about his work is to tell his customers he’s no longer selling the model they are looking for. In the near future, he would like to increase the amount of handsets he is buying right now, to have a full stock which will help him make a better income. This is Carlos’s first loan, and he hopes he would be able to make all payments in time. As he is one of the few male members of the bank, he is continually trying to be responsible and respectful. He will use this loan to purchase new and better furniture (desks, seats, etc), to provide his customers with a better service. Its approximate cost will be of 1000 new soles. He will also use 300 new soles out of his personal savings to pay for them.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new cell phones

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Ella es nuestra socia MARLENE HUAMÁN MARCOTA; nació en la comunidad de Urquillos de la provincia de Calca, del departamento de Cusco; ella tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 menores hijos de 5 y 3 años; ella comparte sus responsabilidades del hogar con diversas actividades, para poder darles a sus menores hijos una adecuada alimentación y una buena educación. 

Ella tiene como actividad principal la agricultura  y el comercio de animales menores; cultiva sus tierras con diversas variedades de verduras, entre las que tenemos(culantro, asnapa, perejil, repollo, coliflor, calabazas, maíz) y frutas (membrillo, peras y palta); Ella también cría animales menores, (cuyes, pollos, patos) hasta alcanzar la madures y la procreación de los mismos, para una posterior venta.

Ella agradece a los prestamistas, la ayuda otorgada y reitera su compromiso con ustedes, para seguir trabajando día a día y devolver el préstamo otorgado en el plazo determinado, ya que ella reconoce la falta de apoyo en estas zonas de otras bancas financieras.
texts.en:
Our member, Marlene Huamán Marcota, was born in Urquillos, in the Calca province of the department of Cusco. She is a 26-year-old, single mother of two children, ages 5 and 3 years old. She maintains her household responsibilities in a variety of ways so she can give her children enough nutrition and a good education. She mostly dedicates her time to agriculture and to the sale of young animals. She cultivates various types of fruits (quince, pears, and avocado) and vegetables (coriander, asnapa (an herb), parsley, cabbage, cauliflower, pumpkins, and corn) on her lands. She also raises young animals (guinea pigs, chickens, and ducks) until they reach maturity and can reproduce to then be sold at a later date. She is thankful for the loans and help offered, and reiterates her commitment to you to keep working day after day to pay back the loan in full since she recognizes the lack of this type of support from other local financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes para los terrenos y compra de animales menores.

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es: Teodolinda tiene 38 años, es casada hace 19 años y madre de un hijo que vive en su casa. El labrar la tierra y el cuidado de  sus cultivos son las vivencias diarias, esta actividad la realiza desde su infancia; ahora cultiva papas, alverjas, y últimamente está empezando con la floricultura con el apoyo de su esposo, debido a que notó que sus vecinos en este negocio les va muy bien. Por ello desde hace 3 años, para la siembra de flores, alquila chacras donde hayan sido cultivadas papas anteriormente, para aprovechar el abonado, y solo se preocupa del fumigado. De ese modo reduce costos de inversión y trata de acumular ganancias para sus otros productos con miras de progresar y convertirse en una agricultora de éxito. Es por ello que no se le puede ubicar fácilmente en su casa, por ser una mujer dinámica y emprendedora, siempre está en actividad. Teodolinda quiere comprar un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad, para que ella misma venda sus productos y gane mucho más que ahora. Teodolinda es secretaria de su banco comunal desde hace varios ciclos consecutivos, asimismo  apoya a su compañera tesorera en el cobro de las cuotas. Este es su 11vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes y semillas de arvejas para la siembra de esta campaña agrícola.
texts.en:
Teodolinda is 38 and has been married for 19 years. She has one son who lives in her home. Every day she works the land and takes care of her crops. She has done this work since her childhood. She grows potatoes, peas, and lately she has started growing flowers with the help of her husband since she noticed that her neighbors are doing well in this business. For 3 years, she has grown flowers. She rents plots of land where she had grown potatoes previously to take advantage of the fertile soil, and she only has to worry about fumigating. In this way, she reduces her investment costs and tries to save her proftis so she can make progress with her other porducts and be a successful farmer. She can't sit easily at home because she is a dynamic and enterprising woman and is always active. Teolinda wants to buy a stand in the market in the city so she can sell her products herself and gain a lot more than she does now. Teolinda has been the secretary of her communal bank for several consecutive cycles. She supports the treasurer in collecting their payments. This is her eleventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and in all this time she has demonstrated responsibility with her payments. The money she is requesting will go towards fertilizers and pea seeds to sow this season.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia M. is 63 and married with 8 children.  She has many years of experience in the pie and ice business. She sells to villagers and the public 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (166 USD).  SPBD loans are Malia’s only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to pay her children's school fees and to purchase timber and cement for home improvement.

loans.use: Help pay for children school fees and to buy cement and timber for home renovation.

loans.name: Gumersinda

texts.en:
Gumersinda M., 65, resides at Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City. Blessed with four children, they own a stall at the public market which is a big help to them. Through selling fish, Gumersinda was able to own a boarding house and accepts tenants/boarders as her additional source of income.

Being a member of Paglaum is a big opportunity for her family. She hopes to expand her business by owning another stall. Recently, she applied for PHP 7,000 to buy additional fish to sell.

Gumersinda never considers herself too old to strive for a better living. With her children and Paglaum MPC, she dreams of escalating her business and hopes that her children will have individual businesses in the future as well.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ludis Antonio

texts.es: El señor Ludís Antonio Gutiérrez , tiene la edad de 29 años, habita en el barrio Lomas del Gavilán en Ticuantepe , junto a su compañera de vida , la cual trabaja como comerciante , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo , dos hijos , una niña de siete años , que actualmente estudia , y una varón de tres años , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Ludís desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los planes hacia el cultivo es diversificarlo, él inicio esta actividad agrícola con sus propios esfuerzos . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para aplicar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ludis Antonio is 29 years old, and lives in the Lomas Gavilan neighborhood of Ticuantepe along with his wife. She works as a businesswoman in order to assist with the household expenses. They are responsible for their two children, a girl of 7 who is currently studying, and a boy of 3. The family plans to improve their living conditions. Mr. Gutiérrez has worked in agriculture for the past 20 years, and the major difficulty he has face in that time is the lack of financing. He plans to diversify his crops, and wants financing to purchase the necessary inputs and crop fertilizer to use on his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inputs and fertilizers to improve his crops.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.en:
The committee “The New Dawn” formed with the union of various neighbors from the city Villa Eliza. All of the participants of the committee develop their own independent activities, such as sales. The participants formed a very united group. They are capable of achieving their goals, as well as strengthen their partnership. 
All of the participants in the committee are mothers that dedicate themselves to various activities with the goal of strengthening the household economy and developing a way of sustainable business. 

1	Elsa C. - Ice cream sales 
2	Irma R. - Dressmaker 
3	Maria R. - Detergent sales 
4	Beatriz C. - Manicurist 
5	Marylina A. - Dressmaker 
6	Daniela Benitez - Convenience store 
7	Maria Graciela H. - General store
8	Lucinda R. - Dressmaker 
9	Maria Noemi C. - Fruit sales 
10	Adolfina C. - Coal sales 
11	Nelida V. O. - Beverage sales 
12	Margarita M. - Food sales 
13	Ursulina G. - Coal sales 
14	Luz Maria B. - Food sales 
15	Maria M. - Recycling and plastic sales 
16	Nidia S. - Hardware store 
17	Hermelinda B. - Beverage sales 
18	Adriana G. - Clothing sales 
19	Francisca C. -Clothing sales

loans.use: To invested in the small businesses of each one of the participants. Each participant invests according to the needs of her business. Purchases  such as fruits, vegetables, rice, coal, etc. Dressmakers invest  buying raw materials: threads, fabrics, needles, etc.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi G. est un conducteur de taxi moto. agé de 31 ans, il est marié et père d’un enfant. avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, kossi espère payer sa propre moto puisque celle qu’il conduit n’est pas de sa propriété. Cette aubaine lui permettra de mieux épargner pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi G. is a motorbike taxi driver. He is 31 years old, married, and the father of one child. With this initial FECECAV loan, he hopes to buy his own motorbike, since the one he drives isn't his. This great opportunity will enable him to save more money to support his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Peniel Grupo 4 Group

texts.en:
Zoraida N. is the coordinator of a group of five entrepreneurs. They are looking for their first loan to invest in their respective businesses. Zoraida owns a small salon and is looking to invest in her business by purchasing more hair products and making small improvements to her store. She decided to approach Kiva partner, Esperanza, because she has been working in the salon business for several years, but has never been able to grow her salon substantially. A loan from Esperanza will allow her to make capital improvements necessary for substantial growth.

Some of the improvements Zoraida needs for her salon include installing a fan and a door. A door and a fan seem very minor, but they represent major improvements for Zoraida’s salon. In the future, Zoraida would like to be able to hire several employees and have a large, modern salon.

Zoraida is happily married with two daughters and one son. Her daughters are aged 19 and 6, and her son is 22. Her son works at a water factory, while her eldest daughter is in college studying administration. Her youngest daughter just finished her first year of elementary school. Zoraida's family is very important to her, and she is taking a loan from Esperanza in the hope that her business investment will make her family’s life better.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and to make improvements to the salon

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja, quien es transportista de motocarro, y con sus 3 hijos, quienes están en edad escolar. Desde hace 8 años se dedica la venta de frutas regionales (naranjas, coconas, mandarinas, plátanos, etc.), negocio que acondiciona todos los días en las afueras de su casa. Gracias a esta actividad puede solventar los gastos de educación de sus hijos quienes se sienten muy orgullosos de tener una madre como ella. A Lizbeth le gusta su trabajo porque se siente útil ante la sociedad y porque se entretiene mucho conversando con sus clientes. Su deseo a futuro es poder crecer hasta el punto de tener un minimarket donde ofrezca toda clase de productos. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que puede confiar en el trabajo responsable de sus compañeros, y ellos confían en ella. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más frutas para implementar su negocio, también adquirirá madera para mandar a construir un kiosco donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is 32 years old and the mother of 3 school-aged children. She lives with her husband, who is a motorcar driver. For the past 8 years, she has been selling regional fruits (oranges, coconuts, tangerines, bananas, etc.). Her business is well-stocked every day outside of her home. Thanks to her sales, she can afford to educate her children, who are very proud to have a mother like her. Lizbeth enjoys her work because she feels useful to society and likes entertaining and talking with her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business to the point that she can convert it into a minimarket where she sells all types of products.

This is her 8th loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her communal bank group because the members are responsible and they have confidence in her. With the money she is requesting, she will buy more fruit for her business and also purchase wood to build a kiosk from which she can sell with greater ease.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory & build a kiosk

loans.name: Clemencia Benita

texts.es: Clemencia Benita S. Chavarría tiene la edad de 59 años. Es una madre soltera que lucha son sobrevivir con sus 2 hijos que tiene a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad que con mucho esfuerzo logro mantener. Ella recorre ciertas calles, todos los días tiene que tomar una ruta diferente que la traslade a los mercados, para ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante, Clemencia ocupa un cuaderno en donde registra a sus clientes y todos los días cobra el dinero ya sea de perfumes, pantalones, camisas, ropa interior y sandalias. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de mercadería en general. Su mayor sueño es que su hija vuelva a estudiar ya que no tiene los suficientes ingresos para ayudarle.
texts.en:
Clemencia Benita S. Chavarría is 59 years old and a single mother who fights to survive with her 2 children for whom she cares. The economic activity to which she dedicates herself is the sale of general goods. For more than 4 years she has been dedicated to this work that she has succeeded in maintaining with much effort. She walks along certain streets, every day taking a different route that moves towards the markets, to sell her products in ambulatory fashion. Clemencia has a notebook in which she registers her clients and every day day charges them money from perfumes, pants, shirts, underwear and sandals. The loan that she requests is for working capital which would be used for buying general merchandise. Her biggest dream is that her daughter return to school now that she does not have enough income to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 41 years old and is married with four children.  Laura and her husband run a discotheque called “Pili’s.”  Laura also has a business selling cooked foods typical of the region in front of her home in the evenings. Laura’s husband is an environmental engineer specializing in forestry. Laura helped pay for him to get his degree. Because he could not find work in his chosen field, Laura’s husband now dedicates himself full time to running the bar/discotheque that the family owns next door to their home.

Laura has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for ten years and is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de la Natividad.”  She plans to invest this loan of 2,000 soles in her family’s discotheque as well as in her food sales business.  

Laura’s goal is to eventually have her own restaurant offering typical regional dishes.

loans.use: Products for a small home-based restaurant business; drinks and other items to sell at a discoteque.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vegetables like cabbage, tomatoes, onions, and peppers for resale at the community market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 54 años, es viudo y vive solo en su pueblo natal. Tiene 40 años de experiencia en las tareas agrícolas, esto le ha servido para sostener a su familia durante todo estos años y sus hijos ahora se encuentran viviendo en la ciudad debido a sus estudios. Pero cuando llega la época de siembra o cosecha, toda la familia se reúne para realizar las labores que demandan estas temporadas. Félix está muy satisfecho con lo que hasta ahora ha logrado a través de la agricultura, por lo que desea seguir trabajando en sus tierras hasta donde le alcancen las fuerzas, menciona.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, él se siente muy comprometido con su banco comunal para realizar un trabajo solidario. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono para su próxima siembra de papa y maíz.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Asmita

texts.en:
Mrs. Asmita L. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Asmita L. has six members in her family including herself. She lives in a joint family home with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband, and two children. She has one son and one daughter. Both children are studying in primary school.

Both Mrs. L. and her husband, Mr. Durga Raj, are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Due to the hilly region, they face lots of problems in their agricultural farming. Mrs. L. is requesting, for the first time, a loan of 10000 NPR to buy fertilizer and seeds for their agricultural farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: Z. Céline est née en 1965 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Céline est mariée à HEBE Phillippe, un jardinier. Le couple a quatre enfants dont deux sont à leur charge. Tous les enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. Céline vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Céline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Les charges de la famille sont supportées ensemble par Céline et Phillippe. Céline n'a jamais fréquenté ; c'est pourquoi depuis une vingtaine d'année, Céline mène comme activité, la vente de divers (savons, insecticides, oeufs, papiers mouchoir, arachide, galettes d'arachide, farine de manioc, etc.) ainsi que la vente de "sodabi" (boisson alcoolisée locale) à son domicile. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d'agrandir davantage son activité et de mieux faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle, Céline sollicite à nouveau un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Céline Z. was born in Ouidah, an historical town in Benin, in 1965. Céline is married to Philippe HEBE, a gardener. The couple has four children, two of whom they have to support. Not all children attend school. Céline has been living for about twenty years in the Gbégamey neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She lives with her children and her husband, and they both support the family. Céline never attended school and for about twenty years, she's been selling various items (soaps, insecticides, eggs, tissues, peanuts, peanut cookies, cassava flour, etc) as well as "sodabi" (local alcoholic beverage) at her house. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who repays her loans without problems. In order to expand her business and better meet customer demand, Céline is seeking her third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs by the tray, soaps, cassava flour, insecticides, etc

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
L. Mendbayar is 39 years old and lives with her two daughters in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her children live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest daughter is 19 years old and in college, and her youngest, age 10, attends a local secondary school. Mendbayar operates a meat trading business out of a rented stall at a local market in her town. She started her business in 2002 and has made much progress over the years. This past year she expanded her business by purchasing a field and growing her own vegetables to sell.  It was a good year as she harvested over 400 kg of potatoes, 200 kg of beets, and 300 kg of cabbage. Mendbayar hopes to build on her recent success and expand her business further. She hopes to build a small grocery shop for her products in teh near future. Her business is very important to her and she says, "All I want is to support my children's education and to own my own grocery shop." She is requesting a 560,000 tugrug (~394 USD) loan to purchase meat for her business.



About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

loans.use: To purchase raw meat for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cases of goods to increase profit

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma P. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Gemma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma sells fish in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide the basic needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Dương Thị's Group
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Pedro Moises

texts.es:
Moises tiene 55 años, es casado y tiene 9 nuevos hijos. Moisés pertenece al banco comunal “Las hijas de Maria” de la Asociación Arariwa.
Moisés se dedica a la producción de artesanía, el nos cuenta que hace escultura de la cultura Inka y pre Inka en miniaturas con piedra serpentina por ejemplo hace replica de la ciudad Machu Picchu. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más material como la piedra serpentina que lo trae de la ciudad de aguas calientes y así esta forma ayudar a su familia. (La ciudad de Aguas Calientes esta ubicado a 110 kilómetros del Cusco).  
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Moises is 55 years old, married, and has nine children. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Hijas de Maria” (The Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

Moises works as an artisan. He produces miniature sculptures out of serpentine stone that reflect Incan and pre-Incan culture. For example, he made a replica of the city of Machu Picchu. Moises has been making these handicrafts for 25 years and has done very well because of his commitment to his business. He is requesting a loan to purchase more materials, such as serpentine stone, which he brings in from the city of Aguas Calientes. This will help him support his family. (The city of Aguas Calientes is located 110 km from the city of Cusco.)

Moises is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase serpentine stone for making miniature sculptures

loans.name: Morris Albert

texts.en:
Morris Albert C. is from the city of Guinsiliban in Camiguin Province. He is 27 years old. Morris Albert is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Morris Albert owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where he sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Morris Albert has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Morris Albert joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Morris Albert is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand his business. This will be Morris Albert's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Hakimali

texts.ru: Рахматов Хакимали проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 54 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. У него средне- специальное образование по професси "Повар". Работает на рынке в своем районе. Имеет небольшую столовую. Работа приност доход, это дает возможность обеспечивать семью. Ему необходимо взять в аренду новое помещение и закупить муки. Поэтому он берет кредит. Это пожет ему улучшить качество обслуживания и сахранить цены на предлагаемую продукцию, так как цены на сырье растут.
texts.en:
Hakimali R. lives in the Khuroson District of Tajikistan. He is 54 years old and married with five children. He has vocational training as a cook. He works in a market in his neighborhood where he has a small dining hall. This work brings in the income which enables him to provide for his family. Hakimali needs to rent a new building and purchase flour; therefore, he is requesting a loan. This will help him improve the quality of his services and maintain production levels as the cost of raw materials rises.

Translated from Russian by Amanda Ross, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent additional space and purchase flour

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Rene Antonio López G., trabaja para un centro turístico desempeñando el cargo de guarda de seguridad, es padre de cuatro hijos todos en edad escolar,  tiene mas de cinco años de desempeñar dicha función, los créditos que ha solicitado con la institución han sido   para mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rene Antonio López G. works for a tourism company, fulfilling the duties of security guard. He is the father of four children, all of school age. He has been working as a security guard for more than five years. The loan he is seeking is for improvements in his house. It will be used to buy iron, cement, steel roofing, stone, and to pay for labor.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials and labor

loans.name: Abidemi

texts.en:
Abidemi sews and sells cotton blinds, and also sells window blind materials. She has been in this trade for two years. She also has a shop where she sells frozen food items. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase window blinds in bulk from the factory, which she says will reduce transportation costs to the market and increase her profits.  She will be able to serve her clients better and take better care of her family.

Abidemi is 30years old, married and has a child. The family lives in Lagos state. Abidemi says thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase window blinds

loans.name: Rusana

texts.en:
Rusana T. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old. Rusana is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rusana owns & operates a business buying and selling agricultural crops like copra and banana in the local community. Rusana has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rusana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Rusana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase more bananas to sell. Rusana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rusana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Derick

texts.en:
Derick is 24 years old and sells clothing (dresses, jeans, trousers, pullovers) primarily for youth (school-going children) and other local customers. His shop is in a busy market center and he manages it himself. Prior to starting this business, Derick was in school. Outside of this business, Derick's family grows vegetables and maize.

Derick plans to use the loan of 40,000 KES to purchase additional clothing inventory and supplies for his shop (dresses, jeans, trousers, bags, and boxes for school-aged children). Derick has successfully repaid one previous loan of 20,000 KES.

He hopes one day to purchase a car for personal use and a plot of land so that he can build a home. In 5 years, Derick hopes to be a wholesaler of new clothing in his town. He also hopes to open up many shops in the region and, not only specialize in new clothes, but also open a boutique. He describes himself as hard-working, strict, and generous.

loans.use: To purchase dresses, trousers, and jeans to sell for school-age children.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastian S. de 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, así mismo vive junto a sus tres hijos de 18, 16 y 11 años de edad, quienes son muy buenos estudiantes. Sebastian posee una granja en la cual cría cerdos y vacas, las cuales posteriormente vende con diferentes clientes. Desde hace 20 años que se dedica a este trabajo, el cual fue un oficio enseñado y heredado por sus padres, así mismo la granja esta ubicada en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual también habita junto a su familia. Sebastian solicita un préstamo para comprar alimentos y vitaminas para su ganado porcino y su ganado vacuno, así mismo desea poder comprar mayor cantidad de vacas y cerdos, ya que gracias a todos sus años de experiencia, Sebastian posee muchos clientes los cuales lo prefieren a él por la excelente calidad de sus animales. Para Sebastian  es de mucha importancia el poder mejorar el estado de su negocio, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta, es por ello que por medio del préstamo hecho a Integral, espera poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sebastian is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children, ages 18, 16, and 11. They are all good students. Sebastian has a farm where he raises hogs and cattle which he sells to different clients. He has been doing this for 20 years and he learned from his parents. The farm is located in the La Libertad department. His family lives there as well. He is asking for this loan in order to buy feed and vitamins for his livestock. He would also like to buy more hogs and cattle. Sebastian has lots of customers who prefer him because of the excellent quality of his animals. It is very important to Sebastian to be able to improve his business, as it is his family’s only source of income. With the help of this loan through Integral, he hopes to improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Desde antes de cumplir la mayoría de edad Julio Cesar L.  sabia  ya de negocios, pues en su familia no hay uno de la familia que no trabaje en ello, asì su mamá tiene un salón de belleza, su padre vende mercancías y lo mismo sus hermanas y tias;  Julio Cesar en un  principio ayudaba a su madre en todo los negocios que tuvo, pero ahora montó el suyo propio : un servicio de llamadas telefónicas el cual ubicó  justo a la salida del local donde su madre  tiene su salón de belleza, en una de las vías más transitadas de barrio simón Bolívar al sur de Barranquilla;  con su negocio no depende de su madre, paga la mensualidad de sus estudios como auxiliar de servicios farmacéuticos  y puede hacer una vida socia con su novia sana y placentera,  sin convertirse en una carga económica para la familia.

En este año ha recibido de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo 2 préstamos,  en este último ha solicitado un monto de $ 1.300.000 COP, que lo invertirá en modernizar  equipos de celulares y dotar su negocio de carcazas protectores y accesorios para la venta. Su sueño agregar a este su propia droguería, porque en 6 meses será un auxiliar de servicios farmacéuticos y con eso  terminará de cumplir  con todos los requisitos legales para hacerlo, por eso se esfuerza como un estudiante trabajador  para poder cumplir su sueño.

Su gran desafío es hacer unas prácticas profesionales de excelencia y responderle  a su familia por todo el apoyo que le brindan su madre, su hermana y su tía en su negocio, especialmente cuando debe ausentarse por efecto de sus estudios. Julio Cesar es un joven  que a sus 21 años tiene mucha madurez y es un excelente miembro de familia.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar L. knew about business since before he became an adult, since there is not one person in his family who doesn’t work. His mother has a beauty salon, his father sells merchandise, as do his sisters and aunts. At first, Julio Cesar helped his mother with all her businesses. However, he now has his own enterprise: a phone call service that he located on a street near his mother’s beauty salon entrance. It is in the busy Simón Bolívar neighborhood, just south of Barranquilla. His business allows him to pay for his own expenses to become a pharmacist, and not have to depend on his mother for his education. This affords him the opportunity to live a healthy and pleasant social life with his girlfriend, without being a financial burden on his family. This year, he has received 2 loans from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. Currently, he is requesting 1,300,000 Colombian pesos to invest in modernizing his cellular equipment and to supply his business with phone covers and other supplies to sell. His dream is to also have his own pharmacy, since in 6 months he will have attained all the legal requirements to be a pharmacist. For these reasons, he puts forth a great effort as a hard-working student to complete his goal. His great challenge is to practice excellent professionalism, so that he can return all the support that his family has provided. His mother, sister and aunt have especially helped him out, particularly when he’s had to be absent in order to complete his studies. Julio Cesar is a 21-year old young man who is very mature and an excellent member of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phone equipment, and to supply his business with phone covers and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine L. is currently in the business of selling fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell.  Christine is 31 years old and is married to a policeman. She has two children and they both go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Flor Aracely

texts.es:
Flor Aracely M. G. tiene 27 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. No tiene  hijos.
 
Flor  es un socia de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Flor se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en las misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener dinero para comprar un pequeño terreno. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas patronales en el mes de Noviembre y realizar juegos deportivos.
texts.en:
Flor Aracely Marín Guamán, 27, is single and lives in Chillanes canton in Recinto San José, Estero Salado parish. She has no children. Flor is a member of the Fronteras Unidas (United Frontiers) communal bank located fifteen minutes from Estero Salado parish, two hours from the Chillanes agency. It has 19 members who are farmers. Flor farms cacao. She makes her purchases in Matilde Esther monthly and does her sales there too. She is asking for funding to buy cacao to plant and increase her business. She feels that the loan is a good way to get ahead. Her dream is to have money to buy a small plot of land. The challenge she faces is during harvest because the rains damaged the access roads. She enjoys celebrating the patron saint day festivities in November and to play sports.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cacao to plant.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 44 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar y trabaja en su propio negocio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa y cada cierto tiempo la socia arregla y aumenta mercadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y así implementar su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the "Choquequirao" community bank; she lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. The partner is Miss Alejandrina; she is 44, lives with her partner and has 2 children. She does housework and works in her own business. She has a small grocery store in her home and at fixed times she organizes and purchases merchandise. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of merchandise with which to expand her business. She infinitely appreciates and values this loan since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She also promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz es una madre D. familia D. 50 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo en el caserío Pueblo Nuevo Tejedores del distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., la zona se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas para exportación, el distrito pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta D. golosinas y D. diversos artículos en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, ella se vale D. este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, además la hace sentirse activa y util, sus principales clientes son los niños y jóvenes D. la zona, ella trata D. brindarles productos D. buena calidad para poder mantener su negocio, durante el tiempo que lleva en el negocio se ha hecho conocida por la zona.

Luz desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas productos, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Luz es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y entregada a su hogar. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para mejorar gradualmente la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is a mother, is 50 years old, and lives with her husband in the farmhouse Pueblo Nuevo Tejedores of the TambogranD. district. The area is mainly characterized by producing fruits for exporting. The district belongs to the Piura province and is located on the region of the same name which is more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She sells sweets and various items in a shop installed in her home. She cares about this business to help her husband with family expenditures. In addition it makes her feel active and useful. Her main clients are children and young women and men from the area. She tries to keep their business by offering them high quality products . During the time she has been running her business she is well known in the area.

Luz wants to expand her business by adding more products. To achieve her goal she found it convenient to request her first loan to Edpyme Alternativa; she request a 500 Peruvian Soles loan to carry out her goal.

Luz is a hardworking woman, aspiring, and devoted to her home. Her biggest wish is to continue working to gradually improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more sweets to increase her sales.

loans.name: Djanali

texts.ru:
Djanali G. 51 qod. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey , doch kotoroy 20 let ona uchitsya v universitete i rabotayet uchitlenicey v detskom sadu, sin 18 let v etom qodu postupil v universitet. Djanali i eqo semya jivut v  Fuzuli regione. 

Uje 8 let kak Djanali zanimayetsya prodajey tovarov dlya upotrebleniya v remonte .Etomu biznesu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo druqa. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviy tovar ( krani,shnuri,trubi i t.d).
texts.en:
Djanali G., 51, is married and has 2 children. His daughter is 20. She is a college student and a day care teacher. Mr. G.'s son is 18. He entered college this year. The G. family lives in Fuzili region. For 8 years, Djanali G. has been selling plumbing supplies and other household items. This loan Mr. G. will use to purchase new inventory for his store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: To make a living, Erlinda F. runs a general store selling a variety of different products like sardines, Milo, biscuits and coffee in her community. She is 61 years old, married and has one adult child. She is from the municipality of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Erlinda has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2005, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Ana Lenis

texts.es: La Joven Ana Lenis de 22 años es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Ana se dedica hace 3 años a la venta de ropa. Ella realiza las ventas de ropa nueva y usada, por lo que busca la forma de generar ingresos para su familia, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, la mayoría de sus clientes son de las orillas del mercado. Por lo que sale todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche  Ana requiere el crédito para capital de trabajo. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable para poder darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana Lenis, 22, is a young, single mother of a son who is in her care.  For the last three years she has sold clothes.  She sells both new and used clothing to generate income for her family.  She sells her wares in an itinerant manner along the outside margins of the local market.  She goes out daily from 7am until 8 pm.

She needs the loan for working capital.  Her dream is to have a stable business in order to provide her son with a good education.

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esperanza está conformado por  Josefa Jarquín, Ana Chávez y Elizabeth Aragón tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Josefa de 41 años  quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, perfumes y gaseosa desde hace un año. Ella tiene cinco hijos de los cuales los tres menores están a su cargo.
