Las otras integrantes son Ana Chávez 40 años vende ropa (camisas, pantalones, blusas) y cosméticos (lápiz labial, delineadores, sombras, marbellí, rubor, polvo compacto, cremas…etc.) desde el 2002 su meta es tener un negocio surtido y Elizabeth Aragón Blandino venta de ropa (camisas, pantalones, blusas) desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza” (Hope) group’s members are: Josefa Jarquín, Ana Chávez & Elizabeth Aragón, three hard working, dedicated, enterprising women.

The group coordinator is Josefa, 41, who has sold clothes, perfumes and soft drinks for the last year.  She has five children, three of whom are still minor and in her care.

The other members are Ana Chávez, 40, who has sold clothes (t-shirts, pants and blouses) and cosmetics (lipstick, eye liner, eye shadow, Marbella brand items, rouge, compact powder, creams, etc.) since 2002; her goal is to have a better stocked business and, Elizabeth Aragón Blandino, who has sold clothes (shirts, pants, blouses) for the past five years.

loans.use: For clothes, perfumes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Mirta forma parte del banco comunal “Creación”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Chillán. Ella tiene una cordonería, bazar y paquetería, en donde también ofrece sus servicios de encintados (recuerdos de ceremonias como bautizos, matrimonios, etc). Este local lo arrienda hace 4 años y está ubicado en la galería “La Merced” a 7 cuadras de su casa. 
Con este préstamo comprará cintas, adornos para los recuerdos, blondas y tarjetas de navidad. Mirta tiene un hijo de 13 años, a quien ha logrado mantener con su negocio, como único aporte económico de su hogar. Su meta es comprar un local, ya que según sus cálculos es más conveniente que arrendar. 
Para Mirta Fondo Esperanza ha sido de gran ayuda, tanto económica como de orientación sobre cómo administrar mejor su negocio. Además también le es muy grato compartir con sus compañeros de grupo y su asesora.
 Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “Silla del Sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en esta tierra han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
Mirta is a member of the “Creación” community bank which is located in the city of Chillán.  She has a store where she sells embroidery, knitting and sewing supplies, stationery and small goods.  She also offers party favor services (mementos for ceremonies such as christenings and weddings).  She has been renting her premises for 4 years in “La Merced” shopping arcade which is 7 blocks from her house.

With this loan she will buy ribbons, trimmings for the party favors, lace and Christmas cards.  Mirta has a 13 year-old son who she has managed to support with her business as it is the only financial support for her household.  Her goal is to buy her own premises since, according to her calculations, it will be more profitable than renting.

Fondo Esperanza has been a great help to Mirta both financially and in providing advice on how to run her business better.  In addition, she is enjoys meeting with her fellow group members and her advisor.

Chillán is a district in the 'centro sur' (south central) region of Chile.  The name means “Silla del Sol” (Sun's Chair) in Mapudungun, the language of the Mapuche, our indigenous inhabitants.  Chillán is known as “Cuna de la Patria” (Birthplace of the Nation) or “Tierra de Artistas” (Land of Artists) owing to the fact that it is the birthplace of a number of prominent characters in Chile's history such as, for example, the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: To buy ribbons, lace, decorations and cards

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS HIJOS DE QOLQUEWASI ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doris; La socia tiene 50 años de edad, el es divorciado y tiene 1 hijos, la socia tiene un pequeño bazar ella vende todo tipo de productos desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde; la socia vende regalos, ella ofrece desde cofres para guardar aretes y joyería, hasta peluches, muñecas, adornos y mucho mas. La socia invertirá su dinero en la compra de mercadería, ella comprara regalos y adornos para la época navideña.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar regalos y adornos para la época navideña. 

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Doris is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Hijos de Qolquewasi” (The Children of Qolquewasi), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 50 years old, divorced, and has one child. Doris manages a small bazaar where she sells all types of products between the hours of 8am and 6pm. She sells gifts which include jewelry boxes for storing earrings and other keepsakes to stuffed toys, dolls, decorations, and many other items. Doris wants to invest in the purchase of merchandise for the holiday season, so she will use the proceeds from the loan she requested to buy gifts and decorations.

She appreciates and values the loan that is being provided to her, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase gifts & decorations for the holiday season

loans.name: Angelica Del Socorro

texts.es: Angélica Del Socorro tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta de comida y ropa. Es una mujer muy responsable que disfruta de su negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante. Ella aprendió este medio con algunos ahorros que tenía y es así que ido creciendo al ver que este tipo de actividad era rentable comenzó a comprar ciertos productos de ropa. Angélica es una persona muy responsable y se encuentra contenta con su actividad. el motivo del financiamiento es para materia prima de su negocio.
texts.en: Angélica Del Socorro is 38 years old and makes a living selling food and clothing.  She is a responsible woman that enjoys her work and is always looking for a way to get ahead.  She started this with some money that she had saved and has been growing the business ever since.   Upon seeing that this type of activity was profitable she started buying certain articles of clothing.  Angélica is a very responsible person and feels happy with her business.  The purpose of the loan is to acquire raw materials for her business.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y uno de sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 40 años de experiencia en la agricultura, en donde siembra papa y maíz en terrenos que posee, sus hijos y su esposo trabajan activamente en esto, por otro lado se dedica también a la crianza de cuyes, vacas, cerdos y ovejas. Le agrada trabajar en esta tarea, aunque reconozca que muchas veces es muy sacrificado, pero la ganancias que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha, podrá recuperar la inversión; asimismo lo que produce le servirá para su propio consumo. Es por esta razón que desea  continuar con esta tarea y aumentar su productividad. Es el crédito número 15 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de más sacos de abono y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old.  She lives with her husband and one of her four children in her own home.  She has 40 years worth of experience in farming.  She grows potatoes and corn on land which she owns.  Her children and her husband also actively work in this activity.

In addition, Rosa raises guinea pigs, cows, pigs and sheep. She likes this work although she recognizes that it is often very sacrificing.  However, the profits that she makes when she sells her harvest mean that she is able to recover her investment.  She also uses some of her produce for her own consumption.  For this reason, she would like to continue in her work and increase her productivity.

This is Rosa's 15th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being part of her community bank because all its members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She would like to thank the people who will make her loan possible since it will be very useful for the progress of her business.  She will invest her loan in buying more sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 40 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y sus padres en casa de sus progenitores. Tiene más de 15 años de experiencia en la venta de cosméticos, productos que son ofrecidos a sus amistades y familiares, y con el apoyo de los catálogos sus clientes puede saber que tipo de producto es lo que desean comprar. Se siente muy satisfecha de lograr sus metas y recibir incentivos de parte de la empresa que le provee su mercadería, además  este negocio le permite ofrecer ofertas y promociones a su público consumidor a fin de que sean fieles en sus compras. Es por eso que Marlene ve con futuro su negocio y se proyecta  para los próximos años aumentar su mercancía y tener una tienda de cosméticos. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Marlene is 40 years old, lives with her two children and her parents in her parent’s home. She has been selling cosmetics for more than 15 years; products that are offered to friends and family, and with the help of catalogues her clients can know what types of products they wish to buy. She is very satisfied in meeting her goals and she receives incentives from the business that provides her merchandise. In addition this business allows her to be able to offer discounts and promotions to her customers so that they continue to make purchases. It is for this reason that Marlene sees her business continue in the future and she expects to increase her merchandise in the upcoming years and have a cosmetics store. This is her first loan with MFP; she is very happy to know that she has financial support. In addition she likes being part of the communal bank because all its members are people who she knows, are responsible, and very united. She thanks everyone who will be supporters of the loan that she seeks as it will be very useful in continuing her business. With the loan she seeks she will invest in buying beauty products to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: Buy more beauty products in order to meet her customer demand

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: "Margie is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating one business venture: tailoring .Her husband Eric, who is 44 years old, works as a Government employee to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 19 and 20 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help in the business. Margie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Margie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000, which she intends to buy tailoring materials so that she could continue to save up for future home repairs and education of her children. Margie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en: Mrs. Chroeb U. lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. Born in 1970, she is married to Mr. Tet Mea, and has three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, and the youngest one is a farmer. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She also sells Khmer cakes. Her husband is a construction worker. In the rice field, she has the problem of infertile soil so is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide, and have her rice field plowed.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide, and plow her rice field

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is Van T., age 45, who lives in the province of Kompong Cham, the best territory for farming. Van T. is a married woman who is devoted to her five single children. Two of her children are working at different occupations and sharing the responsibility for earning daily revenue with Van T.. 

Van T. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. For additional income, Van T. wishes to plant a peanut crop, but she doesn’t have enough capital to do it yet. Therefore, Van T. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers and peanut seed for planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and peanut seed for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing wood and charcoal to resell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes K. lives in the Mpewo Valley neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she owns, but does not have access to electricity or to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are treatment for illness and school fees.

Agnes has a restaurant where she sells fresh food as well as raw plantains. She has been in this business for five years, and works 6 days a week. She sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy plantains, cassava, rice and beef. The main business challenges for Agnes are changing prices and transport. Her goal is to buy her own plot of land for work.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, beef, cassava and rice

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia C. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Patricia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Patricia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fruit like oranges, pineapples, apples & also selling beauty soaps & products in the local community. Patricia has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Patricia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Patricia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fruits like watermelons & guavas. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Patricia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits like watermelons & guavas.

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel E. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 38 years old and married, with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Marifel runs a general store where she sells food and products for daily use. Marifel has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marifel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marifel has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marifel is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be also used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Marifel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vergilia

texts.en:
Vergilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 20 years. Vergilia also earns income from selling vegetables.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

Vergilila is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to purchase materials needed to repair her fishing boat.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: purchase materials needed to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Flory

texts.en:
Flory, 39, is married, with six children. Four of her children are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Flory has a food stall business in the Philippines. Flory requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.
Flory has been in this business for 8 years.  In the future, Flory would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 46-year-old married woman with four children.  Her oldest child is 21 years old.

Lourdes is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses.  She grows rice and corn on her land.  She also raises pigs in her backyard.  Lourdes sells her harvest and fattened pigs at her town's market.

The requested loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, pig feed and vitamins.  Lourdes hopes to improve her skills in managing her farm and piggery. She wants to increase her earnings and save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 43 year old, married man with 3 children. He earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. James is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase of fertilizers and pesticides for his rice farm.

James has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport operator. He is working tirelessly towards the attainment of his dream: to build and expand his business in order to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizers and pesticides for his rice farm.

loans.name: Cerrito Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Cerrito, se conformo gracias a su presidenta, la Sra Antolina, ella se informó del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 10º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Es un excelente grupo, gracias al  trabajo solidario realizado continuan trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
La Sra Antolina se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, desde muy pequeña, gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, logro aprender este oficio y hoy en día esto ya le sirve de sustento no solo a ella sino a toda su familia.
Ella olicita el credito para la compra de los elementos que utilizaran para sus artesanias, es decir, todo aquello indispensable para la realizacion de sus obras como telas, pinturas, agujas y demás.
Esta segura que con la ayuda que le podra brindar la Fundacion Paraguaya podrá seguir con sus tareas e ir sumando clientes y aumentar sus ingresos, para poder tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
The “Cerrito” (Little Hill) women’s committee was formed on 24 March 2008 thanks to Antoliana who sells crafts and contacted the advisor who had a group in the same zone.  She learned about the Enterprising Women’s Committee Program and managed to get 17 women together who are working comfortably in their 10th cycle now together and unified within the program. It is an excellent group; thanks to the supportive work they do they continue working with the program to date.

Since she was a little girl, Sra. Antolina has worked making artisinal crafts. Thanks to the training her mother gave her, she succeeded in learning this trade and today her income supports not only her but her entire family. She is asking for the loan to buy the supplies she need for their crafts, that is, everything indispensible for her work such as fabric, needles, and paints.

They are sure that with help from Fundación Paraguaya they will be able to continue with their tasks, add customers and increase income to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, needles, and paints

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, who is 44 and married to a farmer, has five children, two of whom are still studying. Another is married, while the other two help their parents maintain the farm. Teresita is able to earn about PHP20000 per cropping, profits that enable her to sustain her children and allowed for her recent purchase of some kitchen supplies.

Teresita, who has been growing rice for 21 years, is requesting a loan of PHP15000 to buy fertilizer and seeds, purchases which will be very helpful in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: María Erminda

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 11 y 10 años de edad, el mayor de edad este año termino sus estudios en el colegio y espera ingresar en la universidad, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo tiene un taller donde fabrica muebles.

Ella es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo, nos cuenta que lo que más elaboran son camas las mismas que elaboran bajo pedido que le realizan los clientes. Trabaja de lunes a viernes y su hijo mayor le ayuda en su negocio, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que él lleva más de 10 años en su negocio y que le va muy bien y gracias a Dios nunca le falta trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar madera, pega y clavos para elaborar las camas. Lleva 10 años en el banco  comunal y le gusta ya que con el primer crédito su esposo empezó con su taller el mismo que les ha servido para el sustento de su familia.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que no le falte trabajo a su esposo.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. María. She is 38 years old, married, and has three children (ages 18, 11, and 10). The oldest child is finishing the last year of high school and hopes to enter the university. The younger children are also enrolled in school. Her husband has a workshop where he makes furniture.

María is a good wife and is taking out a loan for her husband’s business. She says that the products he manufactures most are beds since they are often requested by his customers. He works Monday through Friday and her oldest son also helps with the business. María says that he has been in business for more than 10 years and has done very well thanks to God always providing work.

This loan will be used to buy wood, glue, and nails for making beds. María has been with the Communal Bank for 10 years. She enjoys being a member because the first loan she received was used to start her husband’s business, which has allowed them to sustain their family. Her dreams are to move forward and to hope that her husband is never without work.

loans.use: to purchase wood, glue, and nails for her husband's business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 35-year-old mother who has two school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been in this business for almost 15 years. 
Luzviminda is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides needed for good rice production. Luzviminda hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn a higher income. Currently, she earns 8,000 PHP each month in this field of work. She is thankful that Kiva lenders offer financial assistance to sustain crop production.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: For the last year, Visitacion has made a living by running a bakery where she makes many different kinds of bread and pastries. She is 44 years old, married, has three children and lives in the town of Ilagan. Visitacion has lots of experience in her line of work and is well known in her area. She is applying for a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy flour, baking soda and sugar. Her goal is to increase her income to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking soda and sugar for her bakery.

loans.name: Eskimo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Eskimo conformado por tres personas trabajadora y emprendedoras una de ellas es Marisela de los Ángeles ella tiene una panadería desde hace 8 años la cual poco a poco ha ido creciendo logrando tener una ventas mensuales de 31,600 córdobas y su inversión es de 15,200.
Ella con el crédito comprara materia prima como azúcar, harina, manteca, levadura, suero, dulce, leñas y bolsas…etc. además de una inversión que está haciendo para ampliar su negocio en la construcción de un anexo. 

Los otros integrantes son Luz Nohemí quien vende comida de manera ambulante y Ninoska quien vende quesillos en el mercado.
texts.en:
The El Eskimo group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. Marisela de los Ángeles is one of them. She has had a bakery for 8 years, and it has grown bit by bit. She has monthly sales of 31,600 córdobas and she invests 15,200.
With this loan she will purchase basic materials such as sugar, flour, butter, yeast, whey, jam, firewood, bags...etc. She is also making an investment to expand her business through building an annex.
The other members are Luz Nohemí, who sells food as a street vendor; and Ninoska, who sells quesillo cheese in the market.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as sugar, flour, yeast, whey, jam, firewood and bags, etc.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus wants a loan to brew alcohol. He is a farmer and a distiller of local brew. He has been in business for eight years.The 39-year-old hardworking, married man has four children. He is responsible for looking after his family. His dream is to educate his children up to the university level. He also wants to expand his business into the city where there is a ready market.

loans.use: To brew alcohol.

loans.name: Carlos Horacio

texts.es:
Carlos desde hace 20 años trabaja vendiendo mercancía por las calles, el con su negocio a logrado sacar a su familia adelante y además poder brindarles cada día una mejor calidad de vida.

El trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, el recorre las calles ofreciendo sus productos. El quiere comprar mas mercancía para tener mas variedad para ofrecerle a sus clientes, además así se incrementas sus ventas y su economía mejora notablemente.
texts.en:
Carlos has been selling merchandise on the streets for 20 years. His business allows him to move his family forward and provide them a better of quality of life each day.

He works very early in the morning until 8pm. Carlos travels through the streets offering his products. He wants to buy more merchandise so that he can have more variety to offer to his customers. In addition, he hopes to increase his sales and improve his finances considerably.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a 37-year-old married woman with seven children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in the Kator district of Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Hawa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to help her purchase more charcoal to sell. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan for building a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Virginia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages . She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Virginia has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Lilipeta

texts.en:
Lilipeta is 28 years old and is married with one child. Lilipeta owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Lilipeta needs a loan of WST 1200 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Lilipeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lilipeta's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 40-year-old business woman. She is widowed with six children. To raise her children, she sells fruits and vegetables in wholesale. She has been in the business for ten years and has employed one person. Being a widow, she works hard in her business in order to provide for her children, including educating her two children who are in school.

Leah hopes to grow her business in the future. She needs 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fruits and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy fruits and potatoes

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: El señor  Adolfo es chofer propietario afiliado en uno de los  sindicatos de Choferes de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene dos movilidades de transporte de pasajeros en el sindicato ya mencionado. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de nuevas llantas para ambas movilidades que son sus herramientas de trabajo y la fuente de sus ingresos mensuales. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de  Alto Lima II la cual queda ubicada en  la Ciudad de  El Alto. Adolfo es soltero, tiene un hijo el que se queda a cargo de la abuela mientras Adolfo trabaja. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito de Impro y de Kiva.
texts.en: Adolfo is a driver/owner affiliated with one of the city of La Paz’s taxi driver syndicates.  He has two passenger transportation vehicles in said syndicate.  He needs the loan to buy new tires for both taxis which are his work tool and source of monthly income.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Alto Lima II zone.  Adolfo is single and has a son who he leaves in care of his grandmother while Adolfo goes to work.  This is the first time the client gets an Impro and Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy new tires for both his taxis.

loans.name: Erika Alexandra

texts.es: La señora Erica a sus 20 años de edad es madre de un hijo de un año, se dedica a la confección de línea propia de ropa. La señora Erica confecciona todo tipo de pijamas y blusas de dama, el taller lo tiene acondicionado en su casa, esto le permite estar al cuidado de su pequeño hijo. La señora Erica desea comprar una nueva maquina y telas en cantidad. Con lo anterior, podrá aumentar sus ventas y su producción por ende aportar más dinero para los gastos de su casa. La señora Erica sueña con tener su taller más grande y así generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en: Erica is 20 years old and the mother of a one year old son.  She makes all types of pajamas and ladies’ blouses in a workshop she has set up in her home.  This allows her to care for her young son.  Erica wants to buy a new sewing machine and fabric in bulk.  This will allow her to increase her sales and bring in more money for expenses.  Erica dreams of having a larger workshop; in this way she can create jobs in her community.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Rhitshile Group

texts.en:
Tiyani is 44 years old and married with four children aged 22, 17, 6, and 3. He has two dependents.

He is in the photocopying and printing business and offers short computer courses. He has been in business for eight years and has two employees.

He faces power cuts, which hinder the business from operating. Tiyani wishes to have a big shop in town and another in Chiredzi. The loan will help him maximise profits so that he will be able to care for his family.

loans.use: to buy a printer

loans.name: Florencia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Gaza , tem 34 anos, tem 5ªclasse, casada e mae de 5filhos.
É  proprietaria de um pequeno estabelecimento comercial em sua residencia d e venda de produtos de primeira nacessidades comidas, artigos de higiene e bebidas. conta com ajuda duma empregada que oufere 1.500mt por mes. Tem tido um rendimento mensal de 5.000mt no qual 2.000mt envia para os seus sogros .
Este é terceiro emprestimo na hluvuku  no valor de 15.000,00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio, os anteriores de 30.000mt e de 40.000mt foram para construcao da sua casa. No futuro pretende comprar uma camioneta para facilitar o transporte dos seus produtos.
texts.en:
Florencia was born in Gaza. She is 34 years old and finished the fifth grade. She is married and has five children.
She runs a small shop out of her home, where she sells staple goods such as food, hygiene products, and drinks. She has one employee, whom she pays 1,500 meticals a month. She earns 5,000 meticals a month, of which she sends 2,000 meticals to her parents-in-law.
This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries. She used the previous loans, in the amounts of 30,000 and 40,000 meticals, to build her house. In future she intends to purchase a truck that will make it easier for her to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy staple goods for her shop.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
“Virgen de Fatima” fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo con 13 integrantes,son señoras muy actívas destacadas en su trabajo. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de buscar mejores condiciones para sus hijos y familiares y que de esa forma tengan un mejor estilo de vida.
La Sra Liberata es una de las señoras que plenamente se dedíca a su trabajo para cumplir con sus obligaciones su actividad de todos los días se basa en vender Comestibles de todo tipo, de forma ambulante. Ella comenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que tiene clientes que siempre compran de ella. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un local propio para no tener que recorrer, ya que ese trabajo es muy sacrificado. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, pollos, condimentos, panificados y demás insumos necesarios para preparar los alimentos que vende. Agradece la oportunidad que les está dando la fundación y kiva.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Virgen de Fatima”, and currently it is in its second loan cycle. It has 13 members, who are very active women, outstanding in their work. They got together with the aim of seeking better conditions for their children and family members, and to have a better way of life. 

Liberata is one of the women who devotes herself completely to her work, in order to fulfil her obligations. Her daily livelihood is based on selling food of all kinds, as a street vendor. She says that she has very good sales, since she has customers who always buy from her. 

One of her dreams is to have her own shop, so that she doesn't have to walk around, as that work is very hard. She is applying for the loan to buy meats, chickens, condiments, baked goods, and other supplies she needs to prepare the food that she sells. She is thankful for the opportunity that the Foundation and Kiva are giving her.

loans.use: To buy meats, chicken, condiments, baked goods, and other supplies.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
64-year-old Eugenia is a married woman living in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She and her husband are both farmers. Even at her age, Eugenia can still keep up with the work required at the farm. Eugenia also said that she enjoys working at her farm. Eugenia hires laborers to help till her land and grow rice crops.

Eugenia has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Eugenia hopes for this loan to help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kitale. Despite being young, she's very clear about what she wants from her life. For that reason, five years ago she decided to begin practicing mixed farming.  Maize farming and dairy farming are the most popular and lucrative economic activities for people in the Kitale area. Milk, maize and other dairy products are her main source of income. Gladys is seeking a loan to venture into horticultural farming. The new venture will marry well into dairy farming, and the combination of the two activities will bring him and her family untold benefits. With your loan, the horticultural farm she will start will complement the existing dairy farm in the following ways: income from dairy will pay for horticultural expenses as crops mature; lump sum income from crop farming will be rolled back into the business to buy more cows and plant more crops coming season; by-products from crop farming such as maize stalks, cobs and off-coloured grains will be used as dairy feeds; by-products from dairy such as cow dung will be used for biogas generation and manure for planting crops. The impact of this investment is sure to have a big impact on Glady’s family livelihood.

loans.use: to venture into horticultural farming.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 42 years old, is an entrepreneur and active woman, she is a single mother of two children, one of 15 years old and other of 8 years old. Four years ago she began their small business of shoes for catalog sales with an investment of $180 USD, taking acquaintances` orders from her clients and day by day was having a bigger acceptance among her clients.

Her procedure to sell her merchandise is that she takes the order of her clients and she has to finance the payment of the shoes orders, also she allows to her clients that pay to her in comfortable payments, it is for this reason that she has a great demand.

Due to the above-mentioned she needs a loan for $475 USD to purchase merchandise and provide her orders, she is thinking to repay the loan in a term of 3 to 6 months.

**\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Dolores una mujer emprendedora y activa de 42 años, ella es madre soltera de dos hijos, de 15 y 8 años respectivamente. Hace cuatro años inició su pequeño negocio de venta de zapatos por catálogo con una inversión de $ 180 USD, tomando pedidos de sus conocidos y cada día fue teniendo una mayor aceptación entre sus clientes.

Su procedimiento para vender es que ella toma el pedido de sus clientes y tiene que financiar el pago de los pedidos de zapatos, ya que además les permite a sus clientes que le paguen en cómodos abonos, es por eso que tienen gran demanda.

Debido a lo anterior ella necesita un préstamo por $ 475 USD para la compra de zapatos y poder surtir sus pedidos, piensa pagar el crédito en un plazo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is married and has three children. He has been in the business of selling new clothes and garments for the last two years. He started the business with savings he accumulated while employed.

With the loan, he will invest in the business and buy a variety of clothes to cater for the demands of children and adults.

He intends to use the profits from the business to help his father at home by building a good house for him, taking care of the family, and educating his children.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Lach M. is 26 years old and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Lach sells shoes at the local market and is able to generate an average of about $40 per day in revenue.  His wife works with him at the local market, but she sells clothes.  With this loan, the couple hopes to expand their respective businesses by purchasing more shoes and clothes to sell.  Additionally, Lach wants to buy a car so that they can transport their shoes and clothes to and from the market.  In the future, Lach hopes to expand his business beyond Phnom Penh and into other provinces in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to expand business and to purchase a car in order to transport shoes to and from market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Siem Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Siem Seng was married in 1980 and has 4 children, 3 sons and 1 daughter. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 2002. She has also  trained her eldest daughter to weave and now they weave silk at home together. Her husband grows rice and plants vegetables in the same village.   

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA  four times already. Now she is asking for a loan of $500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk for her and her daughter’s looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk for her & daughter’s looms.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma Huamaní T. belongs to the village bank “Bienestar II” which is Spanish for “Wellbeing II.”

Vilma makes her living through the sale of “abarrotes,” or general food items in bulk, such as flour, rice, cereals, cooking oil, and a variety of other products. She is based in Ayacucho, however, because it is difficult to generate profits in a city with much competition and a high level of poverty, she travels great distances to find more profitable markets. Four days of the week, Vilma wakes up at 4:00 a.m. to travel at least two hours outside the city limits to sell her products, only to return the same night and leave again the next day. It is a difficult way to make a living, but worth it, she says, as it is much more lucrative and necessary to support her family as she was, until recently, a single mother. She has two grown children and a brand new baby girl with her new husband.

In addition to the great amounts of traveling, Vilma also has a stand in a local cooperative open seven days a week, which her older daughter maintains while she is away. Vilma has been selling “abarrotes” for a little more than twenty years. Her goal she says is to one day own a large grocery store where people can come and find everything they need.

Vilma loves to be a part of her village bank. She says it is a very beautiful thing. She thinks it is an essential part of helping women to become economically independent and better support their families. With the US$ 500 loan for which she is asking, Vilma will be able to buy food supplies that she can sell, as well as gasoline for the long distances she travels in her car.

loans.use: to buy food supplies that she can sell, as well as gasoline for the long distances she has to travel in her car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue buying materials such as beads and stones that she uses to make jewelry.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian has always identified herself as a very active woman. She's from the city of Cuzco but, due to family reasons, she's been living in Juliaca. She is currently living with her mother in company of 3 of her 4 kids. She set up shop in a small section of the house in which she sells canned goods and drinks. She runs this business from 8am until late hours of the night with the help of her children. She always dreamed of having her own business, which is why she is very happy at this moment. However, she would like to increase her inventory since she has lots of customers. She hopes to get the loan she requested and promises to pay it back within six months. With your support and Lilian's effort you will be able to offer her kids a good education and improved lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

L. señora Lilian, desD. siempre se identificó como una mujer y madre muy activa, elL. es natural D. L. ciudad D. Cuzco pero por cuestiones familiares radica en Juliaca.Actualmente vive en el domicilio D. su madre en compañía de4 sus tres hijos y un espacio que acondicionó se dispuso a aperturar su pequeña tiendita D. venta D. abarrotes y bebidas, negocio que atienD. desD. las 8:00 D. L. mañana hasta altas horas D. L. noche con apoyo siempre D. sus queridos hijos.Siempre soñó con contar con su propio negocio, por lo que ahora se siente muy feliz, sin embargo le es menester implementar y aumentar aún más L. cantidad D. mercadería puesto que tiene gran clienteL..A fin D. que su negocio surja como elL. lo espera requiere recibir tu importante apoyo con el firme compromiso D. retornarlo en un período D. seis meses.Con tu apoyo y el esfuerzo que Lilian realice podrá brindarle una buena educación y mayor bienestar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase more items of better quality  for her store

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga María B. is a hard-working woman who is in the business of selling medications. She has her own pharmacy in her home in León, in the beautiful country of Nicaragua.

She began the pharmacy on her own three years ago after being widowed, with a son in her care. Despite this difficult situation, she has been developing her business to the point where she has been able to stock a greater quantity of medications, pills, and lotions that are very popular with her customers. Currently Mrs. B. needs to purchase more medications, and for this reason she has turned to Ceprodel, who for a year has given her financial support in order to purchase medications for the pharmacy and in this way keep making progress with the maintenance of her home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Olga Maria B. es una dama muy esforzada que se dedica al negocio de venta de medicamentos, teniendo una farmacia propia en su hogar de habitación en León de la bella nación de Nicaragua.

La farmacia la inicia por cuenta propia desde hace 3 años al quedar viuda y con un hijo a su cargo. A pesar de esta dura situación, ha venido desarrollando su negocio hasta lograr surtirlo con mayores cantidades de medicamentos, pastillas y pomadas muy demandados por los clientes.

Hoy en día la necesidad que atraviesa la señora B. es la urgencia de surtir sus productos con los medicamentos, para esto acude a Ceprodel quien desde hace un año le brinda apoyo financiero para surtir la farmacia de medicamentos y así salir adelante con el mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase medications

loans.name: Dobbi A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Robinah N.. She sells herbal medicine and food supplements and is requesting a loan to purchase more food supplements. Robinah is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 2 children, ages 18 and 23. Each week, Robinah makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add more capital to her business.

Robinah is joined in her small group by Kevina N., Scholastic N., Zeda N., and Proscovia Z.. Kevina N. sells charcoal and wants to expand into bulk selling. Scholastic N. has a meat roasting business and wants a loan to diversify her business to chicken roasting. Zeda N. sells used clothing and wants to invest in selling new clothes. Proscovia Z. sells fruit and vegetables and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of vegetables.

loans.use: To boost herbal and food supplement business

loans.name: Sandra's Group

texts.en:
Esperanza, Apolonia, and Sandra have been part of the Solidarity Communal Bank for 2 years, 8 months, and 8 months.

Esperanza is 52 years old and has 7 children. She sells childrens clothing at the Nazarenas fair every Monday. She purchases the clothing and materials in the city of Lima.

Apolonia is 33 years old and has 3 children. She also sells cloths in the Nazarenas fair on Mondays. She travels to the fairs 2 times a week to sell fruit and buys cheeses to resell to local stores.

Sandra is a 25 single mother of 1. She sells clothes to order, and she gets her materials from the city of Lima. She also sells cosmetics from catalogs.

Esperanza, Apolonia, and Sandra need loans of 1600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of fabric, polos, cheese, and fine lingerie.

These women hope to have their own clothing stores, equip their stores with the proper machines to run their businesses, and offer their children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer.

Esperanza, Apolonia y Sandra pertenecen al Banco Comunal Solidaridad hace 2 años, 8 meses, 8 meses respectivamente.

Esperanza es casada, tiene 52 años y 7 hijos, Esperanza vende ropa de niños los días lunes en la feria de Las Nazarenas. Además, Esperanza tiene un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de niños, la ropa y la tela son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Por otro lado, Apolonia es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Apolonia viaja a las ferias 2 veces por semana, donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra quesos que reparte a las tiendas.

Mientras que, Sandra es madre soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Sandra vende ropa a pedido, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima. Además Sandra vende cosméticos por catálogos.

Esperanza, Apolonia y Sandra necesitan préstamos de 1600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tela polar, polos, vestidos, conjuntos, queso y lencería fina.

Los sueños de Esperanza, Apolonia y Sandra son tener una tienda de ropa, equipar su taller con todas las maquina y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Esperanza, Apolonia, and Sandra need loans of 1600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of fabric, polos, cheese, and fine lingerie.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria is a vendor who lives in the neighborhood of Acahual Inca. She is 29 years old and married. Her business is selling pork and pork products. She started out selling on consignment, and began saving and investing her earnings. She already has 15 years of sales experience and a steady group of customers, and her goal is to set her business up in a permanent location and increase her sales. She is going to use the loan to buy more raw materials to sell and thus satisfy her customers with more variety.

Translated by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Gloria, es comerciante habita en el barrio acahual inca tiene 29 años de edad es casada. Su negocio es venta de carne de cerdo y derivados ella empezó con la venta de consignación, y comenzó ahorrar capital e invertir mas ala venta ya lleva 15 años de experiencia y tiene sus clientes fijos, su anhelo es poner un puesto fijo e incrementar las ventas. Con el préstamo va a comprar más materia prima para vender y satisfacer a sus clientes, con variedad.

loans.use: Purchasing products

loans.name: Jessica Esmeralda

texts.es:
Señora Jessica V. is 31 years old. She is married and has two sons, one is 16 and the other is 11. They are both students and are dependent on her. She lives in Pueblo Joven Luis Alberto Fujimori in the Port of Salaverry, Department La Libertad in Peru.

Jessica is a cosmetologist and works in her home doing hair cuts, perms, highlights, extensions, etc. She works with professional materials and equipment because she thinks that she should do things well and so that her clients will come back. She started five years ago with Manuela Ramos and believes that her life has changed since she started this work because she can better support her household. Her first loan was 300.00 Soles which she used to purchase instruments and materials like scissors, liquid dyes, etc. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Empresarias Al Éxito II."

With a loan of 500.00 Soles ($175) that she will repay in four months, she will buy scissors and more.

Her biggest dream is to be able to study Cosmetics (facial treatments) with the goal of opening up a larger beauty and massage center so that she can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jessica V., tiene 31 años de edad. Esta casada y tiene 02 hijos varones, uno de 16 y otro de 11 años estudiantes, ambos dependientes aun de ella; vive en el Pueblo .Joven Luis Alberto Fujimori, en el Puerto Salaverry, departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Jessica, es cosmetóloga, y realiza su trabajo en su casa, realiza cortes ondulaciones, rayitos, extensiones, etc. Ella trabaja con materiales y equipos profesionales, porque considera que se deben hacer las cosas bien, y así las clientas podrán regresar en otras oportunidades. Se inicio hace 05 años junto con Manuela Ramos y considera que su vida esta cambiando desde que trabaja ya que puede aportar a las mejoras económicas de su hogar. Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300. y lo invirtió en la compra de sus instrumentos y materiales como son: tijeras, líquidos tintes, etc Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Empresarias Al Éxito II ”

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 que cancelará en 4 meses lo invertirá en la compra de tijeras, y demás. Su mayor sueño es poder estudiar Cosmeatría (tratamientos faciales)con el objetivo de colocar un Centro de belleza y masajes mas grande y así poder progresar.

loans.use: Purchase of Supplies

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 34 years old, has joined TYM FUND (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2000. Her first loan of 500 000 VND (approximately 31 USD) was used to breed pigs and chickens. She continued to use her next loans to breed animals in large volumes. Her income from this farm also increases over time. When the areas around Noibai Airport develop, the population of her village increases, since there are more workers. Ms. T. discussed with her family and invested in a store to sell clean vegetables and fruit. Her store is doing very well because it meets the demands of her villagers. Ms. T. has two chldren, both are at school age. She wants to borrow 1150 USD to invest in her business. Her monthly income is 5,000,000 VND (around 312.5 USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thúy 34 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2000, vồng vốn đầu tiên chị xin vay 500.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đều vay mức vốn cao tiếp tục đầu tư chăn nuôi với số lượng lớn, thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của gia đình chị cũng tăng lên. Từ khi khu công nghiệp nội bài phát triển mạnh, công nhân tập trung nhiều về địa phương nên chị cùng gia đình bàn bạc đầu tư bán mặt hàng rau sạch và hàng nông sản, phù hợp với nhu cầu thực tế tại địa phương nên việc buôn bán của gia đình chị rất phát triển thu nhâp cao, chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Emiliana's Nazareti Group

texts.en:
Emiliana is 22 years old, married and has a child who is one year old. She also cares for another child who is three. Emiliana owns a small general store, which she opened last year. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Emiliana has applied for a loan to buy more commodities to sell in her store. She will share this loan with the members of her group, who run businesses selling maize, milk and beans.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of items to sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
This is the second time that Mrs. Mao M. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She is a farmer in Taing Klai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from this business, she has pig breeding business. Mrs. Mao M. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets and she has fully paid it back. 

Since her pigs now grow bigger and bigger, Mrs. Mao M. does not have enough money to buy a pig food So she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy two piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Haem Pheap, owns a small coal kiln where he can make coal to sell to support his family. Mrs. Mao M. is 33 and the mother of six children, three of whom are attending school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food to feed them.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 23 years old, and she is divorced with 2 children, ages 5 and 3. She has been a clothing seller since 2005. Every day she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Khadija is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira was born in 1949 and she lives in Makljenovac, a suburb of Doboj in Bosnia. She is a widow and lives with her one child. She receives 150KM per month from her late-husband's pension plan, which is equivalent to roughly $100USD. This is not enough income for her to survive, so she is dependent upon microfinance loans to invest in new business ideas that will help her to meet her most basic needs.

Her first two loans in 2004 and 2005 were used to purchase goats. Her third loan in 2006 was used to purchase a cow. Her fourth loan in 2007 was used to purchase food for the cow. She was able to repay each loan with the additional income that the animal generated.

She now requests a fifth loan from Women for Women International, in the amount of 600KM. She will use this loan to buy pumpkin seeds, which she will sell to spectators at soccer games in the fall.

loans.use: to buy pumpkin seeds to sell to spectators at soccer games

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria tiene 44 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380, en la capital de Managua desde su juventud, tiene un hijo de 10 años que esta estudiando, su esposo trabaja de  electrónico. Doña Gloria inicio su negocio hace seis años vendiendo bisutería, hoy tiene una mini pulpería que vende granos básicos, gaseosas y otros productos, con la solicitud de crédito la quiere para comprar ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, para ofertar a sus clientes, nuevos productos, y así obtener mejores ingresos. A largo plazo es incrementar el volumen de venta y quiere remodelar el local donde tiene su negocio para dar mejor servicios a sus clientes y atraer a otros clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and she has lived in region 380 in the capital city of Managua since her youth. He has a 10 year old son who is attending school, and her husband is an electrician. Gloria started her business 6 years ago selling fashion jewelry, and currenty she has a small convenience store were she sells basic needs items, soft drinks, and other products. With this loan she will purchase clothing, shoes and cosmetics to offer her clients. New products will translate into better earnings. In the long term she plans to increase her sales and remodel the store where she carries out her business, to give better service and attract new clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Genaro Rafael

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega el señor Genaro O. se dedica a su labor de alquiler de teléfono y venta de tarjetas celulares ubicados a la intemperie pero con la esperanza de llegar a tener su propio tramo donde atender a los clientes.

Es importante destacar que é les padre soltero y debe atender a su péqueña hija brindándole las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle en sus estudios de primaria. La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de tarjetas telefónicas para su venta y además para el pago de las recargas electrónicas de celular.
texts.en:
In the central market of the city of Chinandega, Mr. Genaro O. works renting a telephone and selling cell phone cards; he currently operates his business out in the open but hopes to someday have his own shop where he can attend to his customers. It is important to highlight that he is a single father who takes care of his small daughter and tries to offer her the best conditions possible to develop through her schoolwork. He hopes to receive a loan from Ceprodel that will help him buy phone cards to sell and to pay for the cell phone electronic recharges.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cell phone cards to sell

loans.name: Zahriddin

texts.en:
Zahriddin I.  is a taxi driver and in his free time he helps his father with farming. His father has a big garden where together they grow grapes every year. After getting their yield they dry grapes and sell them at the market. He and his father work hard in the field hoping to have a good crop yield. He is proud of their farm because it is allowing him to feed and educate his family. He wants to borrow 3200 Somoni ($ 925 USD). He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and will make a small investment in land preparation. He was born and raised in Istaravshan, but he hopes his children can gain an education and move to a bigger city. His main short term goal is to make all the lands he owns productive.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Julio Nicolas

texts.es: Don Julio Nicolás García B.  es casado, de oficios Albañil , y  lleva 18 años de elaborar en la Construcción de viviendas, su residencia que se encuentra en Paraje Pabulux del Cantón Chotacaj del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, actualmente la demanda de su clientela a prestar sus servicios ha aumentado pero las condiciones económicas  no son suficientes para arreglar su máquina para mezclar concreto, para que ello acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con el que podrá arreglar su máquina y así aprovechar las ganancias que su trabajo le generara y así poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Julio Nicolás García B. has been a construction worker for 18 years. He is married and lives in Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently his work has seen an increase in demand, but his cement mixer is broken and he has not had money to fix it. Julio is requesting a loan through Kiva partner Asociacion ASDIR to repair the cement mixer, and be able to take on all the construction jobs available to him.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reparing cement mixer

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina Y. is fifty–six years old. A slight misunderstanding between her and her husband resulted in a break up after they had given birth to four children. Currently, Angelina is a single parent of the four children, three of whom are female. She says the first three of her children have all completed school and are gainfully employed. The last born is in the military academy. She lives in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Angelina has sponsored her children's schooling through her trading business. She trades in smoked fish. She procures the smoked fish from the northern part of the country and sells them in the market in her locality. She also sometimes treks to other markets to do business. Angelina says she used to sell minerals and other drinks but thought it prudent to switch to this current business. She hopes to amass enough profit to complete her building project.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish

loans.name: Lolo

texts.fr: Née le 31 Décembre 1957 à Vogan, Mme Lolo D. est une veuve avec cinq (05) enfants à charge. Malgré son age, elle a toujours travaillé pour la survie de sa famille grâce à son petit commerce de vente de beignets. Afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et tirer beaucoup plus de profits de son activité, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker les matières premières notamment la farine de blé, du sucre et de l’huile. Les bénéfices tirés de ce commerce serviront à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1957 in Vogan, Mrs. Lolo D. is a widow raising 5 children. Despite her age, she has always worked to support her family, thanks to her little business selling fried dough. So as to increase her turnover and gain more profit from her business, she is requesting a loan to stock up on ingredients, notably wheat flour, sugar and oil. The profit from this business serves to educate her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing wheat flour, sugar and oil

loans.name: Selepa

texts.en: Selepa S., 34, is married with four children. She has three years of experience in the vegetable selling business. She sells to the village people and general public three days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. Selepa expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 tala ($145 USD). SPBD loans are Selepa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy things to upgrade the business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds, sacks of fertilizer, a wheel barrow, and weed killer

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa C. is 40 years old. Her husband, Catalino, is working as a driver and they are living a peaceful life in San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela. They were blessed with four children: Crisanto, a 15-year-old high-school student; Christian, a 12-year-old also in high school; and Chrisilyn, 10, and Christine, 8, who are both in the elementary level of school. The family has a good family relationship and she prays that they can sustain their bonding no matter how many difficulties life may bring.

Marissa is a vendor of native snacks like “kakanin” (rice cake) in their village. She sells different snacks and with her diligence, she was able to earn a weekly income of PHP 1,000.00. Her income is being used as rolling capital and buys the necessary ingredients like glutinous rice, coconut and sugar. Her request of PHP 4,000.00 will serve as additional capital for the improvement of her business. She hopes that her request will be granted for it will really help her not only to support her business but also in sending her children to school and to provide the needs of their family.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maritza Isabel S. se dedica a laborar en el Mercado Central de Chinandega donde ella ofrece el servicio de alquiler de los servicios sanitarios siendo visitada a diario por las personas que visitan el gran mercado central.

De igual forma, ella también comercializa caramelos pero su mayor fuerza es el alquiler de los servicios sanitarios que mantiene en perfecto estado. Hoy en día ella espera en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de productos de limpieza para lavar las paredes y el piso de los baños y de igual forma para la compra de papel higiénico entre otros. Con este crédito se beneficiará grandemente y logrará brindar mejores condiciones a los servicios sanitarios.
texts.en:
Maritz Isabel S. works in the Central Market of Chinandega where she rents out sanitary services to people who visit the large central market every day.

She also sells candy, but her major efforts are in renting out sanitary services, which she keeps in perfect condition. Now she hopes to get a loan from Ceprodel to buy cleaning products to wash the walls and the floor of the bathroom. She also hopes to buy toilet paper, among other things. This loan will help her a lot and will allow her to offer better sanitary services.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning products

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.en:
Luis Miguel is 36 years old and lives with Vicenta Vera, 30 years old. They live in the city San Ignacio in their own house. They do not have children. 

Luis is the owner of a metalurgy workshop that has been open for more than 10 years. He will use his loan for the purchase of materials for his workshop, such as pipes, metal, and iron sheets, etc.

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials (pipes, metal sheets, etc).

loans.name: Lamisi

texts.en:
Lamisi N. cooks and sells banku, a local dish made from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She sells at the market square in the mornings. She has been in business for seven years. Lamisi wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices.

Lamisi is 42 years old, married and has four children--two daughters and two sons. Some are currently in senior high while others are in primary schools. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Võ Thị

texts.en:
Thủy Võ Thị (1022081871) is a 48 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Thủy operates a family member's specialized retail store. These are manufactured products that are sold to local businesses and community members. Thủy has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, Thủy joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Thủy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Thủy is requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Thủy from TYM Fund. Thủy plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed Y. is married and has two children. His wife is a seamstress. He has received schooling through junior high school.

Ahmed sells timber logs at Abura, which he has done for quite some time now. He uses his income to pay fees and housekeeping expenses.

Ahmed will use the loan to purchase to plywood for sale since it is in high demand. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ahmed plans to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase to plywood for sale since it is in high demand

loans.name: Laura Maria

texts.es: Laura María M. L. tiene 45 años. Es una mujer casada y junto a su pareja tiene 4 hijos. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. Todos los días se levanta temprano ya que llegan a dejarle la leche en su casa, sus vecinos están muy complacidos por que Laura les proporciona la leche en a una distancia accesible, por lo que en algunos casos llegan personas que son de comarcas muy lejanas. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de leche, cuajada y queso. Su deseo es que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Laura María M. L. is 45 years old. She is a married woman, and she and her husband have 4 children. She sells dairy products. Every day, she wakes up early, since her customers arrive at her house to take the milk. Her neighbors are very satisfied because Laura provides the milk nearby. In some cases, people from areas farther away come for her products. The loan she is requesting is for capital to buy milk, curds and cheese. Her dream is that her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Do Not Publish

texts.en: Maria I. lovely.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo
texts.en: Alfredo

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to grow Passion Fruit.

loans.name: Edwin Jose

texts.es: El joven Edwin P. de 24 años de edad, casado y con una hija de 9 años que su esposa le tiene, reside en el barrio Pantasma en la ciudad de Managua, el se desempeña en servicios de seguridad y también vende leche agria para ayudarse ya que su salario es bajo, desde hace seis años vende leche agria y trabaja hace dos años que es dinero fijo para subsistir con su familia. Su planes es poder mejorar su vivienda y darle estabilidad a su familia. Con este préstamo comprara más bidones de leche para aumentar las ventas que junto con su esposa hacen, el cual una parte se vende en casa y otra parte ambulante en sus horas libres, es un producto rico y accesible de precios para los Nicaragüenses. Con este préstamo espera aumentar las ventas y captar clientes nuevos. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Young Edwin P. is 24 years old, married, and has a 9 year old daughter of his wife's. He lives in the Pantasma neighborhood of Managua and works as a security guard. In addition to working, he sells sour-milk to augment his low salary. He has sold sour-milk for six years and worked in security for 2 years because it’s a more stable income for his family. He would like to improve is home and provide his family with stability. He plans to buy more barrels of milk with this loan to increase the sales he makes along-side his wife. They sell some milk from their home and some traveling by foot when they have free time. This is a delicious product sold at a price that’s good for Nicaraguans. He hopes to increase his sales and get more customers with this loan. And he is thankful for this institution and its financial support.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy barrels of milk to make more sour milk.

loans.name: Ricardo Jose

texts.es: Ricardo Jose P. D. began his business 3 years ago with the sale of 5 perfumes that he bought in the Nicaraguan city of Guasaule. He recognized that he could make a good profit and has slowly increased his sales and seen his business grow, he is also selling clothes not too. His dream is to have a store from which he can sell his products. He says that the biggest challenge is not having enough capital to invest in his business. He has two children, one is in middle school and the other attends the University here in Leon.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Isabel Damaris
