texts.es: Isabel Damaris es casada, tiene 2 niños la mayor tiene 9 añitos de edad estudia su tercer grado de educaciòn primaria y el niño menor de 7 añitos de edad estudia su primer grado en el colegio catòlico, trabaja como docente en el colegio catolico de nueva guinea, esta solicitando su primer crèdito para construir una habitaciòn y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia,  se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora,  pues  a pesar que el salario que devenga es muy bajo desea brindar las condiciones necesarias a su familia,  Isabel junto con su marido han luchado para que a sus hijos no les falte nada y construir su propia casa,   es una docente muy responsable con sus deberes y es muy querida por sus alumnos y padres de familia , su sueño es terminar de estudiar la licenciatura en ciencias de Educacion, estabilidad laboral y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel Damaris is married and has two children, a nine-year-old, who is in third grade, and a seven-year-old, who is a first-grader in the Catholic school. She works as a teacher's aide at the Catholic Nueva Guinea school. She is requesting her first loan to add a room to her house thereby improving her family's living conditions. She is a hard-working woman who, despite the low salary she earns, wishes to provide the best for her family. Isabel, together with her husband, have struggled to insure that their children lack nothing and to build their own house. She is a very responsible teacher's aide and held in high regard by her students and their parents. Her dream is to finish her studies in Education Sciences (to become a licensed teacher), to have stable employment and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Wendy

texts.es:
La socia WENDY pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos una hija mujer y un bebe de un año y medio.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de atender su pequeño negocio de venta frutas al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
WENDY, 31, is a member of the "MINIBANK" communal bank; she is from the city of Cusco. She is in a common-law relationship and has two children, a girl and an 18-month-old baby boy. She alternates her household chores with tending her small wholesale and retail fruit sales business in Cusco's "Virgen Asunta" market. She needs financing to increase her working capital in her fruit sales business. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital in fruit selling business.

loans.name: Lep

texts.en: Lep A., 47, is a married woman and the mother of a child who is newly married and has started a new home. To help feed the family, Lep A. owns a medium boat that she uses to transport a few grocery items to sell to people who live along the river. Her husband helps her sell the inventory. To earn extra income, Lep A. will be using her loan to buy a larger amount of fresh fish, which she will turn into fish paste and sell. This will provide her with more income and a comfortable living.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to make fish paste

loans.name: Kimmy

texts.en:
Kimmy A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 21 years old. Kimmy is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Kimmy owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of ready to wear items in the local community. Kimmy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Kimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kimmy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Kimmy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Launching small poultry business

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda C. is from the village of Owaon. She is 56 years old. Luzminda is widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 1,700 PHP average per month for these activities.

In 2008, Luzminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third taken out by Luzminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama S. is a single parent who has two children. She has no formal education. Ama prepares rice and stew and sells them in Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now. Ama uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more raw rice, beans and other ingredients to prepare the food that she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, and other ingredients

loans.name: Marciana's Group

texts.en:
Marciana F. is from the town of Aloran. She is 46 years old. Marciana is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is F. Marciana's Group.

Marciana is married. To make a living, Marciana owns & operates a "sari-sari" selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marciana has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2005, Marciana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marciana has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Marciana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Marciana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona A. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Rona is married. To make a living, Rona owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle "habal-habal" services to local community members. Rona is just starting this business.

In 2008, Rona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Rona is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Rona from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Julius Mkutano

texts.en:
Julius is a 50-year-old married man with four children. He lives in M'Chembe a rural part of Malindi and owns a private school where he targets children of the surrounding areas. The school is twelve years old and receives a monthly income of Ksh 12,000 a month.

Julius first learned about KADET when he saw a KADET group being trained. He inquired and joined the group. He is now on his third loan.

Julius will utilize this loan by building a classroom with Ksh 15,000, building a toilet with Ksh 5,000, opening a kiosk with Ksh 35,000 and will use Ksh 5,000 for miscellaneous expenses. With the extra income from this loan he plans to build more classrooms and employ more teachers.

A visionary and hardworking man, he dreams of building the school up to secondary school level.

loans.use: To build a classroom and toilet and to open a kiosk

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie R. is a 44 year-old married woman who supports her family by selling cosmetics. She lives in Sumaliring Siaton, Negros Oriental with her husband, Grisologo, and their 3 adult children who are between 20-24 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and has improved her family's living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her cosmetics vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Jessie is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can have additional working capital for her cosmetic sales business. This will be her 14th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jessie aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Sanayelen Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SANAYELEN,  sont 7 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits, de céréales, de condiments et des fruits avec Assa D.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  5 chargements de charrette de fruits .
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché, dans les vergers de  Sikasso et les villages voisins . Les fruits sont vendus au  marché du quartier Sanoubougou I et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans l’éducation et la santé des enfants et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the SANALEYEN group are seven married women who average 36 years of age and have an average of four children. They live in polygamous families in SANOUBOUGOU 1, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are taking out their first loan from the microfinance institution, Soro, Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. This group of women trade in clothes, cereals, condiments and, in the case of Assa D., fruits. The latter is planning to buy five barrowloads of fruits with her loan. She gets her supplies at the large market, in Sikasso's orchards and the neighboring villages. The fruits are sold at the market in the district of Sanoubougou 1 and within the family, to a customer base made up of men and women. She envisages making an average monthly profit of 12,000FCFA of which part will be used to help her husband pay for the children's education and health and the rest to invest in her business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 39 years old. She is a widow who lives with son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a rental house. Her son, Orgil, is 16 years old and he attends the local secondary school. She operates her underwear sales business at Sunday Plaza. Narantsetseg started her business in 2009 and made quick progress. Narantsetseg is a very hardworking person. However, in 2006, her husband passed away and she was left to raise her son. At that time, it was hard for her to continue her work, but she has since worked diligently to grow her business to its current successful position. She said, “As a mother, I would like to be financially available to provide a good education and other necessary expenses for my son until he grow up and also I would like to expand my business and to purchase my own apartment for my family in the future." She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: David Manuel

texts.es:
David Manuel González G. es un hombre que vive con su cónyuge en el barrio El Carmen del Municipio de Malambo, a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Este joven de 28 años, vende mercancías y tiene  un punto de ventas de minutos de llamadas telefónicas, pues es muy común vender minutos a celulares en esta población; como David es un joven muy activo comercialmente, siempre está pendiente de las oportunidades, por eso gracias al clima caliente también es comerciante de sandalias para hombres y mujeres  y  vende pandebonos (tipo de pan hecho de queso con harina de maíz) , que  elabora en el horno que tiene con su hermano y que éste ultimo comercializa  en la  calle.
David ha aplicado por este préstamo  para comprar mas inventario: piensa conseguir 4 docenas de sandalias de hombre, 4 docenas de sandalias de mujer que le han solicitado y para su negocio de pandémonos  1 bulto de harina, 24 libras de queso e ingredientes varios.   

Él comenzó este trabajo hace 12 años con la venta de pandebonos que solía comprar al fabricante y vender en la calle; cuenta que fue muy difícil al principio porque no tenia capital suficiente y el trabajo era duro, por eso se  sacrificó mucho para continuar; fue así como ahorrando, logro comprar su propio horno en sociedad con su hermano y posteriormente  con nuevos ahorros, comenzó a traer sandalias artesanales de San Jacinto un Municipio de  Bolívar para distribuir en los pueblos del Atlántico y agregar otra actividad para obtener mas ingresos: la venta de ropa y otras mercancías y también  hasta logró adecuar en su casa un punto de ventas de minutos a celulares para que su cónyuge trabajara. 

Este es el segundo crédito que David ha recibido de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; desde  que comenzó con esta organización, ha podido abrir nuevos mercados y ampliar la gama de productos que ofrece. Mirando su futuro él espera continuar trabajando para mejor su nivel de vida y  el de su familia adquiriendo una vivienda propia y este es u máximo sueño y desafío.
texts.en:
David Manuel Gonzáles G. lives with his wife in the El Carmen neighborhood in the Municipality of Malambo, fifteen minutes from the city of Barranquilla. This young man of twenty-eight years sells goods, and he also has a kiosk where he sells cell phone minutes. Selling cell phone minutes is quite common in this area. He's a very active young businessman, always on the lookout for opportunities. Thanks to the hot climate he can also sell men’s and women’s sandals. In addition, he makes pandebonos (a bread made with cheese and corn meal) in his and his brother’s oven, and sells them on the street. David has applied for this loan so he can buy more merchandise. He plans to get four dozen pairs of men’s sandals and four dozen pairs of women’s sandals that he has orders for, as well as a sack of meal, twenty-four pounds of cheese, and assorted ingredients for his pandebonos business. David went into business twelve years ago by getting pandebonos from the supplier and selling them on the street. He says it was hard at first because he didn’t have enough capital and the work was hard, so he really had to sacrifice to keep it going. He kept on saving and managed to buy his own oven, in concert with his brother. Later, with his new savings, he started bringing hand-made sandals from San Jacinto, a municipality in Bolivia, to distribute in the towns of the Atlántico department. He added yet another business to increase his income: selling clothing and other goods, and he even succeeded in putting a cell-phone-minutes kiosk in his house so his wife could work. This is David’s second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Since starting out with the organization he has been able to open new markets and expand the range of products that he offers. Looking to the future, he hopes to continue working to improve the quality of life for himself and his family by getting their own house, his greatest dream and biggest challenge.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inventory, including 4 dozen men's sandals, 4 dozen women's sandals that he has orders for, as well as a sack of meal, 24 pounds of cheese, and assorted ingredients.for his pandebono business.

loans.name: Ivanez

texts.es: Ivanez, de 32 años, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposa Lucy (28)  y sus 4 hijos menores.Desde hace 12 años se dedica a sembrar  plátanos, café y distintas frutas cítricas; realiza la labor junto a su esposa, quien se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de la actividad que desempeña, es rozar los terrenos, en busca de buenas cosechas; sin embargo le disgusta pagar precios altos cada vez que traslada sus productos a la ciudad, por eso en la actualidad recolecta toda la producción de su sector para llevarlo a vender y así ahorra un dinero extra. Con su labor ha obtenido muchos logros, como el adquirir su casa y sus chacras propias, por eso dentro de sus planes futuros se encuentra el de mejorar la calidad de vida, además piensa comprar  más tierras agrícolas, ya que quiere ganar más utilidades.Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se siente motivado de continuar laborando en su banco comunal, porque todos los integrantes son muy trabajadores y responsables. Para mas adelante Ivanez tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado, en la compra de varios sacos de abono, fertilizantes y herramientas agrícolas que necesita para desempeñar bien su labor.
texts.en:
Ivanez is 32 years old and lives in his own home along with his 32 year old wife, Lucy, and four young children. He’s been raising bananas and coffee for the past 12 years. He does this along with his wife, who also cares for the home and the children. What he likes most is that he is able to restore the land in search of better harvests. At the same time, he does not like having to pay high prices every time he needs to transport his products to the city, so now he collects all of the products from his sector, so that he can share the cost of transport and save money. His hard work has allowed him to obtain many things, such as his home and his own farmland. This is why his future plans include improving his quality of life. He also wants to buy more farmland. This will be his second loan through MFP and he is motivated to continue working with his communal bank because all of its members are responsible and hard working. Ivanez will use the money from this loan to buy bags of fertilizer and farm tools that he needs to be able to carry out his labor.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and farm tools

loans.name: Nabieu

texts.en:
Nabieu is a hardworking and very determined businessman. His business centre is located along Rogbaneh Road which is one of the busy Streets in Makeni. He is married to an active businesswoman and has two dependents. Mr. Nabieu was initially financed by his brother and began trading in slippers, which he has now done for thirty-three years.

How to cope with the high transportation costs and frequent increase in wholesale prices of slippers he trades in, is the major challenge Nabieu is faced with. He needs a loan to expand his business.

Nabieu intends to use the additional income generated from this  loan to further invest in his busines and educate his child to university level.

loans.use: To buy additional plastic shoes to sell

loans.name: Aida Marisela

texts.es:
Aida Marisela G. M. tiene 44 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 1 hijo, Edwin (15). 

Aida  es una socia de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Aida se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao y criar aves. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao ycomprar aves de corral  para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementar la producción para el bienestar de la familia. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta criar animales, la agricultura y celebrar las fiestas de la localidad.
texts.en:
Aida Marisela G. M. is 44 years old. She is single and lives in Chillanes Canton, Recinto San Jose, Estero Salado Parish. She has 1 son, Edwin, who is 15. Aida is a member of the rural communal bank "Fronteras Unidas" (United Borders), which is located 25 minutes from Estero Salado Parish and two hours from the agency in Chillanes. This bank is made up of 19 members. The community members make their livings in agriculture. Aida also makes her living in agriculture; she farms cacao and raises fowl. She makes her purchases each month in Matilde Esther and makes her sales in Matilde Esther as well. She is requesting the loan to be able to purchase cacoa beans to plant and fowl to grow her business. She believes the loan will be an opportunity for her to get ahead. She hopes to increase her production for the well-being of her family. The challenge she faces is during harvest time, which is when the roads are damaged by the rain. She likes to raise animals, farm and celebrate the local festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cocoa beans to plant and fowl to grow her business.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El Señor Vicente dedicado al trabajo dela Carpintería  cuenta con maquinas necesarias para realizar los trabajos, el cliente requiere de material para realizar sus pedidos en su trabajo, el Señor tiene una experiencia en su trabajo desde hace 5 años atrás, con este trabajo puede mantener a su familia y hacer estudiar a sus  hijos que en algunas ocasiones lo ayudan a terminar los trabajos requeridos pero en este momento le falta madera para concluir un trabajo importante que le surgió y necesita cumplir con estos pedidos  es por este motivo que el cliente requiere el crédito, para la compra de madera para realizar muebles, es muy trabajador y responsable siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecido con la institución por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Vicente works in carpentry. He has the necessary machines to do the work. He needs the material to make the orders he has in his work. He has a lot of experience in his work. He has been doing it for five years. With this work he is able to support his family and educate his children. Sometimes they help him finish his work. However, he does not now have the wood to finish an important job that has come up, and he needs to fill the orders. That is why he needs the loan to buy wood to make furniture. He is very hard-working and responsible. He is always thinking of his family’s well-being. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their trust by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Feliuai

texts.en: Feliuai A. is 28 and married with four children who ages range from 2 to 8 years. She plants and harvests taro for sale. Feliuai has two years of experience in this business. Feliuai needs a loan of 1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2009, Feliuai joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Feliuai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Sandra Gricelda Julisa

texts.es: Sandra tiene 20 años de edad, ella es soltera y vive con sus padres, estudia su ultimo año de maestra de educacion primaria. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de tacos al pastor, ella despues de estudiar vende todas las tardes en el mercado, de Tecpan, su hermano lo ayuda con la venta. El sueño de Sandra es ser una empresaria exitosa, como sus padres, ya que ellos se dedican al comercio, por esa razon solicita el prestamo a Fape para poder comprar una carreta mas para la venta de cheveres ya que ha prosperado y siente la nesecidad de una herramienta mas. Sandra le da gracias a Dios y a Fape por el apoyo que le han brindado atravez del credito
texts.en:
Sandra, 20, is single and lives with her parents. She is in the last year of Elementary School Teacher Training. Her parents support her efforts. For the last three years she has sold “tacos al pastor” in the evening every day after school in Tecpan’s market; her brother helps with sales. [Tacos al pastor, made the traditional way on a spit (like gyros), typically involves a layering of thin-sliced pork leg with red chile marinade (and, occasionally, sliced onion) topped with a whole, peeled pineapple]. Sandra’s dream is to be a successful businesswoman like her parents who are merchants. For that reason she is asking FAPE for a loan to buy another sales cart to sell hotdogs because she’s done well and feels the need to add another tool. Sandra thanks God and FAPE for the support they’ve given her through the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a hotdog cart.

loans.name: Raponsel

texts.en:
Raponsel O. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. Raponsel owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Raponsel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Raponsel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raponsel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Raponsel is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Raponsel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

La señora  Ana tiene 10 años en el Banco Comunal, le gusta porque siempre es fácil conseguir los créditos. Tiene 56 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo 7 hijos los cuales ya todas son mayores de edad, ninguno de sus hijos vive con ella, solo un nieto que es como su propio hijo la acompaña, su marido es taxista.

Tiene un negocio de cabinas telefónicas y venta de comidas rápidas, tiene su negocio hace tres años y le ha ido bien ya que en el sector es la única, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 23h00, trabaja sola y comparte su tiempo de trabajo con los del hogar ya que su negocio está en la casa que ella alquila,  en la actualidad está construyendo su casa.

Este crédito es para surtir más su negocio para servir mejor a sus clientes. Su sueño es terminar su casa y poner su negocio allí para no pagar alquiler.
texts.en:
There are records of Picoaza as one of the aboriginal villages of the Manta people. This urban parish, located just ten minutes from Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabi province, is filled with stories and it's where the Maria Asuncion loan group meets every couple of weeks. 

Ana has been a member of the loan group for 10 years. She likes it because it is always easy to obtain a loan. She is 56 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has had 7 children. All of them are now grown up and none of them live with her, just a nephew who is like a son to her. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

She owns a telephone booth and a fast food business. She has had it for three years and things are going well because she is the only one in this segment. She works every day from 8am to 11pm. She works on her own, and spends her working day with her landlords, because her business is located in the house she rents out. She is currently having her own house built.

The loan is to buy stock for her business so she can better serve her customers. Her dream is to finish her house and install her business there so she does not have to pay rent.

loans.use: Buy groceries.

loans.name: Frida

texts.es: Frida es una mujer honesta de 36 años, que vive con Néstor de 36 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos pero solo viven con dos de ellos; Kevin, de 10 y Joel, de 2 años; los cuatro viven en la selva central (comunidad nativa pumpuriani). Como jefa de la comunidad nativa, Frida se encarga de las contrataciones de los terrenos de cultivo, ya que la principal actividad de sus pobladores es la siembra de plátanos y café. Hace ya 12 años que viene sembrando maíz híbrido, plátano y café, por ello siempre esta constantemente cuidando sus plantaciones, de esa manera asegura que sus plantas crezcan fuertes y nutritivas; “tienes que trabajar todos los días”, asegura. Sus cuidados han hecho que sus cultivos sean de calidad, y hasta los mismos comercializadores visitan sus terrenos agrícolas para comprar sus cosechas. Pero no solo a eso se dedica Frida, instaló una pequeña bodega de comestibles donde vende productos de primera necesidad, asimismo ofrece bebidas heladas, ya que el fuerte calor y la lejanía del lugar, hacen que adquiera mayores ganancias. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y como presidenta de su banco comunal agradece el apoyo que reciben sus miembros. Frida, tiene pensado invertir el crédito en el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones de café, ya que tiene 2 hectáreas de terreno de cultivo, con los cuales podrá sembrar mayor cantidad.
texts.en: Frida is an honest woman who is 36 years old; she lives with Nestor who is 36 years old, with whom she has four children, but they only with with two of them: Kevin, 10, and Joel, 2. The four of them live in the central jungle (native Pumpuriani community). As head of her native community, Frida is in charge of contracting on the farm lands, since the main activity for the residents is planting plantains and coffee. For 12 years, now, she has been planting hybrid corn, plantains, and coffee. To maintain the quality of her products, she constantly cares for them because if she doesn't cut back the weeds her plantations won't be able to grow strong and nourished. "You have to work every day," she says. Her work has made it so her plants are quality, so sellers visit her farmlands to buy her harvests. Frida doesn't just do farming, though. She set up a small store where she sells basic-needs items as well as cold drinks. The strong heat and remoteness of the place make it so she has good revenue. This is her fifth loan through Kiva partner MFP, and as president of her communal bank, she is thankful for the support that the bank members receive. Frida is planning to invest her loan in the maintenance of her plantations. She opened two hectares of farmland, and she is sure she will be able to plant more.

loans.use: Care for her coffee plantations

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a member of the Communal Bank "Great Power," located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, and in the department of Puno. She is 30 years old, and a single mother with one child.  She studied until the third year of her secondary education. 

Rita has worked with Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN to increase her working capital to expand the merchandise in her grocery selling business.

She is asking for a loan for 1,000 PEN, to buy consumables such as rice and potatoes, and other things she needs to prepare food.  Her dream is to have a hardware store in addition to her current business.

loans.use: Purchase rice, potatoes and other items to sell more food.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era muy pequeña, esta trabajadora mujer se dedicaba a la agricultura, hoy la siembra de maíz, arveja y papa, son una de sus principales actividades. Le gusta mucho su labor de campo, esta muy acostumbrada a levantarse muy temprano para dirigirse a sus campos y cuidar de sus cultivos, ya que sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación puede  producir en abundancia. Por otro lado, cuenta con clientes fijos, que siempre le compran la mercadería, una vez cosechada y llevada a los mercados, de esa manera se genera buenas ganancias que le alcanza y aporta en la economía de su familia, además de poder tanto ella como su esposo brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Como es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene pensado en el futuro sembrar en mayor cantidad para que pueda vender más. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y abono para su temporada de siembra .
texts.en:
Bertha, age 38, lives with her husband and their two children in her own house.  Ever since she was very small this hard-working woman has been farming.  She now grows corn, peas, and potatoes.  The crops are her main business activity.  She really likes to work in the fields.  She is very used to getting up very early to go to the fields and taking care of her crops.  She knows that with much effort and dedication she is able to produce in abundance.

She has fixed customers who always buy her merchandise once it is harvested and taken to the markets.  This is the way that she generates good income, which contributes to the family financially.  Also, she and her husband are able to give their children a better quality of life.

As she is a hard-working woman, in the future she plans to plant more in order to be able to sell more.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  Also, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank, where all of the members are responsible and very supportive.  She is grateful to all of the people who will be the lenders of the loan she is requesting.  It will be very useful to the progress of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the planting season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for corn, peas, and potatoes for the next planting season

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes P. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Agnes is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Agnes owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, her income comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk food to the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP.

In 2010, Agnes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Agnes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON  DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Elias; el tiene 32 años de edad y es soltero; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio de taxi,el trabaja todos los días desde las 06:00am hasta las 08:00pm como también puede variar su horario, el socio se dedica solo a este negocio por el momento y espera poder en el futuro comprar otro carro. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento del carro y para algunos accesorios también.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Patron de Santiago".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Elias, 32 years old and single.  He divides his time between his daily chores and providing a taxi service.  He works every day from 6AM until 8PM., even though he could vary his schedule.  Currently, this is the only business that he is in and he hopes to be able to buy another car in  the future.

He is requesting the loan for the maintenance of his car and also for some accessories.

The member is happy to get the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: The associate requests the loan for the maintenance of his car and also for some accessories.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: T. Fred is an individual client from Kyenjojo. He is 35 years old and married with three children, all of them in school. Fred is involved in agriculture where he grows and sells Irish potatoes, beans, maize, matooke and so on while some of this produce he buys from other farmers for sale from Rutabo in Bwizi. His customers are daily transporters from Kampala and he is able to make 40,000/= as weekly profits. He is also involved in cattle selling; all self initiated and motivated businesses. Fred needs a loan to be able to purchase more produce for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing more produce for resale.

loans.name: Maria Dolli

texts.es:
María Dolly es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en una zona marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona bastante comercial situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella cría aves de corral en su domicilio, las engorda con granos y alimento balanceado y cuando ya han obtenido un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona y con el público en general. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Dolly is a 42 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in a marginalized area of the District of Lambayeque. This commercial area is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

María Dolly works by raising and selling small animals. She raises poultry from her home, fattening them with grain and balanced feed. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, she sells them to merchants who frequently visit the area and to the general public. This business is an important source of income to support her family’s finances, so she always tries to care for her animals in the best way possible.

María wants to expand her business by purchasing more animals and balanced feed so that she can increase her sales and generate more income. To keep growing, she is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase more animals & balanced feed

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita D. is from the community of Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She is a rice farmer and she has been doing this business for 16 years.

She has three children. Her eldest is 15 years old. It is her hope to continue her business and earn a bigger income. In that way, she will be able to support her children in paying their school fees.

Receiving a loan from CEVI will help her buy fertilizers and seeds. She chose CEVI because of the good program they have in helping farmers like her grow their harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Mary Ansah Ekua

texts.en: Mary Ansah Ekua G. sells corn in Dompoase, near Elmina, Cape Coast. Corn is typically used in the preparation of banku and kenkey, staples in the Ghanaian diet. Mary Ansah has been selling corn in both small and large quantities for ten years. She is married to a farmer and they have six children. Her income contributes to their children’s schooling and to their household expenses. With so many mouths to feed, Mary Ansah’s goal is to increase her income by developing her business. The loan will help her purchase more maize and also diversify to other food products.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and other food products

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia ; la socia tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica a la agricultura ella siembra verduras para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva su mercadería a vender a las distintas ferias que se encuentran en el Valle Sagrado y en el mercado de Huancaro de Cusco, a la vez la socia también compra otro tipo de verduras y frutas que no tiene para tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes ,también cuenta con un camión donde ella lleva todas sus cosechas para ser vendidas a sus clientes, la socia es una persona bien emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia .

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para su chacra y para el mantenimiento de su camión.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the Los Angeles Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.  Julia is 34 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.

Julia devotes herself to farming.  She grows vegetables to later distribute to her customers who request them.    She takes her merchandise to sell at different fairs in the Valle Sagrado and to the Huancaro Market in Cusco.  She also buys other types of vegetables and fruits that she does not have in order to have a better variety of products to offer her customers.  She also has a truck she uses to transport all of her harvests to be sold to her customers.

She is a very enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead for her family’s sake.  She is requesting the loan to buy seeds for her farm and for maintenance for her truck.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her farm and for maintenance for her truck

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina N. S. lives in the Kisenyi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Regina has a retail shop business. She has run this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week. Regina has requested a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.
Regina also earns additional income by selling milk. Her main business challenge is seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to extend the business and sell her goods wholesale. Regina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence M. is a 46 year old married lady with one child who is 20 years old. She is a second-hand clothes seller in a market known as Gikomba in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last 11 years and she is able to make a profit of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

Florence joined KADET LTD as a new client a few months ago and she has applied for her first loan which she plans to use to add more stock of the second hand clothes for resale. She anticipates that she will get profits which she will plough back into the business and also save some to invest in real estate. 

She has a desire to be a real investor in real estate in future.

loans.use: buying more clothes stock

loans.name: Miguel Vicente

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el sector Caja de Deposito, una zona que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Chiclayo, capital de la Región de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la ingeniera  mecánica eléctrica desde hace un año y medio. Trabaja como coordinador de remodelación de redes de tensión. Actualmente, la casa de Miguel se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea realizar algunos arreglos en su vivienda y solventar algunos gastos personales. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Miguel es una persona responsable y dedicada a su trabajo y su familia a fin de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel is 26 years old, single and lives with his parents in the Caja de Deposito sector, which is located in the district of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque Region.

He has been working in electrical mechanical engineering for a year and a half, as tension line upgrade coordinator.  Miguel wants to renovate his home and take care of personal expenses.  That is why he decided to apply for a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Miguel is responsible and works to provide a better lifestyle for his family.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Julianita

texts.en:
Julianita is 54 years old and married with five children.  With one child still in school, Julianita works very hard to provide for her family.

Julianita runs a dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like umbrellas, slippers, bags, etc., to sell in her store.

Julianita has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as umbrellas, bags, t-shirts, sandals, etc. In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more umbrellas, slippers, bags, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ronna Mae

texts.en:
Ronna Mae G. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 22 years old, single and has 1 infant. Ronna Mae owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, buying and selling daily use products such as canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Ronna Mae has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Ronna Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronna Mae is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods and beverages. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ronna Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods and beverages.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu is 42, married, and has four children aged 20, 17, 14 and 8. In 2006, Kadiatu established her business selling foods such as garri (a staple made from cassavas), bulgur, groundnuts, salt and beans. She started this business to help support her husband provide livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week, 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to help her buy more food stuffs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to embark on an international business and educate her children to university level. The current inflation level is her major business challenge. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more foods to sell

loans.name: Sehouegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEHOUEGNON est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ablavi Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ablavi Pierrette est née le 12 janvier 1967 dans une ville du Bénin. Ablavi Pierrette est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses enfants. Ablavi Pierrette  a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à sa charge. Ablavi Pierrette n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Ablavi Pierrette mène comme activité la vente de condiments de sauce (tomates, oignons, etc.). De façon secondaire, Ablavi Pierrette vend divers produits (lait, etc.) et du maïs depuis neuf ans. Ablavi Pierrette s’approvisionne au Bénin et vend ses produits à son domicile. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ablavi  Pierrette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEHOUEGNON, un troisième  crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group SEHOUEGNON consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. Pierrette Ablavi, the group’s representative, is seen in the photo with her hand raised. She was born January 12, 1969 in a city of Benin. She is a widow, and lives alone with her three dependent children who all attend school. Pierrette herself never received formal schooling. 

To support herself and her children, Pierrette sells sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, etc.) and as a sideline, she also sells various items such as milk and maize. She has been engaged in this activity for nine years. She gets her stock in Benin and conducts her sales from her home. 

In order to meet the needs of her customers and increase her profits and revenue, Pierrette Ablavi is seeking a third loan together with the other members of the SEHOUEGNON group. All previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy baskets of tomatoes, sacks of maize and cartons of milk for resale

loans.name: Channel Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "CHANNEL". Está ubicado en Puebla, en México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Ma D. los Angeles es integrante del grupo, ella tiene 44 (años), estudió hasta el primer año D. primaria y es comerciante. Ella elabora y venD. donas y empanadas en su comunidad afuera D. las escuelas y en diferentes lugares, es casada , inicio el negocio hace 4 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra D. insumos como (azucar, leche, harina D. trigo y huevos etc.) para la elaboración D. su producto y así comprar en cantidades más grandes y a mejor precio, ya que ha tenido mucha demanda y tiene pensado contrar a una persona que le ayuD. para brindar un mejor servicio. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente con mas animos D. seguir adelante y muy contenta por la oportunidad D. adquirir este prestamo para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida y apoyar en los gastos familiares.
texts.en: This communal bank is named “Channel” it is maD. up of 10 people and located in Puebla, México. Mrs. Ma D. los Angeles is a member; she is 44 years old, studied up to first graD. and is a salesperson. She works selling doughnuts and wraps in her neighborhood outsiD. of schools and in other places. Mrs. Ma D. los Angeles  is married and has been in this traD. for 4 years. She needs the loan to buy supplies like sugar, milk, wheat flour, eggs and other items to make her products, and to buy in greater quantities to have better prices. She has had a lot of demand for her goods and is thinking of hiring someone to help her give better service to her customers. At the time of asking for the loan she is even more optimistic about getting ahead as well as being very happy for the opportunity of receiving this loan to give her family a better quality of life and to help meet the household expenses.

loans.use: buy supplies like sugar, milk, wheat flour, eggs and other items.

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
Sarah Jane works hard to support her family. Sarah Jane is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 20 years.

Sarah Jane requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.  In the future, Sarah Jane would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, 57 years of age, is married, and blessed with five children. She's engaged in selling fruits and vegetables in their village. She's been doing this business for almost 20 years. Her net income a month is 8,500 PHP. She's asking a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional fruits/vegetables to sell even in other villages. She hopes that lenders will continue assisting her in the business so that she can further improve it and support her family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a resident of Nyamira town where she carries out her farming business producing maize, beans and vegetables which she sells on the local market. She is married with three children, two of whom are schooling.

Joyce has made a loan request for 26,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy business will earn her income and enable her to educate the remaining child. She adds that she wants to start a tailoring business in future.

Joyce says animal diseases and low market prices for the produce are the challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 59-year-old married man with six children who lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. His dream is to educate his children to higher levels of learning. Joseph distills alcohol (local Gin). He has been in this business for 25 years. His major challenge has been price fluctuations of the gin due to competition. Joseph needs the loan to distill alcohol.

loans.use: to distill alcohol.

loans.name: Laura Beatriz

texts.es: Laura de 22 años vive en el municipio de Soledad a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene una hija de 5 años que es su mayor motor para trabajar persistentemente, con tal de lograr su bienestar. Laura en su vivienda tiene un negocio donde vende pasabocas y dulces en general, actividad en la que tenía experiencia, pues había sido empleada de una dulcería y cuando quedó sin trabajo tomó su liquidación y emprendió su propia fuente de ingresos. Su familia ha sido su mas grande apoyo para lograr salir adelante con su pequeña hija y para ahora emprender metas, que en el futuro logren un impacto positivo en su desempeño como persona de bien y exitosa, tal como sueña verla. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que Laura hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará en mayor volumen dulces, pasabocas, con el fin de obtener descuentos por la compra de contado y ofrecer estos productos de manera competitiva y generadora de ingresos. Su mayor desafío es el escaso capital de trabajo para lograrlo, pero espera que con su fuerza de trabajo y su credikiva, inicie su ascenso hacia el éxito de esta inversión, pues en la actualidad maneja un margen de utilidad del 26% y con su reinversión logrará  un mayor capital rotando.
texts.en:
Laura is 22 and lives in the town of Soledad which is 15 minutes from Barranquilla.  She has a 5-year-old daughter who is her main reason for working persistently toward a better lifestyle.  Laura sells snacks and sweets for a living and does this from her home.  She has experience in the activity because she used to work for a candy shop.  When she lost her job she used the severance pay to set up her own source of income.  Her family has been her greatest support in helping her and her daughter get ahead, while encouraging her to take on new challenges for their positive impact on her as a responsible, successful person, which is what they hope she will be.

This credkiva is Laura's first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy larger quantities of sweets and snacks and to pay in cash, which will translate into greater discounts.  This way she will be able to offer her products at more competitive prices, thereby generating more income.  Her greatest challenge now is having enough working capital.  But with hard work and this loan she hopes to become successful.  Currently she has a profit margin of 26% which, once reinvested, will increase her capital.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of sweets and snacks.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit and vegetables for her fruit and vegetable vending business.

Jesusa has been in this business for nine years. Jesusa earns more income from buying and selling charcoal and firewood and pig fattening.

Jesusa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Roci Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Roci es socia D. banco comunal Siete Estrellas D. Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 42 años D. edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Se dedica a la venta D. mercaderías como ropas, balsos, carteras, zapatos, en estos momentos no cuenta con mercaderías porque todo lo ha colocado entre sus clientes y espera que pase la huelga que hay en la zona para poder ir a traer más mercadería a la ciudad D. lima.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/ 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 6 carteras, 10 pares D. zapato, 5 bolsos, 12 polos para hombres.
Este nuevo préstamo le va servir para completar el capital necesario para traer más mercadería, su esposo es trabajador independiente y comparten los gastos.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos ahora tiene independencia económica.
texts.en: Roci is a member of Siete Estrellas (Six Stars) community bank in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali, Peru. She is 42 years old, married and has a son. She makes a living selling products like clothing, handbags, wallets and shoes. At this time she doesn't have any supplies because everything has been claimed by her customers, and she hopes that the strike in her area passes so she will be able to bring in more products from the city of Lima. With this loan, Roci plans to purchase six wallets, 10 pairs of shoes, five handbags and 12 men's polos. This loan will give her the necessary capital to bring in more merchandise. Her husband is self-employed, and they share the household expenses. Thanks to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos now Roci has economic independence.

loans.use: to purchase six wallets, 10 pairs of shoes, five handbags and 12 men's polos.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Thea, 32 years old, resides in Siem Reap, a province that is known for ancient temples and tourism. She is a gas exchanger and earns $7 per day. Her husband is a food seller who earns $10 per day. She has three children, two are studying and one is too young to attend school. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $7 on electricity, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy gas cans for exchange with her customers. Before, she helped her husband selling food, but she wants to have another career that can make additional income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy gas cans for exchange with her customers

loans.name: Beyoglan

texts.ru:
Beyoglan ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzili qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Makhmudlu vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Beyoglan 22 qoda. On uje 2 qoda kak imeyet eto kafe.
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stoli i stulya dlya svayego kafe chtobi on mog obslujivat bolshe kliyentov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi kotoriy toje imeyet svayo kafe uje 11 let. Beyoglan okonchil shkolu i ushel v armiyu i kak vernulsya s armii nachal rabotat chtobi soderjat sebya i pomogat svoyey semye.
texts.en: Beyoglan is not married and does not have children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzili and now lives in the Makhmudlu village of the Fuzili region with his family.  Beyoglan is 22 years old.  He has had this cafe for two years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy tables and chairs for his cafe, so that he could serve more customers.  Beyoglan learned this business from his uncle, who has had his own cafe for 11 years.  Beyoglan finished school and went to the army, and started working right after returning from the army in order to provide for himself and help his family.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for his cafe

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is 53 years old. She is married and has six adult children.

Josephina has a "sari-sari", or variety, store which sells different food items such as biscuits, bread, junk food and chips. She has had this business for five years.

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more stock for her variety store like additional biscuits, junk food and chips, as well powdered juice drinks.

Josephina joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional food items such as biscuits, junk food, bread and powdered juice drinks, which are intended for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jacinta Pamela

texts.es:
Jacinta Pamela es socia nueva y participa en el banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Jacinta Pamela nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 21 años de edad, ella trabaja como administradora de una empresa de venta de celulares móviles. Ya son seis meses que se dedica al trabajo y le va muy bien gracias al desempeño laboral que pone en la empresa.  Jacinta Pamela y su mama tienen un negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de artesanía de tipo cerámica y platería.   

Jacinta Pamela requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo alambre de plata y otras cosas más.

Jacinta Pamela se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Jacinta Pamela is a new and participative member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Las Palmeras” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Jacinta Pamela was born in Cusco and is 21 years old.  She works as a manager at a mobile phone sales firm.  She’s been in her job for six months and does well thanks to the work effort she puts into the firm.  Jacinta Pamela and her mother have a family business consisting in selling ceramic and silver crafts.  Jacinta Pamela needs the loan to buy supplies like silver wire, for example, and other things.  Jacinta Pamela is grateful for the opportunity given her through this means and commits to make her installment payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies like silver wire and other things.

loans.name: Ayudanos Senor 3 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Cleotilde is the coordinator of her group, Ayudanos Senor (Help Us, Lord) 3 & 7, a group made up of mostly Haitian citizens. They are located in the city of La Romana, where decades ago Haitians emigrated to work in the sugarcane industry. They all live in a rural community outside of the main city. This kind of communities are called Batey, which are villages founded for sugarcane workers.

Cleotilde and her long-term partner make their home here in a simple structure with their three children. Their community is "a Batey", where most of the people live without services and where it is necessary to go to a closer city to get everything they want.

Cleotilde's excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has been running her business for almost three years. She started investing in calling cards when many people bought prepaid cellphones because they need to buy calling cards to recharge their mobile credits, and over time she started buying clothes to sell. Since this happened, she has been dedicated to vending clothes and calling cards, and she is also adding other products like shoes and cosmetics. 

She will use this loan to purchase clothing, shoes, and miscellaneous products. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Mugwagwa1 Group

texts.en:
Kerita is 27 years old, single, and has one child, aged 7, who attends school. She has been in business for 2 years and has no employees. She sells clothes and shoes and buys her products from Botswana. Her business is situated at the local market in town. She has no other dependents besides her child, and no other source of income.

She faces the challenge of counterfeit notes, brought by some customers, which is a loss to the business. She would like to own various shops around the country. This loan will help her improve her home and provide for her child's needs.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha de 34 anos, vive na casa própria com sua familia e responsabiliza se pela sua irmã e neta que vivem com ela, Consegue poupar  1.000.00mt por mes.
É  proprietària de um salão de cabelaria na sua residência onde faz tratamento de cabelos a homens e mulheres, trabalha das 7h as 20h conta com ajuda de dois trabalhadores  que  auferem ambos  1.500.00mt mensalmente.  Para alêm do salão e também  é docente e passa a maior parte do tmpo no trabalho.  com o ordenado que  ganha  aplica nas dispesas da casa. Tem tido um rendimento de 4.000.00mt, este  é seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende adquirir mais produtos para satisfazer a sua clientela nesta  quedra festiva.
Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros créditos e remodelar o seu salão dando mais conforto aos seus clientes.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Namaacha. She's 34 years old and lives with her family in a house she owns. She is responsible for her sister and her granddaughter who live with her. She is able to save 1.000mt a month.
She owns a hair salon that she runs from her home. She provides hair treatment for men and women and works from 7a.m. to 8p.m. She gets help from two workers who both earn 1.500mt a month. Apart from that, she is a teacher and spends most of her time at work. She uses her salary to pay for home expenses. She has been getting an income of 4.000mt.
This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 15.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase more products in order to satisfy her customers during this festive season. She is confident that she will be able to repay in advance so she can get other loans and renovate her salon in order to provide more comfort for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria tiene 38 años es casada vive con el esposo y con los  hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas en el Reciento Campo Alegre.

Esta ventanilla SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, cerca de la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Ana Maria se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace 5 años, herencia de los padres,  las compras las realizan en comercial Jiménez de la ciudad de ventanas y las vende en la misma ciudad.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para el cuidado de los cultivos, además le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia. Sueño es tener una casa.

Le gusta arreglar la casa y descansar.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 38 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre in the canton of Ventanas.

The San Jacinto Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre, which is near the parish of Guare in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Ana Maria is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for five years. She learned this trade from her parents. Her purchases are made at the Jiménez Commericial Center in the city of Ventanas and she sells her products in the same city. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and composts for taking care of her crops. This will also help increase her family’s income. Her dream is to have a house.

Ana Maria enjoys remodeling her house and relaxing. Le gusta arreglar la casa y descansar.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and composts.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad, 51, lives in Quezon City, Philippines. She is married, has one child and earns a living by running a small convenience store where she sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to people who live in her neighborhood. She earns at least PHP 500 a day and is applying for a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her dream is to earn enough money to give her family a good life, and to help do this she meets regularly with her co-fellowship* members to share work tips and study religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet weekly to study religion, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
DRISSA  est âgé de 42 ans et vit avec ses dix enfants et ses époux à DONGORONA dans la sous-préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Région de KOULIKORO.
DRISSA  n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il  a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le quatrième prêt il est à son cinquième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 6 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de DONGORONA et environnants qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
DRISSA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans les activités d’achat vente de céréales.

loans.use: Achat de céréales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock and also purchase some bulls for cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the loan to purchase bicycle repair tools.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Neli sells perfumes, cosmetics, and lingerie. She began her business with the help of her brother, who gave her the merchandise she needed to get started. At first she sold only children’s clothing. Now she sells children’s clothing and also perfumes and lingerie. Neli wants to sell all kinds of clothing along with things for the home, like irons and pressure cookers, which are the types of things her customers ask her for. She will use the loan to invest in buying merchandise at whole-sale prices. She is certain that with these new products, her business will grow. Neli is the mother of two children. She is 37 years old and it has been very difficult for her to help her family get ahead. Her business is the only source of income for her household. Neli has the hope that this loan will give her financial security and allow her to save up for her children’s education and to continue building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.
