Neli es comerciante de perfumes, cosméticos y lencería. Neli empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su hermano quien le dio mercadería para que empezara su negocio. Al principio solo vendía ropa de niños . Ahora el continúa ofreciendo ropa de niños junto con perfumes y lencería. Neli aspira vender todo tipo de ropa junto con articulos para el hogar como planchas y ollas de presión es lo que solicitan sus clientes. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir comprando mercadería al por mayor. Ella tiene la seguridad de que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecerá. Neli es madre de dos hijos. Ella tiene 37 años le ha sido muy duro salir adelante con su familia. Su negocio es la única fuente de ingreso en el hogar. Heli tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera y pueda permitirle ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos y poder seguir construyendo su casa.

loans.use: To buy clothing and household articles at whole-sale prices

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
It's so beautiful when one steps into the orange field of Mrs Lê Thị Tĩnh, a 44 years old married woman. Over 4 acres of land filled with beautiful green orange trees in full bloom. There's a fish pond in the middle of the field. The sheer beauty of the scenery would make you forget about the heat of the summer. Mrs Lê Thị Tĩnh and her husband, Mr Vũ Văn Thanh, had been working very hard on their land for the last 4 months. Their 15 years old daughter had also been helping them out after school. The revenue from selling the oranges is about 62 USD a month. Mrs Lê Thị Tĩnh is requesting a loan of 450 USD to buy gardening tools and manure which would help her expand her orange business and bringing more revenue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

Thật tuyệt vời khi bước vào vườn cam nhà chị Lê Thị Tĩnh, 44 tuổi. Trên 4 sào đất phủ một màu xanh ngắt của những cây cam với những cành cây trĩu quả. Giữa vườn cây là một ao cá, khung cảnh có thể làm cho bạn cảm thấy bớt nóng hơn dưới cái nắng mùa hè. Để đạt được thành quả này chị Tĩnh và chồng chị, anh Vũ Văn Thanh đã làm việc chăm chỉ trong suốt 4 tháng qua. Cô con gái 15 tuổi ngoài những giờ đi học cũng tích cực giúp đỡ bố mẹ chăm sóc vườn cây. Vườn cam này mang lại cho anh chị thu nhập bình quân hơn 1 triệu/ tháng. Hiện tại chị đang muốn vay thêm 450 USD để mua phân bón và dụng cụ lao động để cải tạo vườn cam tăng doanh thu.

loans.use: buy manure and gardening tools

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Angeline S. is a widow and a mother of two children who are in school. Paying house rents and school fees for her children was a difficult task for her so she sought for capital from GHAPE in order to start cultivating crops so she can sell and raise money for these expenses. Presently, she has been able to invest and repay about five loans and now requests a new one of $1200 with which to invest in the buying and selling of drug supplements and crop cultivation. These drug supplements are now being taken by most elderly in this area. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of drugs, clearing of farm, fertilizer

loans.name: Manuel Rolando

texts.es:
My name is Manuel R.. I provide transport services in my city Dali. I have an itinerary that goes through the city from Colonia Nuvea Esperanza to Danli's regional hospital. I've done this for three years since I'm retired and it is my only means of income. These days, I need to buy various parts for the motor and steering wheel of my bus to provide better service to passengers. I also make trips to the park during the weekends - this is another activity that generates a bit of income on the side. With the earnings I make, I can sustain my household.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Manuel R. me dedico a prestar servicios de tranportes de pasajestos en mi ciudad Danli, cuento con una ruta urbana de la Colonia Nueva Esperanza al Hospital Regional de Danli, actividad que realizo hace tres años, ya que soy una persona jubilada y es mi unico ingreso monetario, en estos momentos necesito comprar varios repuestos del motor y la direccion de mi bus para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes, tambien hago viajes a parques los fines de semana y esta es otra actividad que me genera un poco mas de ingresos, con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi hogar.

loans.use: To buy auto parts

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina, 46, owns a yam stand at the Kantamento market in Kasoa and a fresh foods store in front of her home. When she is at the market, her children take care of the store in front of her house. Georgina has four children. The two younger ones are still in school. She plans to use her profits to support them through their education.

Yam is a root used in many traditional Ghanaian dishes. You are likely to have it daily in Ghana, whether it is in fou-fou, yam balls, palava dishes, or just plain yams. The loan will allow Georgina to purchase more yams for both her store in the market and the store in front of her house. Eventually Georgina would like to expand the space she has at the market, but it is relatively expensive, with each stall costing approximately $325.

Georgina is a member of the lending group, Faith. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing yams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of tires to sell

loans.name: Fortunata's Group

texts.en:
Fortunata, Gudelia, and Pamela belong to the community bank “Cielo”. Fortunata and Gudelia have been members for six years; Pamela joined four months ago. In that time they have learned about saving, punctuality, and responsibility.

Fortunata is forty and has three children. She transports children to school. She started this business two years ago. Previously, she sold shoes and clothing at the market. A few years ago Fortunata had a very difficult pregnancy and was unable to work for an extended period of time. She decided to start the transportation business with a loan from the community bank because it gave her an opportunity to work without putting too much stress in her body.

Gudelia is 62 years old. She has four children all of whom are successful. One child is a police officer, one is an engineer, another is a secretary, and the oldest is an administrator for the regional government. Gudelia has owned a small grocery store for many years. In the past she traveled to different markets buying and selling her products, but now she has been able to open a store in an established location.

Pamela is 24 years old and has two young children. She makes and sells a variety of breads. The most popular is the regional specialty chapla, which is similar to pita bread. She is planning to open a fast food cart where she would sell salchipapa - potatoes topped with meat and egg.

Fortunata, Gudelia, and Pamela need loans of 400, 1200, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy auto parts, flour, sugar, fruits, pasta, milk, and a food cart.

An important aspect of the community bank is that each associate has an interest-earning savings account. Fortunata, Gudelia, and Pamela plan to use their savings to buy furniture for their homes, in case of an emergency of unexpected cost, and to buy a van that would be used to transport bread to different regions respectively.

Their dreams are to move to Lima, continue to develop their business, get married, to own a car, and a house. Gudelia smiled and said what she would really like to do is own an airplane.

loans.use: Fortunata, Gudelia, and Pamela need loans of 400, 1200, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy auto parts, flour, sugar, fruits, pasta, milk, and a food cart.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem R., 49, is married with six children and works as farmer earning around $1 a day.  Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver typically earning $1 a day.  Three of their daughters work as hairdressers in Phnom Penh city while the other children are students and sometimes help their parents to do the house work. The family hopes to borrow $500 to purchase a motor-bike to run a taxi to generate more revenue for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for their taxi.

loans.name: Faith's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Faith is 34 years old and is a single woman. Faith owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2002. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Faith has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tatu, who has a business dealing in charcoal selling.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Silvano

texts.en:
Silvano C. is a single, 53-year-old man who has two sons living in Spain. Paraguayans tend to emigrate from Paraguay to countries such as Spain and Argentina in order to generate more income than they can in Paraguay. According to such people, there is no other solution than to migrate to other countries because they cannot find jobs in Paraguay. Consequently, remittances from those who have moved to other countries are a very important source of income to the people of Paraguay.

The need to help his parents generate more income led Silvano to start working as a child. Fifteen years ago he decided to open a despensa (grocery store) in his neighborhood, and his despensa has grown substantially over the years. In the future, Silvano plans to expand his despensa and convert it into a mini supermarket.

Silvano is now seeking a loan in order to purchase products for the despensa, including: milk, sugar, pasta, drinks and other such goods. With the additional income he expects to generate from sales as a result of the requested loan, Silvano believes that he could provide his sons with a good education and that he could build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for his ever-growing despensa (grocery store) such as milk, sugar, pasta, and drinks.

loans.name: Pedro Ramon

texts.es:
The Villanueva district in the city of Chinandega is known as a cattle-raising area in Nicaragua. Pedro Gómez has a cattle raising business in Villanueva, where he feeds and cares for the animals he owns, with the goal of maximizing their value and selling them. Pedro’s current goal is to expand his business by purchasing oxen and raising them. He has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan for this purpose. The loan will enable the purchase of these oxen, which is necessary for Pedro to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega se caracteriza por ser una zona muy ganadera en el país de Nicaragua. El señor Pedro Gómez se dedica al negocio de ganadería en el municipio de Villanueva teniendo sus propios animales los cuales los alimenta y desarrolla con el fin de sacarles el máximo provecho para luego comercializarlos. Este caballero actualmente su meta es aumentar el negocio por medio de la compra de bueyes para desarrollo. Es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual lograr la compra y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio que tanto necesita de la compra de estos animales.

loans.use: Purchase of oxen

loans.name: Ndèye Khady

texts.fr:
Ndèye Khady C. is single and has been a member of the Bignona Water Tower village bank for the last four and a half years. She takes care of two children whose schooling, clothing, and health costs she pays for. She buys clothes, vegetables, and dried fish in Dakar to retail in Bignona. The vegetables are sold in the market. She wants to strengthen her business to increase her income. Ndèye Khady is seeking a loan that will be repaid with a single payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Ndèye Khady C., célibataire est membre du banc villageois de Château d’eau Bignona depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle a la charge de 02 enfants pour qui elle paie les frais de scolarité, de santé et d’habillement. Elle achète à Dakar des habits, des légumes et des poissons secs pour revendre à Bignona. Les légumes sont vendus au marché. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour augmenter ses revenus Ndèye Khady sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Retail clothing, vegetables, and dried fish

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 24 years old, single and for the last year has made a living as a food vendor, selling mostly chips or french fries. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mariam has applied for a loan to buy more supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies for her business.

loans.name: Saem

texts.en:
This is the second time Mr. Saem C. is asking for a loan to improve his business. He is a construction worker and pig breeder in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.

Previously, Mr. Saem C. obtained a loan to start his pig breeding business and he has fully paid it back. Since his business is going well, Mr. Saem C. wants to expand it so he has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to raise.

His wife, Mrs. Um Sean, owns a small rice field for cultivating rice and vegetables. Mr. Saem C. is 43 years old and the father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira K. is 44 year old and is married with two adorable daughters. Tahira raises cattle for meat production. She has been breeding cattle for about 10 years. Currently, she has three head of cattle in her household. The business is successful and generates a stable income, allowing Tahira to support her family. Her husband and daughters help Tahira look after the cattle. Also, her husband sells the cattle they raise at the local livestock bazaar. 

Now, she is planning to purchase more cattle. For this purpose, she requests $1000 USD. Borrowing for the first time, Tahira promises to be accurate when repaying the loan and thanks everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Ramzija

texts.en:
Ramzija was born in 1965 and lives in Doboj, a town in Bosnia. She is a widow with no children. She currently receives 300KM from the pension plan of her late-husband, which is equivalent to roughly $200USD. In a country where a quality vacuum cleaner costs 200KM, this pension income is barely enough for Ramzija to survive.

Ramzija requests a loan of 1,000KM from Women for Women International in order to buy chickens and food for the chickens. She hopes to raise them and re-sell them to her relatives and friends when they are adults. This is her first microfinance loan.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and food for chickens

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en: Mrs. Sovann T. is a married 34-year-old farmer in Svay Thom Village in Takeo Province. Her husband is Mr. Seang Sarin. On their farm they face a field which is infertile. Mrs. Sovann T. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers for the field. Mrs. Sovann T. has four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is only  three years old. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for the field

loans.name: Elizavet

texts.es: Elizavet tiene 47 años, vive con sus hijos. Desde hace 3 años decidió vender cosméticos, debido a que una amiga que la animó a seguir adelante a pesar de los problemas económicos, es así que cada día trabaja  caminando de casa en casa ofreciendo sus productos, nunca cesa de caminar para conseguir nuevas clientas, siempre en busca de contactos de confianza para obtener ganancias, por el record de ventas puede tener incentivos de la línea de cosméticos que ella ofrece, de esta manera Elizavet sostiene a sus hijos que están pequeños todavía. Es la segunda vez solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que ha demostrado ser puntual. La cantidad solicitada será invertida en la compra de cosméticos, además, en esta época navideña comprará al por mayor prendas de vestir para vender.
texts.en:
Elizavet is 47 years old and lives with her children. 3 years ago she decided to sell cosmetics as a friend of hers inspired her to continue on in spite of economic problems, so every day she worked walking from house to house offering her products. She never stopped walking to obtain new customers, always seeking additional contacts to obtain earnings. Because of her sales record she can have incentives from her cosmetic line that she offers, and in this way Elizavet supports her children who are still young. This is the second time she is seeking a loan with MFP, and she has shown to be punctual. The loan will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics, in addition during this Christmas season she will buy at wholesale clothing items to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and clothing to sell

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en:
Mamlakat I. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and their 4 children. She operates a business growing and selling garden produce like grapes. Thanks to help from her husband and their children, as well as her own dedication and persistence, the business has grown considerably, from uncultivated land to a large garden. Now Mamlakat is requesting 3200 Somoni ($ 925 USD). She will buy fertilizer and prepare her garden for the upcoming season so that she can provide the quality of produce that her customers expect. Let’s help this mother keep working for the well being of her family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Sinath

texts.en: Mrs. Sinath T. is a widow and a farmer in Lngeang village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and cassava, but she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work in her field. Thus, Mrs. Sinath T. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers for this purpose.

loans.use: To hire farm laborers.

loans.name: Irma Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora Irma F. se desempeña en su negocio de venta de piñatas para festividades vendidas en su propio establecimiento donde a diario llega mucha gente a hacer las compras al mercado y a la vez perciben el negocio de ella.

Actualmente ha decidido salir adelante por medio del negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de las piñatas y los mecates para su respectiva venta. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y logra mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y las de su amada familia a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
In the wholesale market of the city of Managua, Irma F. has a store where sells piñatas. Each day, all the people who come to shop at the market pass by and see her store. She has decided to try to get ahead by expanding her business. To do this, she has asked for a loan from Ceprodel to purchase piñatas and ropes to sell from her store. With she loan, she will benefit enormously and be able to improve the conditions of her business and the living conditions of her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase piñatas and ropes

loans.name: Magali Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Magali del Carmen R. Pérez tiene la edad de 39 años habita en las enramadas ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , es madre soltera ella tiene cuatro hijos dos de ellos ya son casado y dos que ella tiene a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ella desde hace ocho años se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio para poder cubrir la responsabilidad de sus pequeños , doña Magali inicio la actividad agrícola ya que sus padres le inculcaron trabajar la tierras que sus parientes le heredaron , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento , los planes hacia un futuro es diversificar con otros productos . Ella con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicárselo al cultivo.
texts.en:
Magali del Carmen R. Pérez is 39 years old and lives in Las Enramadas section of the city of Ticuantepe. Magali is a single mother of four children. Two of her children have already married, but the remaining two are still at home. Her plans for her family include improving their living conditions. For the past eight years Magali has devoted her time to agriculture and trade in order to carry out her responsibilities towards her little ones. She went into agriculture because her parents instilled in her working the land that she inherited from them. The biggest problem is a lack of financing. Magali is planning to branch out into other products and with this loan is going to buy fertilizer and agricultural supplies for her crop.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to improve her crop

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира молодая особа, которой 23 года, проживает в Сомгаре.Она не замужем, живёт вместе с пожилыми родителями.Её отец занимается откормом и продажей скота, у него 40 голов коз белого цвета.Шоира занимается производством и продажей козьей пряжи.Шоира хочет в кредит закупить ещё несколько десятков коз , пока скот дешёвый на рынке.
texts.en:
Shoira is a young woman, 23 years old, living in Somgar. She is not married and lives with her elderly parents. Her father works fattening and selling livestock. He has forty head of white goats. Shoira works making and selling yarn made of goat wool. Shoira wants to take out a loan to buy a few more goats while the market price for livestock is low.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying goats

loans.name: Sherozdjon

texts.ru: Шероз и его тетя (на фото)арендуют торговое место и занимаются продажей женской одежды и обуви. Шероз ездит за товаром, а тетя торгует. Ему 28 лет, имеет одного ребенка. Кроме торговли он работает в одной частной фирме. Шероз собирается прикупить весенний ассортимент обуви и поэтому подал заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Sheroz and his aunt (in photo) rent a sales location and sell women’s clothing and shoes. Sheroz travels to purchase products and his aunt sells them. He is 28 years old and has one child. In addition to his business he works at one private firm. Sheroz plans to purchase spring shoes and this is why he applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spring shoes

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
el Sr. Juan O. tiene 48 años de edad, el compra semillas de marañon para procesarlas y venderlas ya quemadas, este proceso lo hace en su casa, la semillas quedan crujientes y con un buen sabor, tambien las empaca para venderlas en diferentes negocios y pulperias de la ciudad de choluteca, el vive con su hija que tiene 18 años de edad la cual estudia, ella le acompaña los fines de semana para vender su producto en guasaule que es la frontera con nicaragua.
en estos momentos el necesita el credito para comprar mas semillas ya que hay semanas que no le ajusta la produccion y el pierde mucho dinero los fines de semana cuando no tiene producto ya que no viaja a  la frontera. por tal razon necesita el credito para invertirlo en mas materia prima.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan O. is 48 years old, he purchases cashew seeds in order to process, roast and sell them. He does this process in his house, the seeds remain crispy and with a good flavor. He also packages them to be sold to different businesses and grocery stores in the city of Choluteca, where he lives with his 18 year old daughter who studies. She accompanies him on the weekends to sell the product in Guasaule, which is on the border with Nicaragua. At the moment he needs a loan in order to purchase more seeds because there are weeks when the production is low, therefore he loses a lot of money on the weekends when there is no product and he does not travel to the border. For this reason he needs a loan in order to invest in raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cashew seeds.

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Margarita Antonia R., Esther B. H. y Maritza del Socorro O. G..

Llegaron a tener crédito con Adim porque una cliente les habló del tipo de crédito que recibían, donde confiaban en la honorabilidad de los clientes.

Este grupo es originario de la ciudad de Masaya, de la comarca de San Ramón                                    está conformado por las siguientes personas:
Doña Margarita  vende frutas y verduras en su casa, ofrece frutas de la temporada que son las más baratas, compra en el mercado y las vende al detalle donde saca mejores ganancias , es casada, madre de dos hijos jóvenes que trabajan independientes, ya no estudian, llegaron hasta la secundaria.

Doña Esther Baltonano, es otra de las integrantes, ella también vende verduras ambulante, vende frutas peladas y entrega a clientes fijos, ella es conocida por vendedora en la comunidad, compra en Masaya al por mayor y  al detalle. Tiene  
 dos hijos pequeños que estudian en la escuela más cercana a su casa, ella se encarga de cuidarlos y desea que terminen estudios para que conozcan cosas que ella no conoce

Doña Maritaza del Socorro es  la coordinadora del grupo, es una joven mujer madre de dos niños de edad escolar, tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de Tipitapa, trabaja desde muy tempranas horas y regresa a horas de la tarde para dar atención a los niños y hacer los oficios del hogar. Sueña dar estudio a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda, expresa que esta contenta de trabajar con Adim porque ella nunca había tenido oportunidad de un crédito por no tener garantías y ahora ella va a quedar bien a la institución que confía en ella.

Estos señoras abonan todos los Lunes, es el mejor día para abonar, después del fin de semana que las ventas son mejores y así garantizan la cuota del préstamo.
texts.en:
Photograph from left to right: Margarita Antonia R., Esther B. H. and Maritza del Socorro O. G.. The ended up involved with Adim because another person told them about the types of loans they received from an organization with confidence in the honor of its participants. This group originates in the city of Masay, located in the San Ramón region, and is comprised of the following members: Margarita sells fruits and vegetables from her home. She offers fruit during the season when they are the cheapest. She buys them at the market then sells them at retail, which is when she can garner a better profit. She is married and the mother of two young sons who work independently. They are no longer in school, but completed their educations up to secondary school. Esther B., another member, also sells vegetables and peeled fruit that she markets to repeat customers. She is known as a merchant throughout the community. She buys her products in Masaya both at wholesale and at retail. She has two young sons who study at the school closest to her house. She wants them to finish their educations so they can have opportunities that she has never known. Maritza del Socorro is the coordinator of the group. She is a young mother of two school-aged children. She has a small stall in the Tipitapa market and works from early in the morning, returning home in the afternoon to care for her children and tend to the home. She dreams of providing educations for her children and of making improvements to her house. She notes that she is happy to work with Adim because she has never had the opportunity to obtain financing due to lack of collateral. Now, she is going to do right by the institution that has shown confidence in her abilities. These women take credit on Mondays, which they consider the best day to do so. After the weekend, sales are better, and this way they secure the installment payment toward the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr:
H.  Constance est  née vers 1965 à BOPA, le village lacustre du Département du Mono. Constance est Célibataire sans enfant. Constance réside à Irédé à AKPAKPA un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. 

Constance est enseignante de profession et de fonction. Mais depuis 16 ans Constance a une boutique de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) qu’elle supervise pendant ses heures creuses de service. 

Constance a déjà  bénéficié d’un prêt de ALIDé pour améliorer le niveau de son activité. Constance a respecté ses engagements de remboursement de prêt. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Constance sollicite actuellement un deuxième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Constance was born around 1965 in BOPA, the lakeside village of Mono County. She is unmarried and has no children. She resides in Irédé in AKPAKPA, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Constance is a teacher by profession, and it is her job. But for sixteen years, she has had a shop selling various goods: candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, laundry detergents, dish soap, bath soap, batteries, candles, etc. She supervises the shop during her downtime. She has already benefited from an Alidé loan to improve the level of her business. She has honored her loan payment commitments. To boost her working capital and to do better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she's currently requesting a second loan with Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of tomatoes, milk, sugar, candles, pasta, soaps, and sacks of rice and corn

loans.name: Unidos Podemos Group 13

texts.en:
Jose M. M. is 30 years old and owns his own business selling fresh fruit, vegetables, and other food items. Today Jose is looking to take out a new loan, his third with Kiva and Esperanza International, to buy produce for his small business. With this loan, Jose will buy bananas, plantains, oranges, vegetables, and chickens from farmers in the countryside, which he will then sell to his neighbors in his small community outside of El Seybo, Dominican Republic. Jose's business, which he runs along with his wife, helps support his 8 year-old daughter. 

Jose reports that his fruit and vegetable business hasn't had any problems since he opened it 8 months ago. He used to earn a living by giving people rides on his motorcycle (a transportation service called a "motoconcho"), but switched professions when he realized he could make more money in food sales. It appears that, in doing so, Jose indeed made a wise career move: the loan he is requesting today is over twice the amount of the first loan he took out as a motoconcho. 

Jose is the coordinator for the Bank of Hope group called Unidos Podemos (United We Can) Group 13. He is pictured on the far left of the photo along with the four other borrowers in his group.

loans.use: New produce and other food items

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret Y. is married and has four dependents. She has received no formal education. Margaret sells food at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 1980. Her husband is a carpenter. Margaret uses her income to pay for utility bills and other household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Margaret plans to save and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María Antonia Maradiaga tiene 58 años de edad. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 6 hijos y todos traban de manera independiente. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio porque no tenía suficientes ingresos para mantener a su familia y como madre responsable decide establecer este negocio para proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario. Ella tiene más de tres créditos con Fundación ha sido una excelente cliente y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado pagar en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos. El sueño de María es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
María Antonia Maradiaga is 58 years old, married, and has 6 children who are all independent. For over 20 years, she has been making and selling tortillas. She started her business because she did not have sufficient income to support her family. As a responsible mother, she needed to provide for her children’s necessities.

She has had more than 3 previous loans with the Foundation. Sra. María puts much effort into her work, which has allows her to make her payments on time. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy ingredients used for making her products. She dreams of continuing to move her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Artha Sari Group

texts.en: Ni Putu Sumiarti - (-) is a 55 year-old female living in the town of Sumbersari - Melaya.  Ni Putu Sumiarti is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by DINARI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Arta Sari (DNR.M-0588).  Ni Putu Sumiarti is married and has 3 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Ni Putu Sumiarti owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Putu Sumiarti has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 600.000 IDR a month from these activities.  In 2009, Ni Putu Sumiarti joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Putu Sumiarti is requesting for the first time a loan from DINARI.    She is now requesting a new loan of 1.400.000 IDR which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Ni Putu Sumiarti plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.  About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.  *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Ccechcca Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Santa Cruz D. Ccechcca, está ubicado en la Comunidad D. Santa Cruz D. Ccechcca, en el distrito D. Tambillo, provincia D. Huamanga, departamento D. Ayacucho.

Victoria, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Victoria tiene una tienda en la comunidad donD. también venD. comidas, sus hijas le ayudan en su bodega, Victoria en algunos casos aprovecha las ferias locales para vender su comida. Solicita su préstamo para invertir en su bodega y en su restaurante.

Maruja, es conviviente, se dedica a la venta D. comida en su comunidad, su esposo le ayuda en su negocio, solicita su préstamo para implementar su pequeño kiosco D. comida. Su sueño es tener una chicharronería en Huamanga.
texts.en:
The Santa Cruz D. Ccechcca Communal Bank is located in the Santa Cruz neighborhood of Ccechcca, Tambillo district, Huamanga province, Ayacucho department. Victoria is married and has 4 children. Victoria has a store in the community where she also sells meals. Her children help her in the store. Victoria sometimes goes to the local market to sell her food. She is seeking a loan to invest in her store and in her restaurant. Maruja has a partner and sells prepared food in her community. Her husband helps her with the business. She seeks a loan to open a small food kiosk. Her dream is having a chicharronería (a small business that focuses on preparing chicharrón, which is fried pig skin or pork rinds) in Huamanga.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The 17 members seek loans to invest in their respective busiensses

loans.name: Elbira

texts.es: Doña Elvira de 46 años de edad, reside en el barrio Manuel Fernández en la capital de Managua, con cuatro hijos mayores de edad y trabajan, su negocio es una pulpería que logro poner hace varios años con ahorros y financiamiento en Afodenic. Sus planes es poder mejorar su casa y seguir apoyando a sus hijos. Con este préstamo es su séptimo ciclo y comprara productos variados para su pulpería  como: granos básicos, productos lácteos, carnes, golosinas y otros. Para elevar las ventas y poder tener mejores utilidades. Agradece a la institución por la oportunidad que ha tenido en poder invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Elvira is 46 years old and lives in the neighborhood, Manuel Fernández, in the capital of Managua with her four older children who work. Her business is a general store that she started several years ago with her savings and financing from Afodenic. Her plans are to be able to improve her house and to continue supporting her children. With this loan, she is in her seventh cycle and will buy a variety of products for her general store such as: basic grains, milk products, meats, sweets, etc. in order to increase sales and to have better profits. She is thankful for this institution for the opportunity that she has had to be able to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat, sweets, and milk products

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr: Yolande S. est une femme mariée de 46 ans, elle a 9 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans et y a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés avec succès. Elle détient une boutique au niveau de son quartier où elle vend diversproduits. Son crédit lui permettra de générer des bénéfices qui lui permettront de contribuer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yolande S. is a 46-year-old married woman with 9 children in her care. She has been a member of the Village Loan Group of Tenghory Diamalaye for 7 years and has benefited from 14 previous loans, all of which she repaid successfully. She has a store in her locality where she sells various products. This loan will allow her to generate a profit that will allow her to contribute to the improvement of her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her small business

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a successful father and dedicated husband. He has two children. Raed has a small grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as sweets, soft drinks, juices and other items. 

Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Raed is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve successes in his business with this loan.

loans.use: To expand the variety of goods.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el  distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive en Ccotos, estudió educación primaria (incompleta).

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta  de condimentos.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar condimentos, como  ají, orégano, etc. También vende gaseosas o frutas de acuerdo a la época y lo comercializa en la plaza de Capachica.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda bien surtida.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the “Juchuy Child” cooperative bank, located in the Capachica district of the Puno province. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children. She studied until primary school, but did not complete her education. This lady has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 1 year. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which allowed her to increase the capital base for her business selling condiments. Presently, she needs a new loan of 300 soles that will allow her to buy other condiments such as peppers, oregano, etc. She also sells soft drinks or fruit, depending on the season, at the plaza in Capachica. Her greatest wish is to have a well-stocked store. She appreciates being able to save and punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase condiments such as peppers, oregano, etc.

loans.name: Soy Nica Group

texts.es:
María Yolanda C., Luz Argentina y María Auxiliadora C.  conforman al grupo Soy Nica, cuyo nombre eligieron por estar orgullosas de su nacionalidad y del país tan bello en el que viven.
La señora C. tiene su propio taller de costura donde confecciona trajes para cualquier ocasión. En esta época del año ella tiene gran de manda por las festividades desde trajes de noche hasta uniformes es por esta razón que necesita con urgencia contar con capital para comprar los materiales como tela, hilos y zíper etc. 
María Auxiliadora C. tiene desde hace diez años su pulpería la cual en estos años ha ido creciendo. Mientras su compañera  Luz Argentina M. vende cosméticos desde hace seis años y desea a provechar está época que es cuando suben las ventas por las promociones y el ambiente de fiesta.
texts.en:
María Yolanda C., Luz Argentina, and María Auxiliadora C. make up the Soy Nica Group, whose name they chose because they are proud of their nationality and of the beautiful country in which they live.

Mrs. C. has her own seamstress shop where she makes dresses for all occasions. At this time of year there is great demand due to the festivities, for anything from evening dresses to uniforms. This is why she urgently needs to count on capital to buy materials such as cloth, thread, zippers, etc.

María Auxiliadora has for the last 10 years, operated a grocery store, which has grown lately. Meanwhile, her companion Luz Argentina has sold cosmetics for the last 6 years and wishes to take advantage of this season when sales increase, due to promotions and the festive atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SEWING SUPPLIES, GROCERIES, AND COSMETICS

loans.name: Yard

texts.en: Yard C. is 54 years old and lives in Cambodia’s capital, Phnom Penh.  She is a widow and has three children, between the ages of 20 and 29, and they live with her and work in a local garment factory.  She requests a loan of $500 from CREDIT MFI to purchase a motorbike so her children can commute to work.  Currently, the family’s second largest expense (after food), is paying for public transportation.  The savings will help cover other household expenses.  This is Yard's first loan from CREDIT MFI.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie E. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 57 years old, married, and has one school-aged and two adult children.

Vergie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for almost five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vergie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Enecita's Group

texts.en:
Enecita L. is from the village of Tiaman Bonifacio. She is 42 years old. Enecita is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Enecita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Enecita owns and operates a furniture business, providing items of furniture to local community members. Enecita has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $135 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Enecita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Enecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Enecita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to supply her family's daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza.
Juana es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Juana vende hierbas medicinales, sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria en el mercado F. Vivanco que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hierbas.
Juana sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank Granito de Mostaza. She is 35 and lives with her spouse and 4 children. She sells medicinal herbs as a street vendor in the F. Vivanco market located in the center of the city. Juana needs a loan of $1050 to invest in the purchase of herbs. Juana dreams that her children will become professionals, and of increasing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of herbs

loans.name: 010 Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
Trang T. T. (76) is a 48-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Trang is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 010 Quang Hung (010 Quang Hung).


Trang is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Trang owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs & spices in the local community.  Trang has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,442,600 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Trang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Trang has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND that will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Trang from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Trang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Ha (78) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


2.  N. T. Thoi (95) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


3.  N. T. Hue (83) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


4.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Thirty-eight-year-old Nancy T. is a married woman who helps support her family with her general store business. She lives in Cogon 1, Barangay Alimango, Escalante City, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Roberto, who is a carpenter, and their two children, 16 and 19 years old, who are currently going to school. Nancy has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 4,000. Nancy is now borrowing Php 9,000 so that she can buy additional items for her general store. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 9,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Nancy aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Marcialisa

texts.en: Marcialisa is from the village of Silucap, Liloy. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Marcialisa owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marcialisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Marcialisa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. So Phat Vong Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fourteen people who live in Sdok village in Takeo province. Mrs. So Phat V. is the village bank president selected by all the members, who will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support her family. She is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Art Chhe, is a motorbike taxi driver. This family has a problem because their house is too dark. Thus, Mrs. So Phat V. decided to ask for a loan to buy some electrical supplies. She is the mother of six children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory, three attend the local public school, and one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy some electrical supplies

loans.name: Santa Amalia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Amalia lo conforman Cruz V. P., Damaris L. Torres y Grethel del Carmen P. tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora V. P. quien hace cinco años con  quinientos córdobas comenzó su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras. Ella con el préstamo comprara productos como sandilla, jocote y melón.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Damaris L. Torres y Grethel del Carmen P. quienes se dedican al comercio de frutas y verduras de acuerdo a la temporada.
texts.en:
The Santa Amalia group’s members are: Cruz V. P., Damaris L. Torres and Grethel del Carmen P., three hard-working, enterprising and tenacious women. The group coordinator is Mrs. V. P. who started her fruit and vegetable selling business five years ago with 500 córdobas. She will use the requested funds to buy fruit like: watermelon, melon and jocote (a tropical fruit). Her fellow group members are: Damaris L. Torres and Grethel del Carmen P. who sell seasonal fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit crops.

loans.name: Bi

texts.en:
Mr. Bi T. stands alongside the river fishing where he can catch many kilos of fish each day. He sells the fish to middle traders who then take it to retail at the market. By doing this, he has the ability to feed his family members. Also, Mr. Bi T. relies on the income from his wife’s commerce, in which she sells a few groceries from home.

As Mr. Bi T. has seven children, the income is sometimes not adequate to serve their needs. He has therefore requested a loan for capital to begin investing in a vegetable business. With any remaining money from the loan, he will buy more groceries for his wife to sell.

loans.use: To invest in a vegetable business and to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Vitalino

texts.es: Vitalino V. V., tiene la edad de 61 años, está casado, y tiene 7 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 28,26,24,23,22,16 y 12 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Vitalino tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Vitalino V. V. is 61 years old, married and has 7 children who are his first priority. They are 28, 26, 24, 23, 22, 16, and 12 years old. The loan that he requests is for the purchase of a few calves and for their feed. He wants to give the calves adequate maintenance to be able to obtain the best price possible when he sells them. He also would like to increase the umber of animals and be able to maintain them in better conditions, in an ideal area for the care and growth of the herd. This is the first time he is pursuing a loan with Fudecosur, and he is very happy with the ease of the process. Mr. Vitalino has dedicated many years to his herd. In the future, he hopes to be able to give his family a better quality of life and more stable economic support, and to be able to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of calves for fattening

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with one son who attends junior school; her husband works with Kenya Ports Authority. Florence rents a house with electricity and piped water. She pointed out her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport.

Florence operates a stall from home selling soft drinks to her neighbors. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she would like to purchase a refrigerator to help her venture into a competitive market to suit her customers’ needs. She cites seasonality and competition to be her major challenges as many people operate the same business as she does.

Florence hopes to buy her own car from her business profits someday. She joined Yehu so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana S. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Juana is 39 years old and is married to a husband that is a peasant. She has two children who both go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bigger charcoal store.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es:
Aida Luz A. es una señora trabajadora, esforzada  y emprendedora quien durante diez años ha luchado para salir adelante con su pequeño negocio de comida, frutas, chiverías, frescos etc. localizado en la entrada de Ciudad Sandino, municipio de Managua. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en materia prima como granos básicos, carne, frutas etc.
texts.en:
Aida Luz A. is a hardworking, determined, and enterprising woman. For the past ten years, she has struggled to succeed in her small business that sits at the entrance to Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua. She sells food, fruits, yogurts, soft drinks, and other products.

She will invest her loan in products such as basic grains, meat, fruits, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat, fruits, and other items

loans.name: Emily Pilar

texts.es: La solicitante tiene 23 años es conviviente tiene 2 hijos vive en casa de sus padres se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y su conyuge tiene una mototaxi que  la trabaja  manejando tiene experiencia crediticia y buenas referencias personales solicita dicho credito para capital de trabajo, se propone por contar  con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
This borrower is 23 years old. She has a live-in partner and 2 children, and she lives in her parents' house. Her work is raising and selling pigs. Her partner has a moto-taxi which he uses to provide transport services. She has previous experience with loans and excellent personal references. She is requesting the current loan for working capital, based on her ability in her business and her determination to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lusi

texts.en:
Lusi L. is 32 and married with a one-year-old child.  She owns a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Lusi has two years of experience in this business.  Lusi needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Lusi joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Lusi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Laureles y lo que mas le gusta son los prestamos fáciles.
Lourdes es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Lourdes viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 3 veces a la semana de donde compra cereales, papa, carne, queso, productos que son comercializados en el mercado de abastos y en algunas oportunidades lleva a la ciudad de Lima. Lourdes solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de cebada.
Lourdes sueña con tener una tienda de abarrotes y terminar de construir su casa en Lima.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Laureles”. What she enjoys most is the ease of the loans.

Lourdes is single and has two children who are in school. She travels to the different regional fairs three times a week to buy grains, potatoes, meat, and cheese. Lourdes sells these products at the supply market and occasionally she will bring them to the city of Lima. She is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to buy barley.

Lourdes dreams of opening a grocery store and finishing the construction of her house in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barley

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia V. is from Dipolog City. She is 57 years old. Rosalia is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Rosalia owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosalia has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rosalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg T. is 54 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her family in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. All her children are grown up and are working on their own. Her husband is retired and usually goes between Ulaanbaatar and the countryside. Uranchimeg operates an eye glasses and gloves retail business from a stall at the local market. During cold months, she sells padding materials along with her other products. Uranchimeg started her business in 2000 with working capital of 300,000 tugriks (MNT) and has built a stable operation. Today, her working capital exceeds 600,000 – 700,000 MNT. She is a very polite and cheerful woman. Her dream is to expand her business and have her own small shop in the future. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more window padding materials that are used for winterization at wholesale prices to sell in the market as a retailer.

loans.use: To purchase more window padding materials

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred D. C. is a married woman who lives in Hda. Socorro, Brgy. Mabini, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: the buying and selling of dry goods, vegetable vending and food vending. Her husband, Edgardo, who is 62 years old, is a retired employee who helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are 25 to 37 years old. 

Mildred joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mildred has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,500, thus lifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use to buy dry goods to sell so that she can continue to save for the future expansion of her business. Mildred D. C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Otoniel Vitalino

texts.es: Don Otoniel, es de 38 años de edad, de oficio tejedor, tiene 1 hijo que está estudiando actualmente, solo estudio la primaria pero ha sido una persona que ha puesto su empeño en sostener a su familia, quiere ampliar su producción de tejeduría, para lo cual es necesario ampliar su capital de trabajo, para comprar más materia prima (hilo), y así poder tejer nuevos diseños en el arte que realizar, lleva con este trabajo once años, por lo que tiene grandes expectativas de superarse mas.
texts.en:
Don Otoniel, 38, is a weaver. He has a son who is currently in school. Don only finished primary school, but he has always prioritized working to support his family. Don wants to expand his weaving workshop, and to do this he needs more working capital to buy raw materials like thread so that he can weave new designs. 

Don has been weaving for 11 years, and has great expectations of furthering developing his work.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Angela Samaria

texts.es: Ángela Samaria tiene 40 años, su actividad es la venta de hot dog, gaseosa, hamburguesa. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio vendiendo de manera ambulante en las calles con las pocas ganancias que lograba recolectar construyo su propio carretón ahora está ubicado en un lugar en donde transitan mucho clientes y ofrece sus deliciosos productos a gran cantidad de clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de carne, pan, jugos, refrescos, salchicha, aceite y otros ya que se acerca la temporada festiva de navidad y otros eventos que se realizan. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para su hijo y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela Samaria is 40 years old.  She sells hot dogs, soft drinks, and hamburgers.  She has had this business for over 11 years.  She started by selling in an itinerant manner on the streets.  With the little earnings that she managed to collect, she built her own cart.  She is now located in a place where a lot of customers travel.  She sells her delicious products to a lot of customers.

The reason for the loan is to buy meat, bread, juice, soft drinks, sausages, oil, and other items.  The festive Christmas season and other events are getting close.  

She dreams of improving her house for her children and expanding her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 38 años D. edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, resiD. junto a su familia en un sector urbano marginal del distrito D. Lambayeque, una zona D. movimiento comercial considerable que se ubica a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Paula cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. Su negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida por parte D. los pobladores D. la zona ya que se encuentra ubicada lejos del centro D. la ciudad. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar.

Ella desea adquirir mas productos para ampliar su negocio con motivo D. la cercanía D. las fiestas naviD.ñas ya que durante esta temporada la demanda por sus productos aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Paula, 38, is married and has three children.  She lives with her family in a marginal urban sector of Lambayeque district, an area with considerable commercial activity located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Paula has a small grocery store installed in her house where she offers her neighbors various daily use items among which are first need items and groceries.  Her business is well received by residents of the area because it is located far from city center.  Income from this activity makes it possible for her to help her husband support the family.

She wants to acquire more products to expand her store due to the approaching Christmas season because this is when demand increases.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to help her reach this objective.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Eliana Mercedes

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal La California.

La señora  Eliana forma parte del Banco Comunal La California desde hace ya 10 años y está muy contenta con los beneficios que ha recibido de la institución. Ella tiene 58 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tuvo tres hijos, todos son mayores de edad, dos de ellos son  profesionales y uno estudia en la Universidad.

Es maestra en una escuela pública de la localidad y además de eso se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos y productos naturales, trabaja todos los días en las tardes y noches y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra por semana, sus productos los compra en Quito y Guayaquil dos veces al mes.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, y productos naturales, sus sueños son seguir trabajando y algún dia poder viajar a los Estados Unidos a visitar a unos hermanos que viven allá.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'La California' community bank meet in the Nueva California district of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Eliana has been a member of her community bank for 10 years and she is very happy with the benefits that she has received from the institution.  She is 58 years old and separated but has three children from her relationship.  They are all now grown up.  Two of her children are professionals and the other is studying at university.

Eliana is a teacher in a local public school.  She also sells shoes and natural products.  She works every day in the afternoons and evenings and she makes her sales door to door.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every week.  She buys her products in Quito and Guayaquil twice a month.

This loan will be used to buy shoes and natural products.  Eliana's dreams are to continue working and one day to be able to travel to the USA so that she can visit some of her siblings who live there.

loans.use: To buy shoes and natural products

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto, de 29 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposa Margarita de 27 años y de su pequeña hija; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Desde hace 2 años, este emprendedor hombre se desempeña como carpintero, y le gusta mucho su labor pues sabe que los diversos muebles en madera que realiza son de calidad. Trabaja durante todos los días útiles de la semana, de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde  en el taller ubicado en su casa, pues es un negocio familiar, en ese lugar labora junto a su suegro y cuñados. Realizan muebles en madera, además de otros pedidos y las ganancias que obtienen son regulares y se las reparten entre todos. Esta muy contento con su labor que  la desempeña desde muy joven, y de esta manera puede ofrecerle una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia. Como siempre piensa en el futuro, por lo que ya tiene pensado instalar una carpintería en un local, y así independizarse, pues quiere mejorar sus ingresos. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Humberto tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado, en la compra de cantidad de madera que necesita para concretar un gran pedido, de esta manera espera seguir adelante.
texts.en: 29 year old Humberto lives in his own house with his wife Margarita, 27 years old, and their small daughter. Together they work every day to get ahead. For 2 years this enterprising man has worked as a carpenter, and he enjoys his work very much as he knows that the various pieces of wood furniture he makes are of quality. He works every day of the week, from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon, in the workshop located in his house as this is a family business and in this place he works along with his father-in-law and brothers- in law. They make wood furniture, and in addition the orders and earnings they generate are constant and split between them. He is very content with this work he has been doing since he was very young, and in this way he can offer an adequate quality of life to his family. He is always thinking about the future, which is why he is thinking of opening a carpentry shop in a new location, becoming independent, as he would like to increase his earnings. This is his second credit with MFP and he promises to make the payments on time, as he doesn’t want to disappoint those who made this support possible that will permit him to continue working for the future. Humberto has planned to invest the loan, buying a quantity of wood that he needs to complete a large order, and in this way he hopes to continue on with his business.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is a 64-year old single who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and ice candy. She lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. Carlita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carlita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.
