Her previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000, with which she intends to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business. 

Carlita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora D. is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  'abaca' weaving and hog-raising. She lives in Bugho, Bagalnga, Compostela, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her 'abaca' weaving and hog-raising businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,100. Flora is now borrowing PHP 13,500 so that she can buy frames and stocks for 'abaca'.  This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Flora aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for 'abaca' (palm-leaf fiber) business

loans.name: Abena Nimoe Appiah

texts.en: Abena Nimoe Appiah D. is married and has 2 children. She has been through senior high school. Abena Nimoe sells materials, travelling bags, bathroom slipppers and other items at Dompoase near Elmina in Cape Coast. She has been a trader of these products for 6 years. Her husband is a farmer. Abena uses her income to assist her husband educate their children. Abena will invest the loan in her business by buying more goods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to build another shop.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy oranges, onions, tomatoes, melons and mangoes, among others.

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Nyamdorj, 52, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a plot of land that they own. His wife is unemployed and his older daughter attends community college. 

Nyamdorj is a certified carpenter and began making wood products in 1999. He started his business with a working capital of 50,000 MNT.  Now, his current working capital is 710,000 MNT.  He makes ger components such as walls, doors and roofs. He tries to make quality products so that he can attract more customers. 

Nyamdorj is a modest and hardworking person. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more timber and materials for his woodcraft business.

loans.use: To purchase timber and building materials for carpentry business

loans.name: Wilmer Aladino

texts.es:
Wilmer Aladino G. L. tiene 26 años, es soltero  vive  con los padres en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS esta constituida por 12 socios esta se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora, tomate y maíz, son agrícolas por mas de 10 años los mas antiguos y otros miembros que estan comenzando con esta actividad.

Wilmer se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, tomate y maíz en grandes cantidades, las compras las realiza en Chillanes en Agro y las vende los días domingos en la feria de Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una finca para seguir trabajando.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Wilmer Aladino G. L. is 26 years old, married, and lives with his wife in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He does not have any children.

The 'COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS' community bank has 12 members.  It is located 20 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The members of this group work in agriculture.  They mainly grow blackberries, tomatoes and corn.  The older members have been farming for more than 10 years whilst other members are just starting out in the business.

Wilmer is a farmer who grows blackberries, tomatoes and corn in large quantities.  He makes his purchases in Agro, in Chillanes and sells his produce on Sundays at Chillanes market.

Wilmer is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to own his own farm so that he can continue working.

Wilmer enjoying taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Leticia Emperatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Leticia, ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 15, 8 y 6 años los mismos que están en escuela y colegio, su marido trabaja en una fábrica de harina de pescado.

Tiene una  tienda de abarrotes en su casa en la cual vende productos de priM. necesidad y algunos productos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, los productos los adquiere en Portoviejo ya que allá le salen más baratos. Trabaja con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos cuando él tiene tiempo, nos cuenta que le encanta su tienda ya que además de ganar sus propios recursos está al tanto de sus pequeños hijos para  ayudarlos en las tares y brindarles el mejor de los cuidados.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y otros productos que aun le hacen falta. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al crédito pudo instalar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
The village bank Los Corrales meets every 15 days in a place called Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi which has a rich prehistoric culture. Here the majority of residents have different economic activities such as artisan crafts.

Here we meet Leticia, who is 28 years old, married and has 3 children ages 15, 8 and 6 years old who are in elementary and high school. Her husband works in a fish-meal factory.

She has a grocery store in her home where she sells staple goods and other bazaar products. She works every day from 6am to 7pm. She gets the products in Portoviejo since they are cheaper there. One of her sons helps her when he has time. She tells us that she loves her store since not only does she bring in good income, but she is there to help her young children with there homework and to take care of them.

The loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other products that she still lacks. This is her second cycle in the village bank and she likes it because thanks to the first loan she was able to start up her business. 

Her dream is to have her own home, since right now she lives in her mother's home.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergent and other basic necessities

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan M., 44, earns a living by working at the garment factories in the Ang Snoul district. She uses this income to support all her family expenses such as meals, clothing, medical bills, and her children's school fees. Kan M. is bringing up three children while another two of her children are married and live away from home.
Additionally, her husband farms a several types of crops. Beside the current farming work, Kan M.’s husband always goes to buy animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. Because the selling-animal business is the main source of income for this family, Kan M. has requested a loan of $1000 as capital for her husband to buy an extra cow to sell.

loans.use: to buy an extra cow to sell.

loans.name: Askarbek's Group

texts.en:
Askarbek M., 52, is a member of this group. He is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. The daughter is a student, the first son is a driver and the second earns money by repairing mobile phones. Askarbek’s wife provides sewing services. She takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national blankets, pillows, cloth and dressmaking supplies. In order to contribute money to family budget, Askarbek works as a driver and earns 200 soms a day. The family also cultivates agricultural products. With money received from the loan, Aslarbek wants to purchase lucerne seeds; for this purpose he applied for the loan. In the future, he wants to see his daughter get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase lucerne seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mechanical plow the help plow the rice fields.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He started running his own business back in 2006. His job consists in selling a large variety of car accessories. His wife who works in a local school assists him in paying the household expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory. He hopes that these purchases will continue to generate good profits and enable him to expand his business even further.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory.

loans.name: Rina Raquel

texts.es: Rina Raquel de 25 años de edad, vive en su casa con su compañero de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta ropa de manera ambulante en la zona donde reside. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este negocio y es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha logrado establecer buena clientela ya que ella siempre cuenta con variedad de prendas de vestir y sobre todo buenos precios, estas son las razones por las que muchas personas buscan sus productos y la prefieren. Trabaja duramente todo el día para lograr vender la mayoría de sus prendas y hasta el momento lo ha logrado. Últimamente la demanda de sus prendas de vestir se ha visto aumentada y muchas veces no cuenta con el producto suficiente para satisfacer a todos sus clientes. Es por esta razón que solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en variedad de prendas de vestir principalmente en ropa interior que es lo que más vende.  Confía que de esta manera logrará atraer a más clientes y podrá contar con mayores ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su situación que por el momento es muy difícil.
texts.en: Rina Raquel is 25 years old and lives with her husband.  For many years, Rina has worked selling clothing around the area where she lives, and this provides her principal source of income.   She has established a good customer base and she offers a variety of clothing at good prices, which is why many people like to buy from her.    Rina works all day to sell the majority of her merchandise.  Lately, she's seen that there has been more demand, and many times she doesn't have what all of her customers want.   She is requesting a loan from Integral to invest in a variety of clothing, primarily underclothes, which she sells most often.  Rina is confident that with more variety, she can attract more customers and increase her income.   This will help her improve her situation, which at the moment is very difficult.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul is the leader of this group. She is 56 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she has raised three daughters. The first daughter works in a sewing workshop, the second daughter is a student and the youngest one works in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). 

Ten years ago with the initial investment of 10,000 KGS, Aigul started to breed livestock and then resell them at higher prices after being fattened. With money received from this loan, Aigul wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, with money gained from reselling livestock, Aigul wants to purchase agricultural equipment for making the sowing process easier.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 56-year-old divorced woman. To have a basic income she started selling clothes and blankets as a small home retail business four years ago, and she was able to serve a good number of customers in her neighborhood.

While her customer base is growing by word of mouth, Samia has applied for this loan to get more goods to sell. She hopes to open her own store in the future.

loans.use: To add more goods to what she sells, such as new models of clothes.

loans.name: Rauben

texts.en:
Rauben is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Rauben has a small retail shop, which sells sugar, which he has run for five years. He has a poultry farm as his second business.  
To help expand his business, Rauben has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities such as sugar for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Rauben hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.    
Rauben is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by helping him reach his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Anis

texts.en: Anis is a 51-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent. Despite his older age, he is still running his business, which he established in 1988. He is a professional car mechanic and has more than 25 years of experience in the same field. His work specializes in car electric repairs.  Today, he is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed equipment for his shop. He confirms that thanks to the loan, he will be able to serve more customers and therefore, earn a higher income. This will be his third Kiva loan and it’s positive to learn that he has indeed increased his business productivity and income since taking the previous loans. He was a very punctual client, paying on his scheduled dates.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his shop

loans.name: El Renacer De Chacrasana Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El Renacer de Chacrasana” es un grupo conformados por 09 mujeres emprendedoras siendo Olinda una de las integrantes. Olinda tiene 41 años de edad es soltera  y tiene 01 hijo en etapa escolar. Olinda se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 02 años, este negocio surge a raíz de su separación, ya que ella tenía que trabajar para mantener a su hijo y es así que empezó a vender ofreciendo sus productos a sus amigos y conocidos de su zona, pero no solo se dedica a la venta de productos también nos cuenta que brinda servicio domestico de limpieza y cocina es así como Olinda ha superado los problemas ya que su mayor motivación es su hijo.  El deseo de  Olinda es de tener su casa propia ya que nos manifiesta que vive en casa de sus padres. El préstamo solicitado será invertido en productos de belleza como cremas, colonias, talcos, perfumes, entre otros. La Alcancía Comunal “El Renacer de Chacrasana”   agradece el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
"El Renacer de Chacrasana" Communal Bank is a group of nine women entrepreneurs, one of whom is Olinda.  Olinda, 41 and single, has one school-age child.  For two years Olinda has been selling beauty products, a job that presented itself because of her separation.  Since she had to work to support her child, she began selling her products to friends and acquaintances in her area.  She tells us that she not only sells beauty products, she also offers cleaning and cooking services.  In this way Olinda has overcome her problems, since her greatest motivation is her child.  Olinda's wish is to have her own house, since she tells us that she lives with her parents.

The requested loan will be invested in beauty products such as face cream, cologne, talcum powder, and perfume, among others.  "El Renacer de Chacrasana" Communal Bank is grateful for the support offered.

loans.use: To buy talcum powder, face cream, perfume, and cologne.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint and wood for making curios.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es socia del banco comunal Siete Estrellas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos mayores y con familia.
Es una de las fundadoras del banco comunal y el dinero que recibió de los préstamos anteriores los invirtió en un negocio que ahora es familiar porque con ella trabajan sus hijos, nueras y hermana, se dedica a la decoración con telas y globos, actividad que generalmente la realiza los fines de semana.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos comprará: 20 metros de tela de color rojo, 20 metros de tela color dorado, 20 metros de tela color anaranjado, 20 metros de tela color azul, 50 metros de tela blanca, 10 cajas de chinche, 15 bastidores.
Todo lo que está comprando es para implementar su negocio porque cuando tiene que hacer dos decoraciones al día le hace falta los materiales.
Sus ayudante son quienes realizan los trabajos, ella es la que consigue casi todo los contratos.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos tiene un ingreso más en su hogar y lo mejor es que está dando trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy is a member of the communal bank "Siete Estrellas" in the Calleria District, department of Ucayali.  She is 56, married and has four adult children who have families.

She is one of the founding members of the communal bank and used her previous loans to invest in the the business that now employs her and her children, daughters-in-law and sister.  They make decorations with fabric and balloons and usually work on weekends.  The new loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN will be used to buy: 20 meters of red fabric, 20 meters of gold fabric, 20 meters of orange fabric, 20 meters of blue fabric, 50 meters of white fabric, 10 boxes of tacks and 15 frames.

All of the purchases will be used in the business because the materials are needed to make two decorations a day.  Her assistants are the ones who actually carry out the work, since she is the one who gets the contacts.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos she has an additional income in her household.  The best part is that she is providing employment to other people.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fabric and frames.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden is a 55-year-old married woman with ten children, six of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years.

Kiden requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Valichon

texts.ru: Валичон  ответственный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат, у него 2 детей. Валичон  занимается скотоводством и имеет опыт в этом деле. У него 10 голов крупного рогатого скота  и 3 голов мелкого рогатого скота. В этом ему помогает жена.  Он заботливый отец и хочет воспитывать детей  в хороших условиях, поэтому  дополнительно занимается и выращиванием сельхозкультур таких как лук, морковь, огурцы. Этот вид деятельности тоже приносит дополнительную прибыль. Валичон  хочет получить кредит на сумму 9500 сомони для покупки скота, и эта сумма поможет ему расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Valichon is a responsible and hard-working person.  He is married and has two children.  Valichon is involved in animal husbandry and has experience in this business.  He owns 10 heads of cattle and 3 heads of small livestock.  His wife helps him in this business.  Valichon is a caring father and because he wants to raise his children in good conditions, he is also involved in growing agricultural crops, such as onions, carrots and cucumbers.  This business also yields an additional profit.  Valichon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 9500 somoni for the purchase of livestock, and this sum will help him to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 44 years old. She is married and has seven children. 

Encarnacion has a "sari-sari" store or variety store which sells food items like canned goods, bread, and junk food. Aside from the food items, Encarnacion also sells fresh fish by the kilo. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Encarnacion has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fresh fish and food items like canned goods, bread, and junk food.  Encarnacion joined as a  member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items like bread, junk food, canned goods and fresh fish, which are intended for sale.

loans.name: Rwibale Trader Group

texts.en:
Bosco wants a loan to buy maize for resale. 

Age 40, he hails from the Kyenjojo district in Uganda and is the father of five children whom he lives with together with their mother in a permanent house.

Having started by farming, and he saved money to start up this business, which has grown over 10 years. 

His dream is to educate his children and he wishes to acquire a motorcycle to ease transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy maize  for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.es: La Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Exitosas” está conformada por 07 integrantes entusiastas D. comenzar a trabajar con el Programa- Prosperidad, siendo Flora una D. las integrantes del grupo. Flora tiene 53 años D. edad es soltera y no tiene hijos. Actualmente Flora se dedica a la venta ambulatoria D. ropa D. bebe, la cual lleva más D. 12 años trabajando D. esa manera, este negocio le ha permitido a Flora sacar adelante a sus sobrinos ya que con el  fallecimiento D. su hermana, ella quedo a cargo D. sus 02 sobrinos brindado educación y el cariño D. madre. Ella solicito el préstamo para invertir en su negocio comprando polos, chompas y colchas para bebes. Su mayor deseo D. Flora es D. tener su propio local donD. pueda ofrecer sus prendas y seguir apoyando a sus sobrinos la cual han sido su motivo para progresar. La Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Exitosas” agradece el crédito brindado y se comprometen a trabajar bien con el Programa- Prosperidad. Flora es la que viste una blusa D. color rojo.
texts.en:
The  “Mujeres Exitosas” communal bank is maD. up of seven members, who are enthusiastic about starting to work with the Prosperidad program. Flora is one of the group members. She is 53, single, and has no children.

Currently, Flora sells baby clothing in the street, which she has been doing for 12 years. This business has allowed Flora to raise her nephews. After the death of her sister, her two nephews were left in her care, and she has provided them with education and a mother's love. 

She applied for the loan to invest in her business, buying polo shirts, sweaters, and baby blankets. Flora's greatest desire is to have her own shop where she can sell her clothing, and continue supporting her nephews, who have  been her reason for moving forward. 

The "Mujeres Exitosas" communal bank is grateful for the loan they have been provided, and are committed to working well with the Prosperidad program. 

Flora is shown in photo wearing a red blouse.

loans.use: To buy polo shirts, sweaters, and baby blankets.

loans.name: Bakali

texts.en:
For the past nine years Bakali, a 35-year-old resident of the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda, has been working hard to manage his grocery shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers.

To help expand his business, Bakali has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more food products for resale, which will help him to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Bakali hopes that in the future he will be able to open up more groceries stores.

Bakali is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bakali who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food products for resale.

loans.name: Chieer

texts.en:
Chieer is a 38-year-old married woman with one child. She has had a business for three year selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan.
Chieer requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Achok

texts.en:
Achok is a 30-year-old a married woman with five children. Two of them are in school. 

She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Achok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: Madame Aby est une femme de 42 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 5 et 24 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du  commerce  depuis plus  de 10 ans.  Elle s’adonne à la vente de glace et de poulets. Ce sont les difficultés de la vie qui l’ont poussé a choisir cette activité dans le souci de se procurer des revenus. Elle est  plutôt intéressé  par l’aspect lucratif de son activité. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC  qui se trouve dans sa zone d’habitation depuis novembre 2003. Elle y a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’un congélateur plus approprié  a la vente de glace et la conservation des poulets qu’elle commercialise. Elle souhaite mieux rentabiliser son activité de commerce accroitre  ses revenus afin de contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Aby is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Senegal. She is married and the mother of four children, from 5 to 24 years of age. She has been working in the commerce sector for over ten years. She devotes all her time to selling ice and chickens. What has driven her to choose this business are the problems in life concerned with earning an income. She is rather interested by the lucrative aspect of her business.

Since November 2003, she has been a member of the U-IMCEC office that is found where she lives. She has already repaid two previous loans there. 

Ms. Aby is requesting a 300,000 francs loan for buying a freezer more suitable for selling ice and for preserving chickens, which she markets. She would like to make her work in commerce more profitable and to increase her revenues, so as to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Mutuaa

texts.en: Mutuaa is a 24-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 8 months to 5 years. She describes herself to be religious. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a viable market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase more charcoal. Mutuaa's business goal is to be a charcoal distributor within five years.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a forty-six-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. For twenty years he has been farming as well as buying produce from other farmers. Like most farmers he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and inflation, while his dream is to become one of the model farmers in the region. Benard intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur.  She specializes in selling provisions in a village near Elmina.  She has been involved in this enterprise for thirteen years.  

Esi is married and has two children.  Her husband works as a trader.  The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.  

Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions.  In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married and caring for 10 children. She is running a business of fish selling and she has been doing this business for 3 years.

She first started by being a broker thus some one who coordinates business people who could buy in retail from wholesalers. Out of her wages she also started buying from wholesalers and could sell in retail.

Thereafter she was also able to buy from the fisher men at the lakes and then comes and sells in retail. This business has been of great help to her and her family.

Currently she is having a problem in capital thus her capital is low and yet she wishes to buy from manufacturers and comes to sell in wholesale.

This is why she is requesting for a loan of $1300 to enable her add on what she has so as to also buy from manufacturers and come and sell in wholesale than retail.

Retail selling is not bad, but only that delays if you have got much stock, so that is why she wishes to sell in wholesale.

Any assistance given will be appreciated. She is a capable woman and will be able to pay.

loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en:
Kenedy has been in the business of making furniture for the last two years. He started the business in 2004. He is widowed and has one child who is going to school. He also takes care of his elderly father and mother, and he is paying school fees for his two brothers.

Since he started the business, he has been able to meet his needs from the proceeds of the business. With the loan, he intends to buy materials in bulk to enable him to reduce the cost and thereby maximize his profits.

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. joined the Women's Trust loan program in March 2006. In a year's time, she has repaid loans of $55, $88, and $100, and established herself as an excellent client. She has three children and lives in housing that was once barracks for workers on an agricultural station three miles from the center of Pokuase. Each day, Comfort makes 4 to 5 gallons of wheat porridge and sells it from a pan she carries on her head as she walks the three miles to Pokuase center and back.

In this past year, Comfort has assessed that her neighborhood is lacking in prepared food businesses and has begun to develop a clientèle for a small restaurant (chop bar). She has laid a stone foundation. With her porridge profits, she has begun raising chickens and goats for the stews she plans to serve when her restaurant is completed. With the help of two employees, Comfort is currently serving fufu and stew alfresco on-site to enthusiastic diners, and she continues to sell porridge in town each morning. Comfort's gradual growth business plan is sound. With $500, she will be able to complete construction and purchase provisions for the Fast Corner Chop Bar.

loans.use: Construction costs and operating capital for the Fast Corner Chop Bar

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila owns and operates a very successful business in a small market where she sells sausages, mayonnaise, butter and different types of cheeses. There are several large supermarkets around the market where Ludmila works but she has many close relationships and has built up a good repertoire of loyal customers. Ludmila is a wonderful person. She is funny, has a wonderful sense of humor and is very personable and reliable. She has a 6 year old son. Her husband, Dimitry, works along side of her in the business.

Ludmila has requested a loan to purchase a small freezer for her market location which will allow her to store more produce for a longer period of time. She would also like to purchase a larger inventory of products. Such products are needed almost daily and Ludmila is very excited at the prospect of offering such a good and fresh assortment. She currently makes about $400 to $500 a month and has $800 to $1,000 invested in products. She has been and is a very dependable person in her loan payments with Nadiya Ukraine.

loans.use: Ludmila would like to purchase a freezer and inventory for her dairy and sausage market.

loans.name: Anye Felicia

texts.en:
The plight of the widows in this area is not something to ignore, especially when the relations of the late husband inherit all his property even when the widow is still alive. This is the story of Felicia, who was sent away from her late husband's house by her in-laws.

She therefore had to fend for herself and her family, and thanks to GHAPE she was able to start a business with the loan given her. With her first three loans amounting to $300, she was able to raise money to put back into her business.

With a loan of $400, she plan to sell cooked beans and puff balls, cultivate crops, and rear pigs. She will use the profit to educate her children.

Felicia plans to repay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and feed, seeds, clearing, tilling, beans, flour, firewood

loans.name: Doris Ondina

texts.es:
My name is Doris Z. and, for the past three years, I have run a business cutting hair for men and women. I have a good record for customer satisfaction with my services. I am asking for a loan to make improvements to my place of business and for the purchase of various beauty supply products such as shampoo, hair dryers, hairbrushes, styling gel, etc. With this investment I hope to increase my earnings and improve my standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

mi nombre es Doris Z., me dedico al corte de cabellos a damas y caballeros, actividad que realizo hace 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta como les corto el pelo especialmente a los caballeros, Actualmente solicito crédito para invertirlo en el mejoramiento del local y en la compra de materiales de belleza como shampoo, secadoras de pelo, cepillos shampoo, gel, etc. Con esta inversión espero incrementar mis ingresos y mejorar mi condición económica.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for hair salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of produce such as garlic, lemons, and onions

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A. is a trader who deals in smoked fish. She is a well known fishmonger at Elmina where she lives. She is married with eight children who assist her in the business during school holidays. Her husband is also a trader. She buys her fresh fish from Axim, Sekondi in the western part of Ghana and smokes them before selling them.

Diana has a lot of customers, but one major challenge that she faces is that she is not able to buy the fish in large quantities because of lack of capital and also, part of the capital is being used as her transportation expenses. She is therefore asking for a loan of US $1,200 to enable her buy the fresh fish in large quantities to enable her meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: She is asking for a loan of US $1,200 to enable her buy the fresh fish in large quantities to enable her meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Dalias (Grupo 1) Group

texts.es:
The ladies that make up the communal bank Las Dalias are an example for the world on the topic of respect. In this group we can find clients who speak Kachikel Maya, Tzu’tujil Maya, and Spanish. They are respectful of each other, and when one doesn’t understand the language of another, they continue in Spanish. The communication and organization of this group is also outstanding. They appear to be an organized and accomplished communal bank. This harmony has been achieved over a period of almost six years, during which they have solicited eleven loans.

These clients have also developed as businesswomen. Many of them are successful raisers of livestock. Most of them raise and sell pigs, cows, and chickens.

A considerable number of the group’s clients usually decide to buy one or two bulls, between four and six pigs, and twenty or forty chickens. For example, María C. is going use her loan to buy four pigs and twenty chickens. The ladies feel this is what is most advisable for them and that this is what is in highest demand in the market.

Las Dalias is a group that, through the years, has formed an unbeatable friendship. One lady commented that one of the many benefits of working in the methodology of communal banks is that all the participants know each other like family. Josefina C. commented that if one of the participants falls ill, the rest get foodstuffs together to take to the family of the sick person.

This communal bank is a good example of the success of micro credit and the methodology of communal banks because the members developed ties of friendship and have become successful entrepreneurs. Because of this we need to continue supporting them so that they can continue advancing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Las señoras que conforman el banco comunal Las Dalias son un ejemplo para el mundo en lo que respecta tolerancia. En este grupo podemos encontrar clientas que hablan Maya-Kachikel, Maya-Tzu´tujil y español. Las señoras se respetan mutuamente y cuando una no entiende la lengua de la otra proceden a hablar en español. La comunicación y organización de este grupo también es resaltante. Se ve un banco comunal ordenado y cumplido. Esta armonía se ha logrado a lo largo de casi seis años, en los cuales ellas han solicitado once préstamos.

Estas clientas también se han desarrollado empresarialmente, muchas de ellas son muy exitosas en lo que respecta crianza de animales. La gran mayoría trabaja criando y vendiendo marranos, vacas y pollos.

Una porción considerable de las clientas del grupo con su préstamo usualmente deciden comprar de uno a dos toros, de cuatro a seis marranos y de veinte a cuarenta pollos. Por ejemplo, María C. va a comprar con su préstamo dos toros, seis marranos más comida concentrado. Mientras que Marta L. va a comprar cuatro marranos y veinte pollos. Las señoras miran que es lo más conveniente para ellas y que es lo que se está demandando más en el mercado.

Las Dalias es un grupo que a lo largo de los años han formado una amistad inigualable. Una señora comentó que uno de los tantos beneficios de trabajar en la metodología de bancos comunales es que todas las integrantes se conocen como familia. Mientras que Josefina C. comentó que si una de las participantes se enferma, todas juntaban víveres para llevarlos a la casa de la enferma.

Este banco comunal es un buen ejemplo del éxito del microcrédito y la metodología de bancos comunales porque las integrantes desarrollaron lazos de amistad y encima se han vuelto empresarias exitosas. Es por eso que las tenemos que seguir apoyando para que sigan saliendo adelante.

loans.use: To buy cattle and feed; to buy and sell clothing; to buy food products

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret A. is a 41 year-old single mother of three. For the past 10 years, she has been supporting her family by selling second-hand clothing. She is requesting a loan of $175 to buy towels, bed sheets and clothing to sell. She hopes this loan will enable her to reach more customers and improve her profits so she can better provide for her children. Margaret is also a member of a lending group called “Calvary Group”, which consists of eleven members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: Margaret would like to buy towels, bed sheets and clothing.

loans.name: Tumuitike's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Tumuitike is 37-years-old and is married with three children; ages 16,14 and 12. Tumuitike has been a selling cloth since in 2001. She works from 7AM to 6PM and can earn a monthly profit of $190 from her sales.

Tumuitike has taken out two successful loans in the past to expand her business. She is requesting a third loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing in cloth sales and food vending.

loans.use: To purchase more sloths to expand the business

loans.name: Simona De Los Angele

texts.es:
Señora Simona is 38 years-old, is married, and lives in District 380. She has two daughters, a 13 year-old and a 15 year-old. Her husband works in construction in Costa Rica and sends her monthly remittances. For four years, she has worked to support her household by cleaning and ironing clothes because they had little income.

With this loan, she will build her own room in the front of her house so that she can have more space. She wants to have a decent home so that her family is safe and comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Simona es casada, con 38 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380 tiene dos hijas de 13 y 15 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en construcción en Costa Rica y le envía remesas mensuales, ella trabaja lavando y planchando tiene cuatro años de aportar debido ala necesidades del hogar ya que los ingresos eran poco.

Con el préstamo va a construir su casa en la parte de enfrente, lo cual le permitirá tener un cuarto solo y así estar más amplio. En el futuro es tener una vivienda digna que tenga las condiciones que le permitan tener seguridad y comodidad para su familia.

loans.use: Construction of a Home

loans.name: Telma Maria

texts.es:
Telma Maria O. is originally from the town of Cinco Pinos, where she owns her house and lives with her three small school-age children. She currently needs additional income to repair her house’s poor infrastructure, which for a long time has been deteriorating and requires new walls and a roof.

Aware of the need for repairs and concerned for her children’s safety, Telma began fixing her house. Lacking economic means, however, she has had to wait to continue the work. She attended a Ceprodel meeting to obtain the necessary credit, which she will use to purchase construction materials and hire help to continue with the work on her house. This support will ensure her children no longer run the risk of a problematic situation and will have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora Telma Maria O. es originaria del municipio de Cinco Pinos donde posee su casa de habitación que alberga a sus tres pequeños hijos en edades escolares. La necesidad actual de esta dama es la pronta inversión para eliminar la mala infraestructura de su vivienda ya que desde hace mucho tiempo atrás se ha venido deteriorando y hoy en día amerita el cambio de paredes y cambio de techo.

Consciente de esta necesidad y por la seguridad de sus pequeños hijos, ella comenzó a reconstruir su casa pero al hacerle falta el recurso económico se ha encontrado en espera para continuar con la obra. Hoy en día ha asistido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario con el cual continuar con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación por medio de la compra de los materiales de construcción y el pago de la mano de obra. De esta manera al recibir este apoyo, sus hijos dejan de correr el riesgo de alguna situación problemática y les asegura un mejor futuro para ellos.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Claudelino

texts.en:
Claudelino is 55 years old, separated, with only one grown daughter, and he lives in the neighborhood of Maria Auxiliadora in Carapeguà. He is a professional surveyor, and his first labor experience was working as an assistant surveyor in real estate for 10 years, which is what sparked his interest to choose this profession.

Today he has his own office in which he works, making plans, surveys, projects, and budgets to construct houses. He has been doing this for more than 25 years. He maintains a good clientele because there are few types of services like his in the area. He has his own house with all the necessary conveniences and a vehicle, and all of this was gained thanks to his enterprising spirit.

The loan will be used to make repairs to his vehicle.

loans.use: The loan will be used to make repairs to his vehicle.

loans.name: Milica

texts.en:
Milica is born 1968 and she is married. Her husband has a permanent job and his monthly salary is 800 KM. They do not have any additional monthly income. They have two children. Milica is a housewife and in her free time she bakes cookies and sweet pies which she sells. In the beginning, she did this just for her family and she helped her friends prepare cookies and pies for special occasions. Later she decided to start a small business baking cookies.

This is her first loan with our foundation in the amount of 600 KM. She will use our loan to buy materials and supplies needed to make the cookies that she will sell. She has permanent customers who already order from her. Her wish is to expand the business to attract more customers and generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: To buy material for making cookies.

loans.name: Safrida

texts.id: Masakan Padang yang menjadi menu utama di warung makan milik Safrida (50) merupakan makanan favorit bagi sebagian besar pelanggannya. Pinjaman periode pertama telah dilunasi dan pinjaman modal yang diberikan dipakai sebagai modal untuk mendukung usaha warungnya. Selain itu, yang paling penting adalah bahwa pinjaman dari KIVA telah sangat membantu sehingga sekarang dia bisa meningkatkan pendapatannya dari Rp.200.000 per minggu menjadi Rp.300.00. Dengan system pembayaran yang sebelumnya lancer dan tidak macet, dia berharap kali ini dia bisa diberi pinjaman modal usaha yang lebih besar, sehingga nantinya bisa mengembangkan usaha warungnya menjadi lebih besar lagi.
texts.en:
Dishes from Padang, the capital city of the Province of Western Sumatra in Indonesia, has become the primary menu items at Inon’s (age 50) restaurant, also the favorite dishes of the majority of her customers. The initial loan has been repaid and was used as funding to support her restaurant business. In addition, more importantly the loan from KIVA had assisted significantly until her revenue increased from Rp.200.000 (about USD22) per week to Rp.300.000 (about USD32). With this gradual repayment scheme, she hopes this time given this larger working capital loan, so that her restaurant business will develop and be bigger.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Working Capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Né le 15/12/1979 à Mission Tové, Koffi L. est marié et père d’un 01 enfant. Ils vivent dans le quartier Forever. Sa femme est ménagère. Frigoriste de profession, L. Koffi sollicite ce crédit pour ouvrir un atelier et s’équiper en matériels de travail afin de  s’installer et travailler dans les normes de sa profession.
texts.en:
Born on December 15, 1979 in Mission Tové, Koffi L. is married and the father of one child. They live in the Forever district. His wife takes care of the home. Working professionally in the domain of refrigeriation, he is requesting this loan to open a workshop and to get equipped with work materials in order to become established and to work normally in his profession.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a refrigeration workshop and to buy work materials

loans.name: Seema

texts.en: Seema baji is the wife of L. A. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and holy places. She is the mother of six children: two daughters and four sons. Her daughters and her younger son are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. She has been living in this city for the last 40 years. Seema baji’s husband manufactures clothes and sells them to different markets. He has been in this business for the last 26 years. Seema baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy thread to manufacture more clothes to sell in market.

loans.use: To buy thread to make clothes

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom P. is 34 years old, married, and the mother of four children, two of whom stay at home to do housework while the other two are too young to work or study. She and her family live in Prey Kla Thboung village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Choun Rath (on the left in the photo), owns loudspeakers which he hires to villagers to earn an income.

Mrs. Sarom P. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She faces some problems in her plantation -- the soil is infertile and some pests are so bad that they affect her crop. In order to deal these problems, she wants to buy fertilizers and pesticides. She would use the rest of money to hire some laborers to work in the field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her field.

loans.name: Mario Domingo

texts.es:
El señor Mario Domingo R. originario del municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua se dedica a la labor de carpintería, oficio que lo aprendió desde hace varios años en conjunto con sus hermanos y hoy en día le ha sacado gran provecho porque se sustenta de este negocio.

A sus 43 años de edad, el señor Mario R. es padre de familia y con cinco hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está en edad escolar y debe de mantener sus estudios. Por esta razón es que hoy en día ha buscado el financiamiento en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de la madera como material de trabajo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Domingo R. is from the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in Managua and works as a carpenter, a trade he learned several years ago along with his brothers. Today he takes great advantage of this [skill] because this business supports him. At 43 years of age, Mr. Mario R. is a father with five children, one of whom is school aged and should continue their studies. For this reason, today he has requested financial assistance from Ceprodel in order to benefit from a loan that will allow him to purchase wood as working material for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah U. is a hair stylist.  She also sells hair extensions and hair creams in her shop.  She is 26 years old and married.  She lives in Afro-Ajamgbadi, Lagos state, Nigeria.  She hopes for a N140,000 loan to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell.  She says thank you to all the Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions  and hair cream to sell.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Mr. Sang S. is a 50 year old farmer from Boeung village in Kampong Cham province. He owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is facing challenges in his current plantation because his field is infertile. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer as well as purchase recycled materials to resell in the factory. 

His wife, Mrs. Cheim Pach, works at a rice mill. They have four children of which one is a recycling collector while the rest are enrolled in the local school. 

His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and recycled goods

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Don Luis R. de 50 años de edad esta casado con doña Lina Pérez de 38 años, tienen 2 (dos) hijos, ambos en edad escolar.
En sus inicios don Luis realizaba sólo compostura de calzados para otro microempresario, hace aproximadamente 10 (diez) años que con mucho esfuerzo y visión de independencia adquirió sus maquinarias básicas para confeccionar calzados de diferentes tipos, éstos lo comercializa en forma directa o a través de microcomerciantes en la zona del departamento central.
El objetivo de este crédito es cubrir con propiedad la demanda de calzados por inicio de la temporada escolar.
texts.en:
Luis R. is 50 years old, married to 38 year-old Lina Pérez, and has two school-aged children. In the beginning, Luis only repaired shoes for another small business person.

About 10 years ago, with much effort and the vision of independence, he acquired his own basic machinery to make different types of footwear, which he sells directly or through small retailers in the central zone.

With this loan, he hopes to meet the demand for shoes at the beginning of the new school year.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of leather, insoles, and iron fittings

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
La señora Fabiana es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, D. la comunidad D. Taccapissi, sector Quellamaya, en el distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; ella tiene 42 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con 06 hijos menores y mayores. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 05 años, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado menor para engorD. (ovejas y porcinos), su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. ganado (ovejas cara negra) para engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias D. Zepita y Yunguyo.  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 1800.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas ovejas y toros para poder engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias D. Yunguyo y Zepita, su deseo es ver profesionales a sus hijos, por ello viene apoyándolos en sus estudios. .
texts.en:
Fabiana is a member of the Urbano Central community bank in the Taccapissi community of the Quellamaya sector. It is in the Copani district, Yungua Province, Puno zone. She is 42 years old; is married; and has 6 children (young and grown). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 5 years. She buys small livestock (sheep and pigs), fattens them, and sells them. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN which she used to buy livestock (sheep with black faces) to fatten and sell at the fairs in Zepita and Yunguyo. Now she needs a loan for an additional 1800.00 PEN. She promises to pay it back in 4 payments. With the money she would be able to buy more sheep and bulls to be able to fatten and sell at the fairs in Yunguyo and Zepita. Her wish is to see her children become professionals. For this reason she is supporting them in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more sheep and bulls to be able to fatten and sell

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Баротова Рано замужем, имеет 3 детей. Имеет среднее образование. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2007 года. Торгует на рынке более 5 лет фруктами и овощами. Ее основной бизнес привозит  оптом товар и сдает на рынке в розницу. Сейчас у нее сезон для оборота товара нехвататет средств. Она обратилась в Микроинвест за поддержкой . И благодарна , так как сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2007 года и не жалеет.
texts.en:
Rano B. is married and has 3 children. She has a high school education. Rano has been working with MicroInvest since 2007. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for over 5 years. Her main business is to bring products in wholesale quantities and resell them at retail prices. Right now is Rano’s busy season and she does not have enough resources to maintain her product turnover. She has turned to MicroInvest for support. She is grateful because she has been working with MicroInvest since 2007 and has no regrets. .

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela V. E., vive en Santa Tecla municipio La Libertad. Su negocio es la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, el negocio se encuentra ubicado frente al parque San Martin, donde hay mucha afluencia de personas que pueden ver a simple vista todo lo que Blanca tiene en su puesto, Blanca ya ha sido cliente de otras instituciones financieras y sus pagos han sido muy puntuales, hoy solicita un nuevo crédito por que quiere comprar mercadería para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela V. E. lives in Santa Tecla in the city of La Libertad. Her business is selling undergarments for women and men. The business is located in front of San Martin Park, where there are many people pass by and see what she has for sale in her stand. Blanca has been a client of other financial institutions and she has proved that she always makes her loan payments on time. She now wants more money to buy merchandise to stock her business.

(Translated by Elizabeth of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Darlin Celeste

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de Chinandega, la señora Darlin Celeste S. se dedica a su actividad de venta de carne en su propio establecimiento situado en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la carne y para ello espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así saldrá adelante en su negocio de venta de carne en su localidad.
texts.en:
At the Chinandega Central Market, Darlin Celeste S. sells meat in her own establishment, situated in the Central market of the city Chinandega. Now she has turned to Ceprodel for a loan with which to buy meat. She hopes and trusts that this loan will be granted, and help her keep her business selling meat in her local area afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing meat

loans.name: Anyash

texts.en: Anyash I. sells many kinds of electrical appliances such as VCD/DVD players, extension boards, bulbs, etc. in a store by the roadside. Anyash buys from Kumasi. He is 32 years old. He is not married but has a daughter who is currently in primary school. Anyash lives alone in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busiest business centres in the region. His daughter lives with her mother. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. He is hoping to expand his business and give his child a good education.

loans.use: To buy electrical gadgets

loans.name: Rosa Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de Urkupiña” ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos, posee estudios de educación superior (Profesora de secundaria) y vive en el Barrio Central.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de artículos de escritorio. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de cuadernos, lapiceros, hojas bond y otros artículos más para surtir su tienda.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gusta la confraternidad que existe en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the "Virgen de Urkupiña" communal bank, located in the district of Yunguyo, Chuchito Province in the state of Puno. She is 43 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She studied at the university level in education and lives in Barrio Central. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization since its start, with an initial loan of 300 Nuevos Soles to purchase office supplies. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 300 Nuevos Soles to purchase notebooks, pencil cases, paper, and other items to supply her store. Her biggest desire is to continue working. She likes the fellowship that exists in the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, pencil cases, paper, and other items to supply her store.

loans.name: Teofilo Cesar

texts.es:
Teofilo Gutiérrez Sánchez vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Villa la Merced, ladera norte de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Victoria Patti y sus dos hijas.
El señor Teofilo es mecánico y Trabaja en un taller de reparación de vehículos de su propiedad en su barrio, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos nuevas habitaciones en la parte posterior de su vivienda ya que sus hijas no cuentan con espacio para poder desarrollar sus actividades diarias.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Teofilo Gutiérrez Sánchez lives in his own house in Villa la Merced, on a hillside north of the city of La Paz, with his wife, Victoria Patti, and their two daughters.

Teofilo is a mechanic and works in a car repair shop that he owns in his neighborhood, and he supports his family with that income.

He will use the loanhe is applying for to build two new rooms on the back of his house, since his daughters don't have space for their daily use. This is the fourth time that he has requested a loan, and the socioeconomic evaluation performed qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es: Xiomara del Socorro Martínez G. tiene 40 años. Es casada. Es madre de 2 hijos, los 2 dependen de ella y están estudiando. Xiomara es una mujer muy luchadora esto fue lo que la motivo para salir adelante con sus hijos y este negocio que  es una pulpería. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Ha sido modificada para proporcionarle espacio a sus productos. En la actualidad ella tiene ciertos de clientes que viven en comarcas alejadas. Con este financiamiento lograra comprar arroz, aceite, cosméticos, jugos, gaseosas y golosinas en general. Xiomara ha hecho de todo para salir adelante con su familia y con su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Xiomara del Socorro Martínez G. is 40, and she is married. She has two dependent children who go to school. Xiomara is a fighter, and she is motivated to get a good future for her children. That is why she has her business, a mini market. The business is located in her home. It has been modified to provide more space for her products. She currently has some customers who live in neighboring regions. With this loan she will buy rice, oil, cosmetics, juice, soft drinks, and sweets. Xiomara has done everything to get ahead with her family and with her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a roasting machine for cereals

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora L., 42, lives in the town of Silang in the southern part of the upland Cavite province. Her husband Zosimo is a farmer. They have three adult children.

Nora is in the business of swine fattening and buying and selling fresh pork meat. She buys baby pigs and takes care of them in a pig pen until they grow and are ready for slaughter. She has been doing this for eight years and has found it to be very rewarding. She makes a profit of P6,000 per month. Before her pigs are ready for slaughter, she buys fresh meat from other farms which she retails to customers.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative four years ago. Her previous loans from the cooperative were used to improve their farm, especially their pig pen.

Her profits were used to purchase fertilizers and to pay for her children’s education. She wants all of her children to finish their studies, so she and her husband are working very hard, hand-in-hand.

Nora needs a loan of P12,000 to purchase commercial swine feeds and other farm supplies.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase commercial swine feed and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Thelma Floridalma

texts.es:
Thelma Floridalma sequèn Patzàn se dedica a la venta de productos de medicina natural, inicio su negocio atravès de una tìa quien vendìa este producto, ella la recomendò y al ver que si le dio resultado decidiò promover este producto que es bien conocido. Empezò vendiendo un paquete de medicina con un descuento del 25% con el precio de Q 798.00 lo cual le generò Q 200.00 de ganangia. Unos familiares le prestaron Q1,000.00 para iniciar su negoci de forma ambulante, por màs de seis meses estuvo ofreciendo sus productos de casa en casa al ver las ganancias, tomò la iniciativa en alquilar un local de manera independiente, le ha ido bien atiende un promedio de 14 clientas diarias con un consumo de Q22.00. Como se han incrementado sus ventas la empresa donde saca los productos medicinales le da un 42% de descuento en sus compras.
Su sueño es seguir una carrera universitaria pero como su familia es de escasos recursos sus estudios desde nivel primario lo ha hecho en plan fin de semana y ha trabajado para pagar sus estudios, Pero es asì como ella siente que ahora es màs independiente porque tiene mejores ingresos y puede ayudar a sus familia. Y desea que su negocio crezca  es su mayor anhelo.
texts.en:
Thelma Floridalma Sequèn Patzàn sells natural medicinal products. She started this business through an aunt who sold these products. Her aunt recommended it to her to see if it would give her results. She decided to promote this well known product. She started selling a packet of medicine with a 25% discount on the price of Q1,000.00, which generated Q200.00 of earnings. Some relatives lent her Q1,000.00 to start her business as a street vendor. For over six months she was selling her products door to door to see what her earnings would be. She took the initiative of renting a space in an independent manner. It has gone well for her. She waits on an average of 14 customers a day with a consumption of Q22.00. As her sales have increased, the business where she gets her medicinal products has given her a 42% discount on her purchases. Her dream is to pursue a university career. As her family has scant resources, her studies since primary school have had to take place on the week end. She has worked to pay for her studies. She now feels more independent because she has greater income and is able to help her family. Her biggest desire is that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural medicinal products

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora A. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 39 years old. Leonora is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used for inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Leonora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Range Group

texts.en:
R. F., age 45, is married with three children, ages 18, 12 and 4. He has had a second-hand clothing business for one year now. He works daily from 8am until 6pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $227.

This will be R.’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes for a loan to increase the stock of the second-hand clothes he sells. 
	
R. will share this loan with his loan group, Range, which consists of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, R. is first on the right.

loans.use: Increase second-hand clothing stock

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el del distrito D. Capachica, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 53 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 6 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Capana, estudió educación primaria (incompleta).

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 10 años, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. venta D. pescado.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar redes y corchos para sus labores D. pesca, además arreglar su bote.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse una casita en Juliaca.

A ella le  gustan las reuniones donD. pueD. compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Rufina is a member of the Juchuy Niño Communal Bank in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 53, in a common law marriage, and has six children. She lives in the Capana community. She attended elementary school, but she did not finish. She has been working with the Movimineto Manuela Ramos for ten years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her fish selling business. She currently needs a loan for 1,500 PEN, which will allow her to buy nets and floats for her fishing work. She will also fix her boat. Her biggest wish is to be able to buy herself a small house in Juliaca. She likes the meetings where she can share with her colleagues.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy nets and floats for fishing and fix her boat

loans.name: Superación Group

texts.es:
El grupo Superación está conformado por Lucia H. quien desde hace cinco años vende cosméticos de forma ambulante, Xochil B. comercializa ropa y Meyling M. que distribuye ropa y cosméticos en empresas.
	
Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras de gran capacidad y con muchos deseos de auto superarse. Estas necesitan dinero para mejorar sus negocios, aumentar su productividad y generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The group “Superación” has three members. Lucia H. has been selling cosmetics door-to-door for five years. Xochil B. sells clothing. Meyling M. is a clothing and cosmetics distributor. These hardworking women have great ability and desire to overcome any obstacle. They are in need of a loan so that they can improve their businesses, increase their productivity, and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida J. is a 67 year old married woman who lives in Brgy. Lag-asan, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She runs a restaurant with her husband, Antonio's help. They have two children.  One has a family and the other goes to school and also helps his parents with the business as part of his daily chores.

Lida’s joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 to improve her family's quality of life.  With the help of loans from NWTF-PD, she has increased her family income.  Now, she earns an average monthly income of Php 5,000.  Lida is a member in good standing. 

Her previous loan of Php  15,000 was used to fund the operations of her restaurant. She is currently borrowing Php 15,000 for her 16th loan to support her restaurant. Lida works hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations.  She wants a bright future and comfortable life for her family.
-------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow  Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women  through Project <i>Dungganon</i> (a Hiligaynon word that means  <u>Honorable</u>). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is  empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to  achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path  that will ultimately make them <i>Dungganon</i> - a title of esteem  that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through  a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Buy additional equipment for restaurant.

loans.name: Patak Pollerita Group

texts.es: “Patak Pollerira”, significa cien polleras (falda) es  un grupo  que recientemente se conformó para acceder al préstamo y los demás servicios que oferta Pro Mujer, se reúnen en el Centro Focal Exaltación, liderizadas por su mesa directiva así, Shirley B. es la Presidenta, como Tesorera está Maria A. y como Secretaria de Actas  Eva R.. Todas tienen diferentes negocios de producción, servicio y comercialización y necesitan el crédito para invertir en sus negocios y generar ingresos para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
“Patak Pollerira”, which means one hundred “polleras” (traditional skirts) is a group recently formed in order to access a loan and other services offered by Pro Mujer. They meet in the Centro Focal Exaltación, guided by their executive board. Shirley B. is the President, Maria A. is Treasurer, Eva R. is Secretary. All have different business in manufacturing, service and retail and they need a loan to invest in their businesses and generate income in order to provide a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and materials

loans.name: Ham

texts.en:
Ham S., 46, is married and lives with her four children in Batambong Province, Cambodia. S. sells groceries, meat, vegetables and fish from her home. She has been in this business since 2009 and is able to earn an income of $5 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker and farmer who grows rice on his own plot of farmland, earning $3 USD per day.
S. and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as meet their daily expenses.
