As a result, S. is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, CREDIT. She wants to use the loan to buy more groceries to sell, an ice crusher, and a bicycle for her husband. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell, an ice crusher, and a bicycle

loans.name: Manuel Ignacio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Villanueva en el caserío el jicarito el señor Manuel Ignacio Q. tiene su propio negocio de taller de reparación de mecánica, en donde trabaja arduamente para la manutención de su familia y la mejora de su vivienda.
El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de laminas de zinc, ya que el techo de la vivienda se encuentra en mal estado y para temporada de invierno se quiere alistar ya que necesita brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su  familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Villanueva in the El Jicarito neighborhood, Mr. Manuel Ignacio Q. has his own car repair shop, where he works very hard in order to maintain his family and improve their home. The loan he is asking for is to buy sheet metal, since his home's roof is in very bad condition. Winter is coming and he wants to get ready so he can provide the best quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheet metal for his roof

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny B. is a 50 year old married woman who lives in Ping Pong village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nhart Hem, are farmers who own 1.50 hectare field to cultivate rice. Right now is dry season, they want to cultivate rice but they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Ny B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and fuel to support her farming.
Mr. Nhart Hem is also a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family living. This couple has five children, one is a construction worker, three are students in the local school, and the last one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and fuel

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 38 year old single woman who lives with her parents and 2 siblings. She really likes arts and crafts works and she’s very artistic in this area. That’s the reason why in 2008, she opened her own handicrafts, chocolates, accessories, and gadgets shop to begin a new career and earn income. She offers beauty products to her clients and during this short period she has gained a good reputation in the whole region. 

Today, Rima is requesting to borrow $600 to buy artisanA. supplies and accessories for her shop, so that she can take more orders.

loans.use: To buy artisanal supplies and accessories.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor Y. is from the village of Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Flor is married and has 4 adult children. Flor owns & operates a fishing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Flor has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month (about $33 US) for these activities.

In 2008, Flor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  Flor successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan, her second, was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Flor is requesting her third loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en:
Bosede is 42 years old, has two children, and they are doing well. When our team visited her shop, she was not around as she took her aged mother to the hospital. Hence, her son is shown in the photo.

Bosede is a trader: she sells drinks at wholesale and retail prices and also supplies drinks for various ceremonies. She goes to the factory twice a month to get goods in large quantity at a discount rate. She has been in business for the past seven years and with this trade she assists her husband, who is into rental services, with the children’s upbringing.

Bosede has been a member of LAPO for the past three years and she is a faithful client. She is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more drinks to sell which will enable her to meet her customers’ demands and increase her profit. She says thank you to Kiva lenders for their support and promises to pay back her loan at its due dates.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Juana del Carmen O. G., tiene la edad de 37 años es casada, madre de 3 hijos, menores de edad y totalmente dependientes económicamente de la cabeza familiar, la familia habita en el barrio Pablo Calero, y  son agricultores desde hace 21 años.

Dentro de los principales planes para los cultivos, está el restablecimiento de nuevas aéreas de plantillos de piña, en los últimos meses las plagas han afectado la producción, y es por esta razón que ellos solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, vegetativos, y sobretodo fertilizantes que provean a las tierras mejores condiciones para la producción de una mejor cosecha, este apoyo que se le brinde a la señora O. le favorecerá a largo plazo en su economía doméstica para la inversión de nuevos proyectos de vida o para con su negocio, que directamente mejoren la calidad de vida de la familia. Este no es el primer préstamo de la señora Juana, ella tras los otros créditos, que ha tenido buenos resultados y mejorado sus finanzas, ella se siente capaz de inyectarle un mayor capital de trabajo, debido a que la demanda ha crecido en los últimos meses y ella espera suplir esta demanda, que le traerá un aumento en las ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana del Carmen O. G. is 37 years old, married, and has three young children who are financially dependent on her role as a head of household. Her family lives in the neighborhood of Pablo Calero and has been farming for 21 years.

Among the main plans for Juana’s farm is to reestablish a new crop of pineapples because pests have impacted her production in recent months. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can purchase farming supplies, seedlings, and especially fertilizers so that her land will be in better condition to produce a good harvest. This support will help Juana in the long term because she can devote her household finances to other projects that will help improve the quality of life for her family.

This is not the first time Juana has received a loan. Her previous loans have brought about good results and improvement to her finances. She is able to inject more capital back into her business because demand has picked up in recent months. Juana hopes to be able to meet this demand and experience an increase in her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies, seedlings, and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more stock for his business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora P. Montiel es  una señora de 23 años de edad la cual vive con su abuelita en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Aurora se ha destacado por ser siempre una  joven muy emprendedora.  Desde hace algunos años inicio su propio negocio una pulpería (tiendita de abarrotes) para vender productos básicos a sus vecinos en su propia casa; con este negocio ha logrado tener  una actividad económica rentable que la ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida y mantener a su abuela quien a sido su madre y padre toda la vida.

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢654.000(seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro  mil colones) para comprar los materiales necesarios para ampliar su local y así poderle brindar una mejor atención  a sus clientes. Ella comenta que el servicio que ella brinda es muy importante ya que tienen muchos clientes y por eso necesita más espacio.


Doña Aurora es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Aurora P. Montiel, 23, lives with her grandmother in a community called Hernández, located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province; this community is noted for being a mountainous region with vast scenery. It is also quite humid and it’s siturated along the highway that runs very close to the country’s northern border. Its main commercial activities are cattle-raising and farming, specifially basic grains, tubers and oranges. Aurora has always stood out for being an enterprising young woman. A few years ago she set up her own grocery store in her home to sell basic items to her neighbors. This store has provided her with a profitable economic activity that helps her improve her quality of life and support her grandmother who has been like a mother and a father to her her whole life. She needs a 654.000 colones loan to buy materials and supplies to enlarge her store so that she can provide better customer service. She states that the service she provides is very important because she has many customers and that’s why she needs more space. Aurora is a member of the “Unidos por un Desarrollo” (United for Development)communal bank, one of EDESA’s 100 member oranizations in Costa Rica. This will be her 1st loan and she expects to grow more both as a person and as a micro businesswoman with it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and enlarge locale.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
la señora Balbina G. tiene 55 años de edad es originaria de Langue Valle,  a pasado toda su vida en ese lugar dedicandose junto con su esposo el señor Ramiro Tobar al comercio, actividad con la cual han podido salir adelante y darles estudio a sus hijos.
junto con su esposo pagan los estudios de su hija que estudia medicina, tambien tiene una hija que es maestra y recibe ayuda de ella.
La señora Balbina G. se ha dedicado al negocio de las golosinas como ser venta de baleadas, avena con leche,
panqueques y café ademas hace tamales de gallina y cerdo para vender por las tardes.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para hacer sus golosinas.
su sueño es ver graduada a su hija que estudia medicina.
texts.en:
Balbina Gómez, 55, is from Langue Valle; she has spent her entire life there as a merchant with her husband, Ramiro Tobar; this activity has made it possible for them to get ahead in life and to educate their children. With her husband’s help she is paying for her daughter’s medical education; she also has a daughter who’s a teacher and she helps her out too. Balbina Gómez has sold sweets, baleadas [the basic baleada is a thick flour tortilla folded in half containing refried beans and grated queso duro (a hard salty white cheese), and mantequilla (a white sauce much like sour cream], oatmeal with milk, pancakes and coffee; she also makes chicken and pork tamales to sell in the evening. She will use the funds to buy more ingredients to make her snacks. Her dream is to see her daughter who is studying medicine graduate.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking oil, milk, oatmeal, meats, tortillas, beans, bread, soft-drinks.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba P. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and pillows at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dresses and pairs of trousers to sell.  Araba is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fess for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock dresses and pairs of trousers to sell

loans.name: Mayra Janneth

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mayra M. es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas, vive por la parroquia de Quinta Chica, esta parroquia es reconocida por su iglesia, siendo su mayora atractivo.

Nuestra socia tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres compartiendo  los gastos del  hogar, sus padres tienen casa propia.

La Señorita. Mayra es comerciante, esta actividad la realiza desde muy joven, ya tiene 10 años en este negocio, vende todo tipo de lencería y tiene un puesto propio en el mercado de la feria libre donde vende solo los días miércoles y el resto de días se dedica a vender cosméticos.

Se encuentra en la banca comunal y este es su segundo ciclo, está  muy contenta de pertenecer a este hermoso grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  lencería para tener más variedad.

Su sueño es estudiar y obtener un titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Mayra M. is a member of a communal bank called Estrellitas ("Little Stars"). She lives in the parish of Quinta Chica, which is known for its pretty church. Mayra is 23 years old; she is single and lives at her parents' home and shares the household expenses. Mayra has been running her own business since she was very young. She has now had the business for 10 years, selling linen of all types from her own stall in the market on Wednesdays; the other days she sells cosmetics. She became part of the communal bank and this is her second loan cycle. She is pleased to belong to this lovely group of enterprising women. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of linen, so that she has greater variety. Mayra's dream is to study, and earn a university degree.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase linen

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Arambala, Departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera, tiene cuatro hijos de las edades de 18,17,9 y 7 todos estudian actualmente, ella tiene una venta de comida y antojitos.
Hace 10 años se dedica a la elaboración de comida y antojitos (tostadas de plátano, yuca, papas frita) ella es una mujer trabajadora que todos sus esfuerzos son para apoyar a sus hijos. Ella solicita actualmente un préstamo para compra de una cocina industrial con plancha para hacer pupusas, esto contribuirá a generar trabajo a para que ella obtenga ingresos y mejore las condiciones de vida la familia.
Los sueños de María son apoyar a sus cuatro hijos para que terminen los estudios.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and lives in the town of Arambala, Morazán Department. She is a single mother; she has four children aged 18, 17, 9 and 7. They are all in school. She has a business selling meals and snacks. Ten years ago she started making meals and snacks (tostadas with plantains, cassava, and potatoes). She is a very hard-working woman who puts all her effort into supporting her children. María is requesting a loan to purchase an industrial stove with a press for making pupusas [a Salvadoran stuffed tortilla]. This will help her generate work so she can have more income and improve her family's living conditions. María's dreams are to support her four children so they can finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Industrial stove with press for pupusas

loans.name: Domero

texts.en:
Domero T. is from the village of Salimpuno, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old. Domero is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Domero owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing mechanical services and repairs for local community members. Domero has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Domero joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Domero has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Domero is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Domero from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Rosalina Alejandra

texts.es: Rosalina Alejandra es una mujer muy responsable tiene 3 hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues han sido muy provechosos, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocios sus inicios fueron muy difíciles actualmente los precios están muy variantes, pero no se deja abatir. Este financiamiento es destinado para comprar sandalias, zapatos deportivos, zapatilla, shorts.
texts.en:
Rosalina Alejandra is a very responsible woman who has 3 children who are no longer dependent on her. Rosalina sells general merchandise. This is not the first time that she has received financial assistance. She has been involved with this business for 6 years and initially it was difficult. The prices are very variable but have not lowered. The loan will go towards the purchase of sandals, trainers/sneakers, shorts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general merchandise

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en:
Monica B. is from the village of Cutog Grande, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Monica is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Monica is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Monica owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Monica has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Monica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Monica is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP for the same purpose. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Monica from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials for bread manufacture.

loans.name: Medardo Rafael

texts.es:
Medardo Rafael Rodríguez C. tiene 35 años. Es casado  vive con los hojas y la esposa, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Medardo pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Medardo trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener una casa y comprar terrenos para cultivar.
Le gusta caminar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Medardo Rafael Rodríguez C. is 35 years old and lives with his spouse in the Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. He has one son.

Medardo belongs to the group Ventanilla Dole, located in the precinct of the same name in the parish Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo. This group of 16 members is dedicated to short-cycle labors, mostly the cultivation of bananas.

Medardo works planting bananas on land that he leases. He does his shopping in Guayaquil and makes his sales from his home and in the Ventanas market.

He is seeking this loan to purchase merchandise to expand his business. This credit will help him to meet his needs. His dream is to have a house and buy land to cultivate. He enjoys walking and playing sports.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 67 años, es separado y vive en su casa propia en compañía de su único hijo, quien es mayor edad. Juntos forjaron su propio negocio. La especialidad de Santos, es reparar calzados, por ello cuenta un espacio apropiado dentro de su casa, en lo que lo ha convertido en un taller. Es ahí donde cose  los quiebres de los zapatos, así como cambiar  tacos y suelas. Sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos por el trabajo que realiza, es así que ha logrado tener 40 años trabajando en esta actividad, por lo que empezó aprendiendo de sus padres. Lo que más le gusta de su oficio es la comunicación y el trato que tiene con sus clientes, además que gracias a este trabajo puede generarse buenas ingresos económicos a su hogar. Con el tiempo, desea ampliar  y mejorar su taller, por ello se ha propuesto comprar otras maquinas mas sofisticadas, para lograr mayor eficiencia en el acabado de los calzados que fabrica. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar suelas, cueros e incluso enviará a reparar su maquina cortadora de suelas.
texts.en: Santos is 67 years old, separated, and lives in his own house with his only son, who is an adult. Together, they formed their own business. Santos's specialty is shoe repair, which he carries out in an appropriated space in his house he converted into a workshop. That is where he sews rips in shoes, and replaces heels and soles. His clients are satisfied with his work, and this is how he has made it in this business, which he learned from his parents, for 40 years. What he likes most about his job is the communication and good treatment that he has with his clients. Also, thanks to this work he can generate a good wage. With time, he wishes to expand and improve his workshop. He has proposed buying more sophisticated machines to achieve greater efficiency in finishing his shoes. This is his second loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments on time. With this loan, he will buy soles, leather and send his sole-cutting machine for repair.

loans.use: Purchase leather and soles, and repair sole-cutting machine

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Renacer, se conformó en fecha 16 de Setiembre del 2.008, mediante  la Sra.  Carolina V., quien ya había participado del programa en otro grupo.
 Ella es la actual presidenta del grupo y se dedica a la venta de bijouterie, fabricadas por  ella misma. 
Ella fabrica los bijouterie, de acuerdo a los pedidos que recibe de los clientes, además de los aros, gargantillas, pulseras, actualmente está comenzando con las zapatillas bordadas que tiene buena aceptación de los  clientes. 
Sus productos son muy admirados por los clientes y el deja buena ganancia, por lo que quiere continuar con la actividad.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de todos los accesorios que la ella necesita para la elaboración de nuevas mercaderías.
 Ella comenta que se encuentra muy satisfecha con el grupo y que desea continuar ya que todas trabajan con esmero ya en el 7º ciclo, y en la actualidad el grupo esta conformado por 19 mujeres que trabajan  en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
texts.en:
The 'Renacer' women's committee was created on the 16th of September 2008.  It was set up by Mrs Carolina V. who had already participated in another group in the program.

Carolina is the current group president and her business is selling costume jewelry which she makes herself.  She makes the jewelry according to the orders which she receives from her customers.  As well as making earrings, chokers and bracelets, she is currently beginning to make embroidered slippers as well which are proving very popular with her customers.  Her products are very much admired by her customers and maker her good profits.  For this reason, she would like to continue in this business.

She is requesting this loan to buy all the accessories which she needs to make her new goods.  She comments that she is very happy with the group and that she would like to continue as everybody is working with great care on their 7th loan cycle.  Currently the group has 19 female members who work together and with mutual support within the program.

All the group's members carry out business activities to make funds and they help each other out to achieve their common aims which they all have within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya.  They participate actively in the weekly meetings and work supportively in an impeccable manner.

loans.use: To buy different size and colored beads, sequins, pearls, etc.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok K. is a hard-working woman who has spent her life cultivating lotus crops. She has a few rental ponds where she grows lotus. Three months after planting, she harvests them to sell. Besides her work, she also goes with her husband to the river where they fish to earn additional income in order to fix the needs of their family. This couple has four school-aged kids who assist in their parent’s job when they are not studying. Sok K. has had great success growing lotus crops, which is an annual process. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year. Sok K. will be using the loan to replant the lotus crop and buy more tools to fish.

loans.use: To replant the lotus crop and buy more tools to fish.

loans.name: Selenita Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva Portoviejo de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Portoviejo.
 
La señora Selenita es socia del Banco Comunal desde hace dos años  y está muy contenta,  le encanta las reuniones porque aprende cosas nuevas y en ellas ha hecho muchas nuevas amistades. Tiene 41 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y fruto de esta relación tiene seis hijos, dos de ellos mayores y 4 de 16, 15,  13 y un pequeñito de dos meses, tres de sus hijos están en colegio. Su marido trabaja en el Municipio de Portoviejo.

Se dedica al comercio, vende juguetes y bisutería, ella se desplaza de pueblo en pueblo cuando hay ferias o fiestas, en estas ciudades se queda mientras duren las fiestas,  para esto organiza un local en el cual expende sus productos, nos cuenta que a veces se queda hasta por siete días seguidos en los lugares donde ella va. Lleva en este negocio ya 12 años y le gusta esta labor ya que así conoce muchos lugares de la provincia.

Este crédito es para comprar bisutería y juguetes. Su sueño es tener un bazar en su casa para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Nueva Portoviejo' community bank meet in the Nueva Portoviejo district of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Selenita has been a member of the community bank for two years and she is very happy.  She really enjoys the meetings because she learns new things and she has made a lot of new friends there.  Selenita is 41 years old and has a common-law husband.  She has six children from this relationship.  Two of her children are already grown up and the others are 16, 15, 13 and a little one who is just two months old.  Three of her children are in school.  Her husband works for the City of Portoviejo.

Selenita sells toys and costume jewelry.  She travels from town to town whenever there are festivals or fiestas.  She stays in the towns while the fiestas last and arranges a place where she can sell her products.  She tells us that sometimes she stays for up to seven days straight in these places.  She has been in this business for 12 years and she likes her work because through it she gets to know many places in the province.

Selenita will use this loan to buy costume jewelry and toys.  Her dream is to have a store in her home where she can sell her products.

loans.use: To buy costume jewlry and toys

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Leonada; ella tiene 44 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de venta de pollipapas, la socia vende en la plaza de Urcos, tiene su carreta donde todas las tardes a partir de las 5:00pm hasta las 10:00pm vende, la socia es una persona muy alegre y de esta manera saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para aperturar un restaurante y poder implementarlo con mesas, sillas, cubiertos, platos entre otros mas y  la vez también para comprar insumos para su negocio de pollipapá.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Qori Orcco". The bank is located in the district of Urcos, which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.
The member is Leonada. She is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. She combines her daily activities with her business selling pollipapas (a meal of chicken and potatoes). She sells in the market place in Urcos - she has a cart from which she sells her goods in the afternoons, from 5:00pm until 10:00pm. She is a very cheerful person and in this way she is moving her family forward in life.
The member is requesting a loan to open a restaurant and to be able to stock it with tables, chairs, cutlery, plates and other things and also to buy supplies for her polllipapas business. 
She is happy to have the loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: To open a restaurant and to supply it with tables, chairs, cutlery, plates, and other things and also to buy stock for her business selling pollipapas (a meal of chicken and potatoes).

loans.name: Emerlinda's Group

texts.en:
Emerlinda L. is from the village of District 1, in Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Emerlinda is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Emerlinda is single. To make a living, Emerlinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Emerlinda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Emerlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Emerlinda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Emerlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Guibay

texts.en:
Guibay N. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 50 years old. Guibay is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Guibay owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Guibay has been engaged in farming for 6 years now. 

Guibay joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guibay is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Guibay from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ekua Abokuma Theresa

texts.en:
Ekua Abokuma Theresa M. sells shea butter, beauty products and other items in Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast. She has been in this trade for nine years. 

Ekua has completed her senior high school education. She is married to a farmer and they have 5 children. Her earnings are used for their children’s school fees and household expenses. 

To improve her earnings, Ekua requires a loan to add quantity and variety to the products she sells. She will reinvest the profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To add quantity and variety to product line

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of clothing and textiles to sell.

loans.name: 0203015 Bac Son - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Ly N. T. (203093) is a 29 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Ly is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 0203015 Bac Son - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa. Ly is married and has an infant. To making a living, Ly operates a family member's business venture providing food services to local community members. Ly has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2011, Ly joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ly is requesting a loan for the first time from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Ly plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. T. Hang (203094) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. 2. P. T. Them (203095) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her general store. 3. T. T. Cuc (203097) is a 43 year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business. 4. M. T. Ly (203096) is a 43 year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her general store. 5. P. T. Hao (203098) is a 56 year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ly N. T. (203093) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Ly là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0203015 Bac Son - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ thực phẩm cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Ly thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Ly kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND. Vào 2011, Ly đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Ly đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. T. Hang (203094) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 2. P. T. Them (203095) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 3. T. T. Cuc (203097) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 4. M. T. Ly (203096) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 5. P. T. Hao (203098) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is 69 years old. He earns his daily bread through dairy farming.  He used to grow vegetables, but he has been a farmer for four years now, and he has employed one person.  He sells milk to people in his area.  Besides farming, he also has other employment.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business through loans.  He hopes to start large-scale farming in the future.  He has requested 20,000 KES to buy animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Zoila Balvina

texts.es:
La Señora Zoila Z. P. es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive en la comunidad de San Vicente que pertenece a la parroquia de La Victoria del Portete, este lugar  es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad de Cuenca a laborar en diferentes actividades.

La Señora. Zoila tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 20, 18, 15 y 13 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda en la economía del  hogar, sus tres últimos hijos  estudian en el colegio. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil.
 
Doña Zoila trabaja realizando bordados hace 20 años, cuenta con un pequeño taller en su casa y este oficio lo ha aprendido trabajando, labora todos los días dependiendo de cuanto trabajo tenga y sin un horario fijo. También cría cuyes, chanchos, gallinas y borregos  que son para su consumo y para la venta.

En la banca comunal está desde que lo fundaron, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para crecer en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zoila Z. P. is a member of the San Vicente community bank, which belongs to the parish of La Victoria del Portete. This place has a cold climate. Its people work with cattle and farming. A lot of them go every day to the city of Cuenca to work in different activities. 

Zoila is 42 years old. She is married and has 4 children, aged  20, 18, 15 and 13 years old. Her oldest son works and helps with the household expenses. Her three younger children go to high school. Her husband works as a bricklayer in contruction.  
 
Zoila has done embroidery for 20 years. She has a small workshop in her house and she learned this job by working at it. She works every day depending on how much work there is and has no set schedule. She also raises guinea pigs, pigs, chickens and sheep, which are for her consumption and to sell.

In the community bank, her loan will be used to invest in buying a cow to grow in this activity.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Big

texts.en:
Big S., 62, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. S. and her husband sell snacks, corn, and yams, earning an income of 4 USD each per day. Each month, the family has to spend 74 USD on food and 10 USD on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport vegetables and fish for sellers at the market. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike with a trailer attached

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama K. is a mother of five and makes her living selling slippers and bowls in the Elmina. She doesn’t own a store and sells her wares the traditional, mobile way: balancing them on her head and walking around the villages. She has been doing this for the past 12 years.

To provide better for her children, Ama wants to increase her earnings. She plans to do so by expanding her business. A loan from Kiva will allow her to purchase a greater variety of slippers and increase her stock of bowls. She also wants to add clothing to her items for sale.

She plans to save up her extra earnings for her children’s future, particularly their university education.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of slippers and increase her stock of bowls for sale

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith has a mixed farm that produces maize and beans that are all sold in the local market. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last two years in western Kenya. She also earns additional income from her cereals business in Kitale. Her major challenges have been poor weather conditions and fluctuating market prices for farm produce.

Edith has requested this loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her meet the basic needs of her family.

Edith hopes to increase her farm acreage and acquire two more dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kihanga Women's Group

texts.en:
44 year old Onesmus has been transacting his banana sales trade in Ntungamo for 30 years now. The fact that this happily married father of 7 is a farmer has been a place of advantage. His advantage is that most of the bananas he sells, are from his own farming efforts. His business longevity has not come easily. Like any other business person, has had to weather many financial storms during some seasons.

Being the philosophical and hard working gentleman that he is, Onesmus has taken most of the challenges in his business in his stride. This, in a way, has been his magic formula for success. Weekly, he says his sales profits total 130,000 shillings. He says with this Kiva loan he is going to purchase high grade manure for his banana farms.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure for his banana farms.

loans.name: La Merced (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jazmines de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal La Merced.
 
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios que hasta la fecha tienen. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, agricultura, etc.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Margarita, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad, dos son independientes y el menor estudia medicina en Cuba. Su esposo es Abogado.

Ella es Lic. En Ciencias De la Educación y trabaja de maestra en un colegio en la ciudad de Tosagua, también se dedica a la venta de productos de Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja vendiendo sus productos los fines de semana en las tardes  y noches cuando puede, nos cuenta que aprovecha las ofertas ya que ahí ella compra a mitad de precio y luego las vende a precio real y con esto le queda mejores ganancias, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. son siete meses que se  dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su meta es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the communal bank "La Merced", made up of 15 members, meets in the residential area known as Los Jazmines in the city of Portoviejo, the Manabí capital known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.  This group is comprised of people who decided to unite and form this communal bank which is very helpful since the loans allow them to improve their small businesses.  They are involved in different activities such as commerce, services, agriculture, etc.

Here we meet Mrs. Margarita, 50, who is married and has three adult children, two of whom are independent while the youngest studies medicine in Cuba.  Her husband is a lawyer.  She has a degree in Education and works as a teacher at the school in the city of Tosagua.  She also sells Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She sells her products on the weekends and in the evenings when she can.  She takes advantage of the offers since she can buy at half price and then sell at the real price, so earns a good profit.  She delivers on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She has been in this business for seven months and it is going well for her.

The loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.  This is her first term in the communal bank which she likes because loans are granted quickly and without many requirements.

Her goal is to own a bazaar.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 35 years old and married with 6 children. Analy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of items like bread, curls, sugar etc. to sell. She has been running the variety store for 20 years and also earns an income from selling firewood. Analy has borrowed and paid 9 previous loans from NWTF. 

Analy aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of items like bread, curls, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Alex Jesus

texts.es:
En Soledad, un municipio del departamento del Atlántico, a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, habita Alex de 37 años, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 3 y 6 años respectivamente.  Allí tiene su negocio de marroquinería,  mediante el cual  confecciona  bolsos. 
Alex hace muchos años comenzó una experiencia emprendedora y de mercado, vendiendo pudines de tienda en tienda. En esta actividad conoció a una mujer que le enseñó a fabricar bolsos,  Alex se interesó mucho en aprender y por eso practicaba esta tarea, con mucha frecuencia en la casa de esta señora, con quien finalmente organizó su hogar y con la que trabaja persistentemente para salir adelante, cada uno con su propio negocio, pero eso si unidos para lograr bienestar en su hogar. El negocio de Alex tiene  10 años de haber iniciado, sus bolsos son  comercializados en las ciudades  de Barranquilla Santa Marta y Cartagena, tres estrellas del mar caribe que descansan en la orilla de las playas;  cuenta  con 3 empleados incluyéndolo a él, el cortador, el costurero y él que engoma; anteriormente estaba ubicado en el centro de Soledad y desde hace un año funciona en un barrio de este municipio, más cerca de Barranquilla.
Su meta más adelante es abrir nuevos mercados, para ver crecer a sus hijos prósperos y potenciarles su éxito, ayudándolos a que se conviertan en profesionales.  Mientras esto ocurre se esmera trabajando y buscando la forma de aumentar su capital de trabajo, para responder a su creciente clientela, razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una máquina plana y materias primas para fabricar un buen numero de productos, porque planea  e producir más e incursionar en los mercados de Sincelejo y Valledupar otras ciudades de la Costa. Sus estados financiero están acordes a la actividad que desarrolla Alex y reflejan el buen momento que está pasando el negocio, sus ventas   cubren  todos los gastos y maneja  un  margen de utilidad neta no menor del 6.85%, mientras sus cuentas por cobrar rotan cada 5 días y  inventarios cada 20.
texts.en:
In Soledad, a municipality of the department of the Atlantic, 10 minutes from the city of Barranquilla, lives Alex, age 37, with his spouse and 2 children, aged 3 and 6. In this place he operates his business, a leather goods shop where he makes purses. 

Many years ago, Alex began his first experience with the market and entrepreneurship, selling puddings from store to store. In the course of this activity, he met a woman who taught him how to make purses. Alex was very interested in learning, and because of this he practiced the skill with great frequency at this lady's home, ultimately moving in with her and working with her on an ongoing basis. They strove to get ahead, each with their own business, but united in the effort to achieve well-being in their household. Now, Alex's business is 10 years old, and his purses are sold in the cities of Barranquilla, Santa Marta and Cartagena, three stars of the Caribbean Sea which nestle by the beaches along the coast. He has 3 employees, including the man who cuts the leather, the designer and the man who glues the pieces. He was previously located in the downtown area of Soledad, but since 1 year ago he has been working in a neighborhood of the municipality, closer to Barranquilla.

His goal for the future is to expand into new markets, so he can see his children become prosperous and provide them with chances for success, helping them to become professionals. In the meantime, he is continuing to work with dedication and looking for ways to increase his working capital in order to serve his growing customer base. For this reason, he applied for a Kiva loan, his first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will use the loan to buy a sewing machine and raw materials to manufacture a range of products, because he plans to expand his production and enter the markets in Sincelejo and Valledupar, other cities of the coastal region. Alex's financial status is consistent with the business he operates, and it reflects the good times his business is experiencing. His sales cover all expenses and give a consistent net profit margin of no less than 6.85%, while his accounts receivable turn over every 5 days and inventory every 20.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Felegona

texts.en:
Felegona is 45 years old, married to Jacob, and they have 6 children who are all above 10 years old.

Felegona has a grocery business that she has been running for the past 25 years. She is currently applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a friend who is also a KADET client. Felegona wants to use the money to buy watermelon, lemons, coconuts, mangoes and oranges to add to her stock.

She hopes to be able to build her own residential house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, lemons, coconuts, mangoes to add to her stock

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Marcosa has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Marcosa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marcosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Carmen Delpilar

texts.es:
La señora Carmen, es socia del banco comunal Las Colinas del Distrito Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años, está casada, tiene dos hijos y su esposo se desempeña como mecánico.
Lleva tres años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de desayunos desde las 6 a las 10 am, una empleada le ayuda con la atención al cliente.
Con su nuevo préstamo de PEN 2,000.00 invierte en tres juegos de mesa y sillas para dar más comodidad a sus clientes, ademàs va a comprar platos tendidos, vasos, un balde para refresco y dos ollas medianas.
Con los ingresos que tiene puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del colegio de sus hijos y puede contribuir al bienestar de toda la familia.
Le gustan las sesiones educativas que reciben las socias de parte de las promotoras y agradece mucho a Manuela Ramos las oportunidades y todo lo que ha logrado hasta el momento.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Las Colinas del Distrito Yarinacocha” (The Hills of Yarinacocha District) in Ucayali Department.  She’s 41 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband works as a mechanic.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  She sells breakfasts from 6am to 10am; she has an employee that helps with customer service.

She will use her new, PEN 2000, loan to buy three sets of dining tables and chairs to provide more comfort for her customers.  She will also buy flat dishes, glasses, a bucket for beverages and two medium pots.

With her income she’ll be able to help her husband with her children’s school expenses and contribute to the entire family’s wellbeing.

She likes the educational sessions the members get from their advisors and is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunities it has provided and for everything she’s accomplished to date.

loans.use: to buy sets of dining tables and chairs, dishes, glasses and pots.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, 37 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a farmer, earning the income of $2 per day. They have four children; two are studying, and two more are working in the factory with $5 per day in income for all. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $9 on electricity, $6 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for farming. This couple does not want to change their career, and they enjoy doing farming. In the future, she only wants to support the rest of her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
La señora Digna vive en la aldea el Cerro de Marcovia, ahi vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Digna se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza desde su casa de habitacion, todos los dias se levanta temprano para elaborar sus tortillas.
Digna tiene la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña y cal, Digna trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos los cuales los necesita para darle estudios y una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Digna lives in the hamlet of El Cerro de Marcovia with her husband and two children. Digna makes and sells tortillas from her home. She gets up early every day to make her tortillas.
Digna's husband helps cover the household costs.
She will use this loan to purchase corn, firewood and lime. Digna works very hard to get her business ahead and to make a better income. She needs this in order to offer her children an education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and lime.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is married with five children who are in school. She is engaged in a hog raising business. She has been in this business for over four years. Jovita’s dream is to uplift her family  out of poverty.
Jovita needs  additional capital to sustain her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase feed for the maintenance of her hogs. Jovita believes that impatience never commanded success that’s why she is keeping on being patient and hardworking. Jovita hopes that her dream becomes reality through her earnings from the business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has two children: a 4-year-old boy and a 2 ½ year-old girl. They’re both currently enrolled in school. Josephine owns a rental house as well as a vegetable stand, selling her goods from home. She's worked in this business for two years. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She says her greatest business challenge is seasonality and her largest monthly expenses are food, electricity bills, and school fees. 

Josephine will use this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy cement, stones and other supplies to construct a new rental house. Josephine hopes to add more rooms to her rental house in the future. She joined Yehu to improve her business and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cement, stones and other supplies to construct a new rental house.

loans.name: Maria Fely

texts.en:
Maria Fely is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. She has a stall at the market where she sells the meat of pigs she has butchered. She has had this business for five years. 

Maria Fely has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more pigs to be butchered.  She became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to be butchered.

loans.name: Gidion

texts.en:
Gidion, age 26, is a teacher. He feels that he needs to acquire more skills by going to school to pursue higher education. He is requesting a loan in order to pay for his school fees.

He dreams of eventually getting married and building a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Makump Family Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very please to present to you members of the “Makump Family” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,200,000 SLL for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Idrissa is the leader of this group. Idrissa is 40 years old and is married with eight children – two in primary school, four in secondary school and two adults. Idrissa sells biscuits, soft drinks, sugar, mints, salt, etc. He has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Idrissa will invest in his business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to his shop.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, mints, salt, etc. in bulk to add to his shop

loans.name: Alba Doris

texts.es: La señora Alba Doris a sus 43 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía como ropa y productos por catálogo, esta actividad la realiza desde hace muchos años. La señora Alba Doris desea comprar mercancía tal como prendas de vestir femenina y masculina, con el fin de tener surtido para la temporada de fin de año. Asimismo, lo anterior le permitirá incrementar las ventas y podrá brindarle a su único hijo bienestar y una buena calidad de vida. El deseo de la señora Alba Doris es ver crecer su negocio y a futuro tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Alba Doris is 43, and sells merchandise such as clothing, as well as products by catalogue. She has been doing this work for many years. Alba Doris wishes to buy merchandise, such as articles of women's and men's clothing, with the aim of having stock for the year-end season.  

This will allow her to increase her sales. She will be able to provide for the well-being of her only son, and give him a good quality of life. Alba Doris wishes to see her business grow, and in future to have her own store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as women's and men's clothing.

loans.name: Abeie

texts.en:
Abeie is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. All three of them are in school. For two years, she has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan.
Abeie requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions, oil, and sugar for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase oil, onions, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells pineapples and boodo (a dish made from maize) at Ankwanda near Elmina. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a fisherman. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy other kinds of fruit to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Angie Lorena

texts.es: La joven Angie Lorena a sus 20 años de edad es madre de una hija de 4 años, se dedica a prestar servicios de Internet en tres computadores que tiene adecuados en la sala de su casa. Con el ánimo de prestar un mejor servicio, ofrecer nuevos productos y mejorar sus ingresos, la joven Angie Lorena necesita de la compra de insumos de papelería para ofrecer un mejor surtido. El sueño de la joven Angie Lorena es que su negocio crezca y ofrecer a su hija una buena educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Angie Lorena, 20, is a young mother of a 4-year-old daughter.  She has an Internet Cafe with three computers that she runs out of the living room of her home.  In order to provide the best possible service, offer new products and improve her income, Angie Lorena must buy a variety of stationery supplies.  Her dream is to grow the business and giver her daughter a good education and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy stationery supplies.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a single 29-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his parents and three siblings, two of whom are working. His father works hard to enhance his family and children’s way of living.

In order to help his father provide, Mohammad started his own business as a DJ in 2007. He attends weddings and parties at customers’ requests.

Today, Mohammad wants to borrow $800 from Kiva’s partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new DJ equipment. This loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him to attend more events. In the future he plans to open his own music shop.

loans.use: to purchase new DJ equipment.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 63 years old and lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 

Epifania has a general store that sells a variety of products, such as oil, bread, and matches. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 49,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Epifania has been a member of PMPC for twelve years. In the future, she hopes that her cocoland will be back of his own for the additional income someday.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Messan

texts.en:
In 1968, Messan K. was born into a polygamous family in Anfoin. He is married with two children and takes care of a third. As a merchant at the market in Akodessewa, he is the sole provider of the family since his wife lost the strength to work following a prolonged illness. Mr. K. has taken management training and has expertise in his hardware business. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to take a stronger position in the market by renting a larger retail space and to increase his inventory. By so doing, he will enhance his revenues and improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Monsieur K. Messan est née en 1968 à Anfoin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Issu d’une famille polygame, il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants et a à sa charge une personne. Commerçant dans le marché d’Akodésséwa. Il est seul à s’occuper de toute de la famille car sa femme a perdu la force de travailler suite à une longue maladie. Ayant suivi une formation en gestion, il a une bonne maîtrise de son commerce des produits de quincaillerie. Il sollicite alors ce crédit de $1000 pour renforcer son activité en louant un magasin plus large et augmenter son stock de marchandises. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus en d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille

loans.use: Sale of hardware goods

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a very hard working woman with the desire to move forward in life. Laura is married and has two small children of 2 and 4 years of age. Her husband works in construction and his income is not sufficient to support his family. Given her needs, Laura began her own business by selling cosmetic products and later she added the sale of shoes. Thanks to her friends and acquaintances, her clients and business continues to grow.

Laura needs a loan for $375 dollars to buy the merchandise she needs to satisfy her clients’ orders and to offer a better service. She plans to repay her loan within 5 to 10 months. With your help, you can contribute to the growth of this business and help Laura and her family improve their quality of life. They sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Laura es una mujer muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, de 2 y 4 años de edad, su esposo es albañil y el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para el sustento de su familia, ante esta necesidad Laura inició con la venta de cosméticos, y después incorporó la con la venta de calzado, gracias a las amistades y conocidas que tiene, sus clientes se han incrementado y su negocio ha estado creciendo.

Ahora Laura necesita de un préstamo por $ 375 dólares para comprar la mercancía que necesita para surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y poder ofrecer un buen servicio, ofrece devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Con tu ayuda Laura y su familia pueden mejorar su calida de vida, contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise/ Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto Diaz is 33 years old. He attended school up until the third year of his secondary education (high school). The terrible economic situation forced him to abandon his village and to move to the ciy in search of work to help him sustain his family.

He started working in a shoe store, and within some time started saving. Several years later, Roberto was able to open his own shoe store and establish a great clientele. Roberto enjoys his shoe store business. However, beyond his dedication to the shoe store and in the hope of increasing his income, Roberto decided to work in a tire shop. His business is situated on one of the country's principal routes. There are no other tire shops in this area.

Today, Roberto envisions expanding his business, selling new and used tires. He asks for a loan to purchase new and used tires for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Roberto D. es un hombre joven de tan solo 33 años; curso sus estudios hasta el tercer año de la secundaria, luego la mala situación económica lo obligo a abandonar su pueblo y mudarse a la ciudad para buscar un trabajo que le ayude a su familia con el sustento.

Empezó trabajando en una zapatería y de a poco fue ahorrando; varios años después Roberto pudo independizarse y montar su propia zapatería donde tiene muy buena clientela. A Roberto le va bien con su zapatería, pero además de dedicarse a la zapatería y en miras de aumentar sus ingresos, Roberto, decidió hacer también trabajos de gomería, ya que su negocio está situado sobre una de las rutas principales del país y en la zona no existen otras gomerías.

Hoy Roberto tiene deseos de seguir expandiendo su negocio y vender cubiertas nuevas y usadas en su negocio para lo que solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de cubiertas nuevas y usadas para venderlas.

loans.use: To purchase new and used tires

loans.name: Ayubdjon

texts.ru:
Ayubdjon H. is 27 yrs old, married and has a college diploma. He has been selling food since childhood because his father was not able to support the family due to frequent illnesses. He used to work/sell together with his sister, working on busy city streets with no fixed location. This resulted in frequent warnings and harassment from local authorities concerned about public order in central city streets. Such disruptions greatly affected his earnings, down to the basic ability to earn enough to feed himself and his family.

After learning about the collateral-free credit program at MLF MicroInvest he became a member in 2002 and obtained a loan for $100. Gradually he increased the variety of his offerings and most importantly was able to obtain a permanent trading stall at the central city market. All this showed his dedication to the MicroInvest program and his discipline. In the future, he plans to use the loans to move into wholesale trade.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Хакимов Аюбджон – 27 лет ,женат образование среднее. С детства занимается торговлей продуктами питания, поскольку его отец не в силах обеспечить семью материально из-за частой болезни. Торговал со своей сестрой в многолюдных улицах без постоянного место деятельности и постоянных натисков местных органов по порядке центральных улиц, что сильно влияло зарабатывать хотя бы на хлеб. Узнав о программе без залогового кредитования для микро-предпринимателей в МЗФ «Микроинвест» Аюбджон без сомнения стал кредитоваться с 2002-го года с активами на 100$. Постепенно он увеличил свой ассортимент товара, добавил продукты питания и кроме всего приобрел постоянную точку деятельности в центральном рынке города, что говорит о его дисциплинированности перед программой. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: To move into wholesale trade

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is a hardworking and responsible father who has been able to educate and care for his children. He is now able to proudly observe his children as they work in their various fields to take care of families of their own. He shares his joy with his lifelong companion and wife in their now empty nest filled with indelible memories. He has been able to accomplish all of this through the economic benefit that he has received in the last 25 years by getting up early every day to distribute fodder (animal feed) that he has harvested. Though lately his income has decreased as a result of competition from others, he is still able to support himself through this activity. Even so, because of his advanced age and the physical labor that the job requires, he would like to open a small store in his home. He plans to work incessantly to make this a reality. Juan is requesting a loan to grow and consolidate his small business so that he can save enough money to realize his dream of opening a store in his home. Let’s make the dreams of Juan and his wife reality.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Don Juan es una persona muy trabajadora y esforzada que como padre responsable ha cumplido satisfactoriamente con la obligación que tiene todo padre de familia, el de educar y sostener sus hijos.Y ahora puede observar muy contento y orgulloso el desenvolvimiento de cada uno de sus hijos que se desempeñan en diversas labores para procurarles bienestar a sus propias familias. Ahora comparte la dicha de este hecho y su nido vacío lleno de recuerdos imborrables con su compañera de toda la vida, su esposa.Para realizar todo lo que se propuso siempre contó con el apoyo financiero que obtenía de la venta de forraje ya que viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 25 años, levantándose cada día muy temprano para poder distribuir su cosecha.Actualmente aunque sus ingresos han disminuido por la competencia de vendedores que existe aún puede sostenerse con esta ocupación. Sin embargo por su avanzada edad y por el esfuerzo físico que requiere este trabajo piensa abrir una pequeña tienda en su casa y para conseguir este propósito seguirá trabajando incansablemente.Solicita un préstamo para acrecentar y consolidar su pequeño negocio con el objetivo de ahorra lo suficiente para aperturar su pequeño sueño en casa.Hagamos que los deseos de Don Juan y su esposa se hagan realidad.

loans.use:
Purchase of seeds to increase savings and open a small store in his home

Compra de semillas para incrementar sus ahorros y aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
Maria is 23 years old and comes from a large and humble family. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. This became even more critical when her husband abondoned her and their three children. Because of this, and with the experience she had gained working in different jobs since she was very young, she was able to develop her business raising small animals, such as chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. She raises them in her house, and with the income she generates she is able to take care of her children and provide them with a better quality of life. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals so that she can grow her business and continue to improve their standard of living. With your help, this dedicated mother will be able to reach her goals.
