María, tiene 23 años de edad, proviene de una familia numerosa y humilde, las circunstancias difíciles y duras de la vida hicieron que conociera desde muy pequeña el valor propio del trabajo, aún más cuando su esposo la abandonó y se marchó de casa y dejándola desamparada con sus tres pequeños hijos. A raíz de estos hechos y de la experiencia que adquirió en diversas ocupaciones desde muy pequeña se desenvuelve sin ningún problema en sus actividades cotidianas; actualmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animalitos como gallinas, cuyes y cerditos, este trabajo lo realiza en su casa y con el ingreso que le genera le brinda una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijitos quienes son su mayor alegría. Solicita un préstamo para comprar más animales pequeños y luego venderlos cuando alcancen su etapa de comercialización; así mismo cree que con esta inversión podrá incrementar sus ganancias y su calidad de vida. Solidaricémonos con los sueños de esta dedicada madre para que pueda alcanzar sus sueños en corto tiempo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A GREATER NUMBER OF ANIMALS SUCH AS CHICKENS, PIGS AND GUINEA PIGS, GROW HER BUSINESS AND PROVIDE A BETTER LIFE FOR HER THREE CHILDREN.

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.es:
Norma, Mery and Beatriz have been part of Huascahura Communal Bank for 3, 1 and 3 years respectively. Since then, they’ve learned to be responsible, punctual and how to save money.

Norma is 34 years old and has 2 children. She sells cheese, hens and bread in the Ayacuchana forest fairs and brings fruits from Ayacuchana to sell to Nery Garcia produce market.

Mery is 35 years old and has 3 children. She works in different activities. Sells treats and candies at Huascahura high school entrance, she makes beautiful tapestries and hand maD. doilies that are sold to brokers and on Sundays makes typical Peruvian food to sell in her neighborhood.

Beatriz is 40 years old and has 1 son. She’s been selling groceries and vegetables in the Hatún, Rumi and Pichari fairs for the past 18 years.

They need this loan to invest in the purchase of celery, carrot, onion, potato, sugar, noodle, beverages, flour, hen, cheese and bread. Their dreams are to buy a grocery store, buy a car to transport their produce and to send their kids to college.

Translated from Spanish to English by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer

Norma, Mery y Beatriz pertenecen al Banco Comunal Huascahura, hace 3, 1 y 3 años respectivamente y el Banco Comunal lleva el nombre del lugar D. donD. son las socias. Norma tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Beatriz tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, mientras que Mery tiene 35 años y 3 hijos. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, a ser puntuales y responsables. Norma venD. quesos, gallina, pan, en las ferias D. L. selva Ayacuchana, y D. L. selva trae frutas, que son vendidos en el mercado Nery García. Por otro lado Mery venD. golosinas en L. puerta del colegio D. Huascahura, y también es artesana textil, realiza bellos trabajos en telar como tapices, pasadizos que son vendidos a los intermediarios, además D. estas dos actividades Mery venD. comidas típicas los días domingos. Mientras que Beatriz venD. abarrotes y verduras en las ferias D. Hatún Rumi y Pichari hace 18 años. Ellas necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1000 soles, 300 soles, que serán invertidos en L. compra D. apio, poro, zanahoria, cebolL., papa, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas, harina, gallina, queso, pan. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para las emergencias, enfermedad y para incrementar el capital D. sus negocios. Los sueños D. Norma, Mery y Beatriz son tener una tienda D. abarrotes, un carro para trasladar su mercadería y para L. educación D. sus hijos.

loans.use: Norma, Mery and Beatriz need a $650 loan to be invested in the purchase of celery, potatoes, carrots, onions, sugar, noodles, beverages, flour, hens, cheese and bread.

loans.name: Ni Komang Dwi Astuti

texts.id:
Living with parents in law did not allow Komang Dwi Astuti to be relax and did nothing. With the skill she had, Dwi opened a tailor that provides clothes sewing service. The business was initiated by her mother in law. Dwi is able to sew and produce various clothes such as kebaya, uniform, etc. Dwi sews everyday from early in the morning until afternoon, and sometimes she should work until late in the night when she gets more orders. It usually happens before school holidays ends or before the Hindu festivals. At fist Dwi was only a helper to her mother in law to sew, but now she has many customers. She invested Rp 1.000.000 to buy a sewing machine to help her working faster. She earns Rp.50.000,- as income, and use it to support her family living, for they have had a 6 moths old baby. Dwi’s husband, I Putu Wiartika who works as a construction worker, is very supportive to her in running the business. With the loan that she wish to get from Dinari, Dwi hopes to be able to develop her business into a bigger one, and to have more workers so that able to receive more orders.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Tinggal menumpang di rumah mertua membuat Komang Dwi Astuti tidak bisa hanya tinggal diam dan berpangku tangan saja, dengan ketrampilan yang dimilikinya Dwi membuka usaha menjahit baju yang awalnya usaha ini dirintis oleh mertunya. Bermacam-macam baju bisa dijahitnya seperti kebaya, baju seragam sekolah dan lain-lain. Dwi mulai menjahit dari pagi sampai sore hari, kalau orderannya banyak Dwi bisa lembur sampai malam hari. Biasanya hal ini terjadi pada saat akan memasuki tahun ajaran sekolah yang baru atau menjelang hari raya. Awalnya hanya sekedar membantu mertuanya tetapi sekarang berkembang karena pelangganya semakin banyak. Jadi dengan modal awal Rp 1.000.000 Dwi membeli mesin jahit agar pekerjaanya bisa lebih cepat selesai. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya karena Dwi sudah punya anak yang baru berumur 6 bulan. Suaminya, I Putu Wiartika, yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan sangat mendukung pekerjaan istrinya. Harapan Dwi dari pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari bisa mengembangkan usahanya menjadi lebih besar lagi dan memiliki keinginan untuk menambah jumlah tenaga kerja dan bisa menerima orderan lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine to enable receiving more orders and having more workers

loans.name: Atwa

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 48 year-old Atwa H., who is widowed with four children, aged between 20 and 30. In 2001, Atwa established a soft drink business. Working 9 to 12 hours a day, 7 days a week, and assisted by her children and one employee, she earns about $100 per month from this business.

Atwa has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan of $525 to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, water, juice, and milk. Given the hot weather and popularity of cold drinks, she hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $70. In the future, Atwa also plans to renovate or expand her shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drink, water, juice, and milk.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is 33-years-old and is married with four children; ages 15, 9, 6 and 2. Zakia has been selling soft drinks since 2005. She works from 9AM to 7PM and earns approximately $250 per month.

Zakia has taken out one successful loan to expand her business. She now hopes for another loan to increase her inventory of soft drinks for resale.

loans.use: To increase inventory of soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia has been a member of the communal bank "Azucenas" for 7 years. She lives with her partner, is 32 years old, and has two children. Along with her spouse, she sells shoes and new and used clothing. She has two stands in the "Las Américas" market. They also sell out of their home, both retail and wholesale. She obtains her merchandise in the city of Lima. Lida plans to begin a new business selling pottery.

Lidia needs a loan for $1075 which she will invest in buying vases, cloths, plates, and assorted pottery.

Lidia dreams of becoming financially stable in the future and of her business prospering.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas hace 7 años.

Lidia es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Lidia junto a su esposo venden zapatos, ropa nueva y usados, en el mercado Las Américas, donde tiene 2 puestos, sus ventas también lo realiza en su casa al por mayor y menor. Su mercadería es adquirida en la ciudad de Lima. Lidia tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de Locería.

Lidia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de vasos, cuadros, platos y locería variada.

Los sueños de Lidia son tener estabilidad económica para el futuro y que su negocio sea prospero.

loans.use: Purchasing vases, plates and other assorted pottery for her new business venture.

loans.name: Horm

texts.en:
Horm S., 61 years of age, lives in Kampong Cham Province where, despite being advanced in years, she and her husband work hard on a daily basis and maintain a household with five older children at home, two still in school and two working as laborers. She is a firewood saleswoman earning only $1 per day while her husband collects recyclable items from trash heaps and houses and earns a profit of $7.50 per day by selling them to local factories for reuse.

Horm S. would like to take out a loan to buy a plot of land on which she can build a solid home. The couple wants to be able to leave something behind for their younger children. With any left over cash, she plans to help her husband buy more recyclable items.

loans.use: To buy recyclable items and land.

loans.name: Delfin

texts.es:
Delfin Ricardo T. was born in the city of Santisima Trinidad in 1965. He has been married to his wife Maria Martinez for 3 years and they have four children, all young boys. Delfin works selling fruits and vegetables around the cities of Aregua, Luque and Asuncion, a business he's had for more than 10 years. He began his membership with the foundation as part of a group of enterprising men in 2007, and now has earned his own good credit and qualifies for the loan.

El Sr. Delfin Ricardo T. nació en la ciudad de Santísima Trinidad en al año 1965, esta casado con Maria Martinez desde hace trece años, tienen cuatro hijos todos varones y menores de edad.

El señor T. se dedica al reciclaje, al servicio de flete y comercialización de frutas y verduras con su carrito desde hace mas de diez años, recorriendo las ciudades de Aregua, Luque y Asunción. Se inició en la Fundación dentro de un comté de hombres emprendedores en el año 2007, hoy día ya accedió al crédito personal.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE VARIOUS FRUITS AND VEGETABLES IN LARGE QUANTITIES AND CONTINUE TO GROW HIS BUSINESS.

loans.name: Njuma's Wanawake Na Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
40-year-old Njumais is married, with six children between the ages of 4 and 22. Since 2004, she has been working from 7am to 1pm daily at her food vending business. She earns a monthly profit of $250 from her sales.

Njuma now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Salma.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is 22 years old and is married with a 5 month old child. She has been a bite and porridge seller since 2006. She works everyday from 6am to 5pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

Zaina has previously taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Zaina now requests a new loan to increase her current stock for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To increase her current stock.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Né le 18/11/1983 à Vogan, Mr Koffi A. est marié  et père de famille avec quatre (04) enfants à charge. Sa femme est une tresseuse. Ils habitent le quartier Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il sollicite ce crédit pour ouvrir un studio de photo et de reportage vidéo. C'est un jeun homme très dynamique qui mérite d'être appuyé.
texts.en:
Born on November 18, 1983 in Vogan, Mr. Koffi A. is married and raising 4 children. His wife does hair braiding. They live in the Hédzranawoé district in Lomé. He is asking for this loan to open a photography and videography studio. He is a very dynamic young man who merits support.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: opening a photography and videography studio

loans.name: Sardaran

texts.en:
Sardaran baji is the wife of A. A. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and religious places. Sardaran baji has lived in this city for 45 years in the same four-room house, which she owns. Sardaran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.

Sardaran baji’s husband has a shoe shop and also sells CDs. He has had this business for the last 16 years. He has a good reputation in the community. Sardaran baji is requesting a loan to buy more shoes and CDs to increase their sales and expand the business.

loans.use: Buy more shoes and CDs to sell in the shop

loans.name: Ni Luh Rahayu Astuti

texts.id: Mempunyai suami seorang pegawai swasta belum tentu dapat menjamin kebutuhan keluarga terpenuhi. Apalagi sekarang kebutuhan pokok semua pada meningkat.Tiga orang anak yang kini duduk dibangku SMA dan SMP membutuhkan biaya sekolah yang cukup banyak,oleh sebab itu Ni Luh Rahayu Astuti kini berusaha untuk membantu pendapatan keluarga dengan menjalankan usaha beternak babi. Karena kekurangan modal maka Ni Luh Rahayu Astuti mengajukan pinjaman ke Yayasan Dinari, karena selain mendapatkan pinjaman modal dari Dinari juga memberikan pelatihan bagaimana cara beternak babi yang baik, cara memberi pakan juga mengatasi penyakit,agar usaha yang dilakukan nantinya bisa mendapatkan keuntungan, dan ekonomi keluarga tercukupi. Pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari nantinya akan dipergunakan untuk membeli 2 ekor bibit babi unggul dan sisinya akan dipergunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak sampai babi ini laku terjual. Sesuai dengan program Dinari bahwa pinjaman akan dilunasi pada akhir periode pinjaman.
texts.en:
Having a husband who is a private official is not assured that the family’s needs are fulfilled. Especially as of now the cost of all primary needs had increased. Three children current in school (SMA and SMP) requires payment of substantial school needs, due to that Ni Luh Rahayu Astuti now expend effort to supplement the family’s income by performing the task of pig rearing. Due to insufficient capital thus Ni Luh Rahayu Astuti requested loan from Dinari Foundation, because beside receiving loan from Dinari will also receive training in the best ways of rearing pigs, method of feed and care to avoid diseases thus resulting in generating good profit, improving the family’s financial condition. This loan from Dinari will be used to purchase 2 piglets of superior quality and the balance to purchase feed and supplies until the pigs are sold. In accordance with Dinari’s program the loan will be repaid at the end of the loan.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets and livestock supplies (Anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Andrea Policena

texts.es: La señora Andrea es habitante de la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando su 5to crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para invertirlo en arenillar las paredes de su casa y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones económica del nucleo familiar, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 12 años estudia su quinto grado de educación primaria y la niña  de 9 años estudia su tercer grado, su esposo trabaja como colector de la Alcadia Municipal, ambos comparten los gastos familiares ya que son muy unidos, Andrea se caracteriza por ser muy responsable, honesta y ha demostrado buena conducta en la sociedad, ella es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo, padres y alumnos por ser una mujer muy humilde, su sueño es tener salud, estabilidad laboral y que sus dos hijos estudien para que lleguen a ser personas de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Andrea lives in zone #6 of Nueva Guinea. She's asking for her fifth loan with AFODENIC, which she'll use to invest in sanding the walls of her home, thereby improving the economic conditions of her nuclear family. Andrea has two children. Her is 12 years old and is in fifth grade. Andrea's daughter is 9 years old and in the third grade. Andrea's husband works as a collector in the municipal government. Both Andrea and her husband work to cover the family's expenses, and they're very close with each other. Andrea is responsible, honest, and has demonstrated good citizenship. She's well loved by her colleagues, parents, and students for her humility. Her dream is to be healthy and have a stable job, so that her two children can grow up to be good people.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sand the walls of her home

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en: Maleyka N. is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her two children. Maleyka works diligently caring for cows at a facility at her home, and then her husband sells them at various fairs in the area. She shows the same dedication to the small creatures that she shows to her small children, and, in a short amount of time, the cattle have provided her with excellent earnings. She is eager to increase the capacity of her animal care facilities to accommodate a greater number of animals. With your strong support, she will be able to achieve her goal.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Nasriddin

texts.ru: Муродов Насриддин проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 33 года, женат и имеет двоих детей. Закончил средне специальное учебное зведение. По специальности водитель. Работает частным таксистом. опыт работы в данной сфере 7 лет. Сейчас он остался без работы , так как его автомобиль требует ремонта. Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом . Деньги ему необходимы для покупки запчастей. А ремонтом будет заниматься саммостоятельно. Кредит погасить сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nasriddin M. lives in Shahrinau. He is 33 years old and is married with two children. He is a driver by training. For the past seven years he has been working as a taxi driver but now he is temporarily out of work because his car is broken and he needs to purchase spare parts. In order to do so, Nasriddin would need a loan. He will fix the car by himself. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to fix a car

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirián Fátima es del barrio Virgen del Cármen de la ciudad de Carapeguá, la misma es propietaria de una chiperia instalada en el domicilio de sus padres teniendo un local de ventas en un lugar céntrico de esta ciudad.
      Actualmente esta viviendo con su madre, mencionando que el negocio esta instalado hace varios años y era explotado por su madre quien por la edad avanzada le dejó la administración a su hija, teniendo una clientela formada desde hace años.
      Con el crédito solicitado logró adquirir una buena cantidad de materia prima que se le ofertó a un buen precio, además de realizar algunas mejoras en su local.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirián Fátima is from the neighborhood "Virgen de Cármen" in the city of Carapeguá. She is the proprietor of a "chiperia" (a store that makes traditional Paraguayan chipa bread,) located in the residence of her parents, which has a central location in the city.

Nowadays, she lives with her mother. She mentioned that the business has been in place for various years and was operated by her mother, who moved under the administration of her daughter, due to age. They have an established clientèle of many years.

With this requested loan she will get a substantial quantity of primary material which was offerd to her a good price. With this she will make many improvements to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying primary materials (starch, oil, cheese)

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is 46 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: three males and two females. According to her, the first four children are out of school and learning trades while the last one is in junior high school. Her husband is a cocoa farmer.

She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm-oil production.

Beatrice is also in the palm-oil production business. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and on a retail basis. She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. It is her dream to help her husband improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Kokadiè (Sincerity) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kokadiè est un regroupement de six femmes du   quartier  de Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) qui se connaissent bien. Mariées et mères d’au moins 8  enfants, elles ont une moyenne d’âge 50 ans et  sont unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage
Elles font les activités de vente d’habits de chaussures et de parures
Pour remédier au problème d’insuffisance de fonds de commerce les membres du groupe kokadiè ont fait recours au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a cinq ans de cela. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 125.000 FCFA pour le douzième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des habits et parures qui sont à la mode en gros  pour être revendus. Les femmes du groupe kokadiè s’approvisionnent au marché de Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali) Elles vendent leurs produits au grand  marché de koutiala où elles ont des places (kiosques ou hangar aménagé).
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser chacune 140000 FCFA. de bénéfice au cours du cycle. En plus du remboursement des prêts elles utiliseront une partie de leur bénéfice  pour  faire face aux  dépenses courantes de la famille et  la scolarité des enfants. 
Dans les jours à venir elles comptent avoir des prêts élevés individuellement pour l’ouverture d’une boutique de vente de vêtements.
texts.en:
The Kokadiè group is a group of six close women from the Hamdallaye area in the city of Koutiala (third administrative region of the republic of Mali). Married mothers of at least 8 children, they are on average 50 years old and are either related to each other or neighbors. They sell clothes, shoes, and jewelry. In order to rectify not having enough funds for their business, the members of the Kokadiè group turned to Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program five years ago. The loan amount has gone from 50,000 CFA francs at the first loan to 125,000 CFA francs for the twelfth group loan. The current loan will be used to buy in-style clothes and jewelry at wholesale to be resold. The women of the Kokadiè group stock up at the market in Bamako (the capital of the republic of Mali). They sell their products at the large market in Koutiala where they have space (kiosks or a converted shed). With this new loan, they plan on earning 140,000 CFA francs each over the term. In addition to repaying the loan, they will use a portion of their profits to pay for the needs of their family and the schooling of their children. In the near future, they plan to seek individual loans to open a clothing boutique.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Vaofetu

texts.en:
Vaofetu F., 47, is married with five children. She has five years of experience in making elei prints (traditional Samoan fabric printing). She sells in retail in the village and at the main market at Salelologa five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about $120).

SPBD loans are Vaofetu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She has one previous loan with SPBD. The current loan will be used to purchase cotton materials, elei board, paintbrushes, and paints for making elei.

loans.use: To purchase cotton materials, elei board, paintbrushes, and paints for making elei.

loans.name: Maritza Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Maritza Q. se dedica a laborar en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario se esfuerza en su negocio de venta de alimentos elaborados por ella misma y ofrecidos a las personas que a diario visitan el Mercado.

Hoy en día ella tiene la necesidad de adquirir la materia prima para la elaboración de alimentos y refrescos y por esto es que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener dicho crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio ya que es una excelente cocinera.
texts.en:
Martza Q. works in the Central Market in the city of Chinandega, where each day she sells homemade food to the people who visit the market. She now needs to purchase ingredients for making meals and drinks, and for this she has come to Ceprodel for support to obtain a loan. She wants her business to succeed and she is an excellent cook.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make food

loans.name: Adu

texts.en: Adu G. runs a provisions store. He says his store is by the roadside. Adu buys his provisions from Kumasi. He is 50 years old, married and has four children: three boys and a girl. According to him, they are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. His wife is a farmer. He lives with his wife and children in a house in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region. Goaso is one of the busiest business centres in the region. He has been in business for over eight years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase his stock. Adu is hoping to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa T. est une femme de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de tissus au grand marché de Lomé. Yawa exerce ce métier de puis 8 ans et maîtrise bien tous les rouages. Pour relancer son activité, Yawa désire avec ce crédit alimenter sa boutique avec de nouveaux produits. Cette aubaine lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawa T. is a 38-year-old woman, married, and the mother of two. She is a retailer of fabrics at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She has been in this business for eight years and has a good command of all its fine points. To reinvigorate her business, she would like to use this loan to supply her shop with new products. This great opportunity will enable her to provide for family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida
Juana es conviviente, tiene 51 años y 4 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, bebidas, además los fines de semana vende picarones cerca del cementerio de manera ambulatoria.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y harina.
Los sueños de Juana son mejorar su negocio y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Nueva Vida (New Life) Communal Bank. She is 51 years of age and lives with her domestic partner and her four children. Juana has a store in her house where she sells mostly groceries and beverages. In addition, on the weekends she goes on foot near the cemetery selling picarones (a donut-shaped, fried pastry, sometimes incorporating pumpkin or sweet potatoes, served with syrup). Juana needs a loan of 1,250 Sols which will be used to buy rice, sugar and flour. She dreams of improving her business and buying a house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga.
Valentina es viuda, tiene 56 años y 10 hijos, Valentina venD. flores variadas D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado magdalena, las flores los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima.
Valentina necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. flores.
Los sueños D. Valentina son sacar adelante a sus hijos y que culminen sus estudios, tener mas capital.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the Morenita Huamanga cooperative bank. Valentina is a widow. She is 56 years old and has ten children. Valentina walks around the Magdalena Market selling many types of flowers. She buys the flowers in Lima. Valentina needs a loan of 600 soles. She will use the money to buy more flowers. Valentina hopes her children are successful and that they finish their education. She also hopes to have more capital.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of flowers

loans.name: Ama  Amelie

texts.fr: cette femme est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, elle habite avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé à lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de boissons alcoolisées appelé "sodabi", elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de Lavié.son stock de boissons est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 bidons de 25 litres de "sodabi" et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and the mother of three children.  She lives in the Adidogomé district in Lomé.  Her income-generating business involves commerce in an alcoholic drink called sodabi.  She stocks up from the country's interior in the city of Lavié.  Her stock of drinks is exhausted.  She wants to stock up again, which is the reason behind her request for a loan from WAGES for buying ten 25-liter drums of sodabi and for ensuring the transport of the merchandise. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying drinks

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en:
Racquel E. is from the village of Mobod, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Racquel owns and runs a restaurant where she offers a variety of dishes to local customers. Racquel is just starting this business.

In 2008, Racquel joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Racquel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC (this will be her third loan from GDMPC). Racquel is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase more inventory and to have some working capital at hand. Her goal is to use all additional profits to improve her family’s living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that individual translations of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and obtain working capital

loans.name: Moanh

texts.en: Moanh N. is a long-time businesswoman. She has been working in the handicraft trade since she was young. She weaves bamboo baskets, a skill she learned from her grandparents, and sells them buyers when she saves up 100 sets of basket. Moanh N. is married and seven children who are married and have started new homes. She now lives with her husband who assists with her in making and selling baskets. Moanh N. will be using her loan to replace the roof of her house, because it is cracking frequently. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy more raw materials.

loans.use: To replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Manuel Joaquín

texts.es:
En un establecimiento del mercado central del departamento de Chinandega, el señor Manuel P. se dedica a atender el negocio de venta de revistas y de libros de segunda mano. Los productos son ofrecidos todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

El señor Manuel ha solicitado un crédito con el fin único de invertirlo directamente en la compra de las revistas para continuar ofertándolas y así continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
In a sector of the central market located in the department of Chinandega, Mr. Manuel P. works in the business of selling second handed magazines and books. The products are offered every day since early in the morning until the afternoon. Mr. Manual requested a loan with the only purpose of investing it directly in the purchase of magazines to continue offering them and this way continue to bring money to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy books and magazines

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: La señora Ernestina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Angeles”, Distrito D. Picota, Provincia Picota, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 64 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, ya independientes.Ante la necesidad D. aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella misma, emprendió un pequeño  negocio D. venta D. abarrotes con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desD. un inicio por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donD. sus principales clientes son los vecinos D. su barrio.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,600.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.Hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Ms. Ernestina M. is a member of the Los Angeles Microfinance Institute in the district and province of Picota, department of San Martin. She is a 64-year-old married mother with 3 children who are all independent now. Because of her need to contribute to the household income, and motivated by herself, she launched her own general store with her 300.00 PEN loan. She obtained great results from the beginning because of her high-quality products, her reasonable prices, and her excellent customer service. She still runs this same business, which is located in her house. Her main customers are her neighbors. With this 1,600.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more products to stock her shop with rice and sugar by the kilo, crates of eggs, personal hygiene products, household cleaning supplies, crates of soft drinks, candy, and other products to keep her customers satisfied. She now feels very happy with the work and service that she provides, and she gives thanks to Manuela Ramos for giving support to people like her who want to work and get ahead in life. She hopes that they continue doing so for a long time so that they can help many families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client is married and has two children. He has been buying, selling, and repairing mobile phones for three years. He has requested this loan to buy new mobile phones in order to expand his business and better respond to the competition. This loan will help generate an income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones

loans.name: Glenda Esther

texts.es: Doña Glenda tiene siete años de vender, ropa, electrodomésticos, y los fines de semana vende sopa, vigoron entre otros para mejorar los ingresos. Tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto con sus dos hijos, mayores de edad que trabajan y ayudan a pagar los gastos básicos como agua, luz, y alimentos. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa, hacer otro cuarto para dar a sus hijos mayor comodidad ya que siempre la han apoyado. Cuando inicio lo hizo con la necesidad de poder apoyar  a su familia y salir adelante, el negocio de sus hijos es la compra y venta de ganado y le queda buenas ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito en la institución el cual va invertir en la compra de ropa, planchas, licuadoras para entregar a sus clientes ya que le da al crédito y los electrodoméstico los vende solo por encargo ya que son más caros. Con esto espera aumentar las ventas, captar clientela y seguir mejorando su economía. Todo esto con ayuda de Afodenic gracias a la oportunidad del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Glenda, 47, has sold clothing and appliances for the past seven years; on weekends she sells soups, vigoron {chopped cabbage; chimichurri: tomatoes, onions, garlic and cilantro pickled in lime juice; boiled yucca and chicharrones (fried pork skins and/or fried pork meat)}, among other items to improve her earnings. She lives with her two adult sons who work and help with basic household expenses like food and utilities. Her plan is to continue to improve her house, to build another room so her sons can have more comfort since they have always helped her. When she began, it was because of the need to support her family and get ahead. Her sons' work consists in buying and selling cattle and it produces good profits. This is her second loan with the institution and she plans to buy clothing, irons, and blenders to deliver to her customers since she sells them on credit and the appliances she only sells on order since they are more expensive. With this she expects to increase sales, gather more customers and continue to improve her finances. All of this is thanks to Afodenic's help with the financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing, an iron, to increase sales.

loans.name: Los Jazmines Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “LOS JAZMI.” se encuentra ubicada en la parte alta de Huaycán distrito de Ate departamento de Lima, vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desde hace 5 meses, la alcancía comunal está  conformada por 11 socios quienes desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades como: producción, comercio y  servicio, la cual está representada por: 
M. Medina, actualmente asume el cargo de Tesorera, desde hace 5 meses, tiene 49 años, madre soltera con 4 hijos. M. se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo desde hace 1 año y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado comprar muebles para su casa, su nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de artefactos y como todo pequeño empresario tiene muchos sueños, uno de ellos es poner una gran bodega.
R. M. Arony, actualmente asume el cargo de Secretaria, desde hace 5 meses, tiene 23 años, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 1 año y 9 meses. R. en un inicio se dedicó a la venta de ropa, pero como para éste rubro se necesitaba una mayor inversión y no contaba con ello, decidió cambiar de rubro y dedicarse a la venta de salchipollo, ya que tenía demasiadas necesidades que cubrir y por ende la necesidad de generar mayores ingresos, se encuentra en este negocio desde hace 5 años y su reciente préstamo lo invertirá  en la compra de ropa para campaña navideña. R. como toda mujer emprendeD. sueña tener una  tienda de ropa y que su tienda sea reconocida por toda la clientela.
texts.en:
The alcancia commual bank “LOS JAZMI.” is located in the high part of the Huayan district of Ate, in the department of Lima. For the last 5 months, the alcancia communal bank has been working with EDASPROSPO-Prosperidad and is made up of 11 members. They work in different types of jobs such as: production, commerce and services, represented by: M. Medina, has been serving for the past 5 months as the Treasurer. She is 49, and a single mother with 4 children. M. has been working for a year selling beauty products from a catalog. With the effort she has put into her work she has been able to buy furniture for her house. She will invest her new loan into buying fixtures. Like all small entrepreneurs, she has many dreams: one of them is to set up a big grocery store. R. M. Arony has been the Secretary for the past 5 months. She is 23, and in a common-law-marriage. She has 1 son, aged 1 year and 9 months. In the beginning R. worked selling clothes, but for this type of product she needed a big investment and she didn’t have it. She decided to change the type of product and work selling salchipollo(French fries with shredded chicken-typical food of Peru) since she already had too many necessities to cover and therefore needed to make more money. For the last 5 years she has been doing this work, and will invest her next loan was in buying clothing for the Christmas season. R., as with all women entrepreneurs, dreams of having her own clothing store and that her store would be popular with all the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of clothing for the Christmas season

loans.name: Veolita

texts.en:
Veolita O. is  a 59-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Brgy Maquiling Sagay City Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store, a rice retailing shop, and a restaurant.

Veolita’s husband helps her run the businesses, and they have three children; two of them are already grown and the youngest is currently going to school. All of the children help their parents in the businesses as part of their daily chores.

Veolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 in the hope that she would be able to help her  husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family's income by operating a general store, rice retailer and restaurant. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000 from her business activities.

Veolita is a member of good  standing. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 was used to fund the operation of her general store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 19,000 in her sixteenth cycle loan, which she  intends to use on her businesses. Veolita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family: to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon"--a title of esteem bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for a general store, rice retailing shop, and restaurant

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid de 25 años es una joven muy trabajadora que  vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.El cafetín que Ingrid administra esta ubicado en un centro hospitalario de la ciudad, ella ganó la licitación hace 4 años, en los cuales ha trabajado fuerte  para sacarlo adelante. Ahora su cafetín esta muy bien equipado y atiende desde muy temprano a los doctores, enfermeras y personas que desean servirse algo sabroso y saludable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día atendiendo su negocio, ya que muchas veces se queda hasta muy tarde por la gran cantidad de clientes que tiene. Para el futuro, espera mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio y así brindar un mejor servicio.Este es su primer préstamo con  MFP y promete  ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además  en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar los platillos que vende en su cafetín y mejorar de esta manera su producción.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 25 years old. She is a hardworking young woman who lives at home with her parents. What she desires most is to improve her quality of life. Ingrid manages a café located at the city hospital. She won the bid to establish her business there four years ago and has worked hard to make it a success. Her café is well-equipped and opens early so that she can begin serving doctors, nurses, and others who are looking for something tasty and healthy to eat. What she enjoys most about her job is attending to her customers. Ingrid finds the most difficult part of her job is spending all day at her business, since she is often open late so that she can serve several of the remaining customers that she has.

In the future, she hopes to improve her business facilities so that she can provide better service. Ingrid is receiving her first loan from MFP and promises to make her payments on time. She is a highly respected member of her Communal Bank because of the responsibility she has demonstrated. With her loan of 1000 soles, Ingrid plans to buy the ingredients that she needs for making the dishes she sells at her café. This will also improve her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia S. is from the village of Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, is married, and has ten adult children. Virginia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Gerardo Manuel

texts.es:
La ciudad de Azogues  es la capital de la Provincia del Cañar, se halla localizada en la Hoya del río Paute, goza de un clima templado  por su ubicación  geográfica favoreciendo al cultivo de frutas y verduras, además podemos disfrutar de la belleza del Santuario Franciscano y su arquitectura  colonial  haciéndola una  ciudad  muy hermosa, su gente cordial y  amable acogen al turista nacional y extranjero, además se caracterizan por ser personas  muy luchadoras y firmes para salir adelante y siempre brindarles lo mejor a su familia.

El señor  Gerardo V. es socio del banco comunal Barrio Nuevo, vive  con su esposa y su hijo de siete años en el barrio del mismo nombre de su banco, tiene 28 años  no tiene un trabajo fijo por lo que no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad  de trabajo en el oficio que le soliciten,  su esposa  es comerciante ambulante  vende una gran variedad de productos como papas fritas, helados, etc.,  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven  en casa de sus suegros.

Gerardo tiene gran amistad con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal al ser el único varón del grupo, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en la institución gracias a  su amiga Anita que le hablo de los beneficios que ofrece ESPOIR, con el préstamo que reciba va a invertir en el negocio de su esposa para que compre papas, helados, etc..

Su meta es superarse cada día más y así brindarle una vida mas digna a su familia.
texts.en:
The city of Azogues is the capital of the Cañar province. It is located in the Paute River basin and enjoys a moderate climate favorable for growing fruits and vegetables. The city is very picturesque, and its citizens enjoy the beauty of the Franciscan Sanctuary and the colonial architecture. Its residents are very kind and welcoming to foreign and local tourists. They are also known to be very hardworking and committed to getting ahead and providing the best for their families. Gerardo V. is a member of the Barrio Nuevo Communal Bank and lives with his wife and seven-year-old son in the Barrio Nuevo neighborhood. He is 28 years old and although he does not have fixed employment he never passes up the opportunity to perform whatever job he is offered. His wife is a street vendor selling a variety of items, including french fries and ice cream. They live in his wife's parents home as they do not have their own house. Gerardo is the only man in his communal bank and has a very good relationship with all of the other members. This is his second loan cycle and he is grateful to his friend Anita who introduced him to the benefits offered by ESPOIR. He will invest this loan in the purchase of supplies for his wife's business, including potatoes, ice cream, and other items. His goal is to get ahead a little more every day and thereby provide a more decent life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase french fries and ice cream

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy laboriosa de 53 años, está casada con Benjamín de 50 años, tienen 6 hijos quienes en busca de un futuro mejor estudian en Lima (la capital del Perú), por eso ella vive sólo con su pareja en la casa que le heredó su madre. 

Desde hace 35 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, flores (gladiolos), variedad de verduras alfalfa y papa. Ambos se despiertan muy temprano y mientras ella prepara la comida del día, él se va a inspeccionar y regar sus tierras sembradas, o a cortar el pasto para alimentar a sus cuyes. A María le satisface haber sido perseverante, pues gracias a eso pudo cubrir la educación de sus hijos, quienes ahora cuentan con una carrera profesional, además todos los integrantes de la familia viven cómodamente. 
Para más adelante, desea comprar mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno, cuyes y otros animales menores, ya que sembrará hectáreas de alfalfa para su alimentación.

Esta es la décima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está tranquila de trabajar en un banco comunal donde sabe que sus ahorros están muy bien cuidados. Con el dinero que ahora solicita piensa comprar varios sacos de abono, fertilizante, cinco botellas de insecticida y dos bolsas de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
María, 53, is a hard-working woman. She's married to Benjamín, 50. They have 6 children who, in search of a better future, are in school in Lima (the capital of Perú). Because of this, she lives alone with her husband in a house she inherited from her mother. For the last 35 years, she and her husband have farmed corn, gladioli, a variety of vegetables, alfalfa and potatoes. Both rise very early and, while she prepares the day's food, he goes out to inspect and water the planted fields or to cut grass to feed his guinea pigs. María feels satisfied to have persevered for, thanks to that, she was able to pay for the education of her childen, who now have professional careers. Besides, all the family members live comfortable lives. For later on, she wants to buy greater amounts of cattle, guinea pigs and other small farm animals since she will plant several hectares of alfalfa to feed them. This is her 10th loan with MFP and she is content to work in a communal bank where she knows her savings are well cared for. She will use the funds requested to buy several sacks of manure and fertilizer, five bottles of insecticide and two bags of pea seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Modou Bousso

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou Bousso K. sollicite un prêt de 150 000 FCFA  pour d’une part,  se payer un équipement meubles  et d’autres part,  investir dans une  activité d’aviculture. Nouvellement marié, Monsieur Modou Bousso K. compte acheter un équipementde meubles. Cet achat constitue un investissement nécessaire besoin pour sa chambre. 
Vivant  à la maison familiale, il participe pour la gestion collective des besoins quotidiens de la maison.  Ainsi pour accroitre le revenu familial, il compte également si possible avec le reste de l’argent financer son jeune frère qui connait bien l’aviculture. L’impact du crédit pour cet enseignant âgé de 29 ans c’est aussi de créer un emploi pour son jeune frère, équiper sa chambre et diversifier les ressources financières.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou Bousso K. is applying for a loan of 150,000 FCFA, which is partly to pay for a piece of furniture and partly to invest in a poultry farming business. Newly wed, Mr. Modou Bousso K. is planning to buy a piece of furniture. This is a necessary investment for his bedroom. Since he lives in the family home, he participates in the collective management of the daily needs of the household. Thus, in order to increase the family's revenues, he is equally planning to use the rest of the money, if possible, to finance his young brother who is very familiar with the poultry farming business. The impact of the loan for this 29-year old teacher will thus be to create a job for his young brother, to furnish his bedroom and diversify his financial resources.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire furniture and launch a business for his brother

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Anayat wants a loan to buy wheat for her wheat-selling business. Anwar wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Shahnaz akhtar wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit-selling business. Hamidan wants a loan to buy bangles for her bangle-selling business. Buhran wants a loan to buy a new donkey cart for loading.

Nasira is the group leader of the above-mentioned ladies. They all live in a city called Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. Nasira's husband's name is M. S. and he has a fruit-selling business. He has been in this business for over 10 years. He sells his fruit on a fruit cart going to different areas. Nasira is a housewife but she also helps him arrange the fruit on his cart every morning. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruit to expand her husband's fruit-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit for resale

loans.name: Marème

texts.en:
Marème E. is a 41-year-old married mother of five children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" Diamaguene1 for two years and has always paid back her loans.

Marème E.’s main activity consists of selling dried and salted fish and other seafood. She will use the loan to buy more fish which she will resell. The earnings from selling fish allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever  tiene   25 años de edad,  es soltero, vive con su padre quien está a su cuidado.
Desde  muy  joven  se dedicó a trabajar  como empleado en una empresa que se dedica a la reparación de celulares que pertenecía a un familiar y  quién aprendió la profesión.
Hace cinco años habilitó su propia empresa en el centro de la ciudad,   que se dedica a la venta, reparación, recarga de saldos para celulares.
Hoy en dia cuenta con clientela formada y trabaja con él una hermana a quién le paga sus estudios universitarios por los servicios prestados.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas y celulares ya sean nuevos o en desuso para su posterior reparación y re-venta. Y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ever is 25 years old, single, and lives with his father who is in his care. As a young man, he decided to work for a relative’s business that is dedicated to repairing mobile phones so that he could learn the profession. Five years ago, he started his own business in the central part of the city where he sells, repairs, and provides minutes for mobile phones. Today he has an established clientele and works with a sister who he pays so that she can attend university.

Ever is requesting a loan to buy tools, as well as new and used phones for repair and re-sale. He hopes this will increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools & mobile phones for re-sale

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni J. is 39 years old, widowed, and has three children who go to school. She is currently in the business of selling simsim (sesame seed), tomatoes, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock bags of cowpeas, pulses and cassava flour. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build up a big shop.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of cowpeas, pulses and cassava flour to sell

loans.name: María Dalinda

texts.es:
María Dalinda tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos dependientes, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Tranca Sasape, uno de los caseríos que conforman al distrito de Mórrope, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Lambayeque. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años al comercio de productos de consumo diario, verduras y abarrotes en una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, su domicilio queda cerca al mercado del caserío lo cual le permite contar siempre con clientes. Actualmente, debido al tiempo de funcionamiento de su negocio y al buen que trato que ofrece, cuenta con una clientela fidelizada que siempre acude a su establecimiento para agenciarse de diversos productos al crédito y al contado.

María esta solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la adquisición de mas mercadería para ampliar su bodega y seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes.

María es una mujer activa y que siempre trata de apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
María Dalinda is 37 years old, married, and has three dependent children. She lives with her family in Tranca Sasape, one of the many villages in Mórrope, a farming district in Lambayeque Province. This area is located an hour and fifteen minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than three years, Maria has been selling everyday consumer products, vegetables, and groceries from a store in her home which is near the village market, so she always has customers. Due to the time she has been in business and the good service she provides, Maria has a loyal customer base that visits her store to buy products with cash or on credit. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to acquire more merchandise to expand her store and continue satisfying the demand of her customers.

Maria is an active woman who always tries to help her husband maintain the household finances. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can provide her children a better quality of life. She has worked previously with Edpyme Alternativa and demonstrated that she is prompt and responsible when making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander Antonio tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación y ha sabido aprovechar sus financiamientos. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio como es la venta de ropa ambulante el crédito solicitado es para la compra de mercadería por lo que actualmente tiene muchos pedidos y quiere sufragar la demanda que tiene de parte de sus clientes, es muy trabajador siempre velando el bienestar de su familia, pues siempre ha demostrado ser una persona luchadora y trabajadora. Desea seguir creciendo con este negocio poco a poco.
texts.en:
Alexander Antonio has collaborated with the Fundación for a long time and has taken advantage of the financing. For over 8 years he has been an itinerant clothing merchant. The requested funds will be used to buy merchandise because he has several pending orders and he wants to meet customer demand. He is very hard-working and is always watchful of his family’s wellbeing; he has always been a fighter and a worker. He wants to continue growing with his business little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
Femme celibataire de 50 ans,celibataire avec 3 enfants,agee de 26 a 33 ans,  diplomee sans emploi  de l'Ecole paramedicale de la Sante,Il ya 20 ans qu'elle s'est lancee dans la vente de bois quand elle a compris qu'elle ne trouverait pas de place a la fonction publique. 
Elle s'approvisionne sur place , elle se met en contact avec les commercants ambulants  qui sillonent dans les quartiers et parfois , elle prend des contacts avec tous ceux qui sont dans la livraison du bois a domicile. Ses recettes sont de 30000 a 45000frs par jour,et ses potentiels clients sont les menages.Ayant une grande experience , elle a eleve tous ses enfants avec les recettes de la vente de bois de chauffe.
Avec le pret octroye,elle pense renforcer son stock en achetant des paquets de bois.Elle epargne beaucoup pour realiser ses ambitions,soutenir les etudes de ses enfants qui sont a l'universite et enfin construire une maison sur le terrain acquerit avec les benefices de ses ventes pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Single woman, 50 years of age, with three children from 26 to 33 years old; unemployed although she has a paramedic’s diploma. About 20 years ago, as she realized she couldn’t’ get a job in the public sector, she started selling firewood. She buys her sotck locally, networking with street vendors who walk around town and sometimes she also arranges for deliveries to be made to her home. Her revenue is between 30000 and 45000 Central African franks per day, and her potential clients are households. She has a lot of experience, and has been able to raise her children thanks to the income from selling firewood. With this loan obtained, she would like to increase her stock and purchase additional loads of firewood. She puts a lot of her income aside as savings in order to be able to realize her plans, support the university studies of her children and eventually build a house for her children on a land parcel purchased with the income from her sales.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up on firewood [for resale]

loans.name: Mujeres Con Decision  ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión esta formado por un grupo de 11 socias quienes buscan con su trabajo brindar a sus familias un mejor futuro y entregarles una mejor estabilidad económica, viven en varios lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por sus hermosas iglesias, sus ríos, sus gastronomía que es muy variada y su gente que es muy cordial y amable.

La Señora María C. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación  y ha sido invitada por una gran amiga que pertenece al banco comunal. Se dedica a realizar bordados hace 10 años y ha sido su hermana quien le ha  enseñado este hermoso oficio, labora desde las 10 a.m., hasta las 6 de la tarde de lunes a viernes.

Nuestra socia tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos quienes se encuentran de 4 y 3 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como mesero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. Su crédito lo va  a utilizar en la compra de víveres para su hogar. Su sueño es de algún día tener su casa propia.

La Señora Rosa Z. vive por la comunidad de San Pedro del Cebollar, tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 7 ya son casados y viven de manera independiente,  tiene una hija de quince años que vive en su casa y esta estudiando en una academia de corte y confección, su esposo se dedica al reciclaje, gracias al trabajo y esfuerzo conyugal han logrado tener su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a vender chancho horneado  los fines de semana y vende  recorriendo el mercado 10 de Agosto, este trabajo realiza desde  soltera, el resto de la semana se dedica a la cría de cuyes, chanchos, sus animalitos los vende en su casa.  Nuestra socia se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 3 años y en todo ese tiempo ha logrado tener una  buena amistad con todas las socias,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y  alimento, su meta es  tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres con Decisión" is made up of a group of 11 members who seek with their work to provide their families with a better future and better economic stability. They live in various parts of the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is a city that is known for its beautiful churches, its rivers, its varied cuisine, and its people who are very cordial and friendly. Señora María C. lives in the center of the city of Cusco. This is the first loan that she has taken with the fundación. She was invited to join the group by a close friend who is a member. She has been doing embroidery for 10 years; it was her sister who taught her how to do this beautiful work. She works from 10am until 6pm Monday through Friday. María is 24 years old and is in a common-law marriage; she has 2 children who are 3 and 4 years old. Her husband works as a waiter. They do not have their own home, and so are renting. She will use this loan to buy groceries for her home. She dreams of some day having her own home. Señora Rosa Z. lives in the community of San Pedro del Cebollar. She is 56 years old, married, and has 8 children, 7 of whom are married and live independently. She has a 15 year-old daughter who lives in the house and who is studying dressmaking. Her husband works in recycling. Thanks to hard work and a lot of effort, the couple has managed to have their own home. Rosa sells baked pork on the weekends, walking through the "10 de Agosto" market, an activity she has been doing since she was single. During the rest of the week she raises guinea pigs and pigs, and she sells her small animals from her house. Rosa joined this communal bank 3 years ago, and over that time she has developed a good friendship with all of the members. She will invest this new loan in the purchase of pigs and feed. Her goal is to have a bigger business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed / to buy groceries

loans.name: Minda's Group

texts.en:
Minda D. is from the village of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga. She is 24 years old. Minda D. is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Minda is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Minda owns & operates a fish vending business, primarily selling fresh, ocean-caught fish in the local community. Minda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Minda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Minda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for the business. Minda is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used for house completion. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Minda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for their daily needs. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house completion.

loans.name: Flacir

texts.en:
Flacir J. is from the village of D'ban Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old and single. To make a living, Flacir owns a business providing shoe repair services. He has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Flacir joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital and is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the second loan taken out by Flacir from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es:
Don Luís es un hombre trabajador que se ha dedicado a la confección de ropa por muchos años, pues ha hecho su medio de trabajo. Logrando a si apoyar  a su familia.
Junto con su esposa se apoyan ya que ella es modista lo que ha sido de mucho para lograr las ventas.
Es su quinto ciclo en A fodenic que a través de los financiamiento ha incrementado la producción de ropa. El cual comprara telas,  variadas de colores, hilos, bordados, y hará algunos mantenimiento a sus maquinas para seguir dando un servicio de calidad. y poder vender.
texts.en:
Luis is a hard working man that has many years' experience in making clothes. He has forged his own business and this has given him the ability to support his family. He and his wife provide support for each other in the business. She is a fashion designer and this has been a great advantage for sales. This is his fifth loan through Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner). Through these loans he has increased the production of clothes. He will purchase fabric in various patterns and colors, threads and trims but he will also provide some needed maintenance to the sewing machines, to continue to work with excellence and sell accordingly.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various fabrics, threads, and trims.

loans.name: Bùi

texts.en:
L. Bùi Thị (20213050016) is a 41 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - huyện Bắc Ninh. She is married and has three school-aged children. To making a living, L. owns a business making and selling food and rice products. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month.

In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA, used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. L. is now requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. The loan will be the fourth  she has taken out from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Bùi Thị (20213050016) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - huyện Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, L. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  L. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
At age 45, Corazon D. S. is a tough and determined widow who has the responsibility of taking care of their three children. Her eldest is 21, the middle one is 19 and the youngest is 17 years old. All her children finished only high school because she does not have the capacity to send them to college because of the expensive fares required to going in and out of the island where they live. Some of her children already have a family of their own. 

She joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines. As a member, she makes sure that her loans are invested properly and she performs her duties and responsibilities diligently. For almost five years she has been buying and selling dried fish. Aside from the fish caught by her children, she will buy fresh fish from the fishermen and dry them. She will then pack the fish in kilos and sell them to the market and to her frequent customers. She is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 for additional capital for her dried fish business and to finance the plan of her eldest son to put up a locally known fish trap called "skylab" that is made up of fish net and bamboo poles positioned in the allowed fishing area of the lake. Income generated from this business will be used to renovate their house and for the daily consumption of her children and grandchildren. She is hoping that KIVA lenders will help them in this venture.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and finance construction of a fish trap

loans.name: William Gonzalo

texts.es:
William Gonzalo C. C. tiene 26 años. Es soltero vive con los papas vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene hijos.  

William pertenece a la Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría siembra maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta ventanilla tiene 13 miembros.

William trabaja en la agricultura siembra en ciclo corto el maíz,  arroz y fréjol  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar seguir cultivando para tener dinero y comprar un carro.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
