William Gonzalo C. C. is 26 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  He has no children.

William is a member of the Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración [New Inspiration Group] located in the Anchoventa neighborhood in the parish of Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo.  It is a group dedicated to short term workers who mostly grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  The group has 13 members.

William works in agriculture, planting short cycle corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  He buys them in Guayaquil and sells them in a store in his home and at the market in Ventanas.

He is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise to grow his business.  This loan would help him economically so he can meet his needs.  His dream is to continue farming to make money and purchase a car.  He likes sports.

loans.use: Purchase corn, rice, and beans

loans.name: Veronika Katerina

texts.en:
Veronika is a member of the Communal Bank group "Active Women II," located in the district of Juliaca, in the province of San Román, and in the department of Puno. She is 20 years old, single and has no children.  She is currently seeking a higher education degree. 

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan was for the amount of 500 PEN, to increase the capital for her selling clothes business. 

Veronika is currently asking for a new loan for 800 PEN, to purchase more merchandise to sell. 

Her dream is to be a professional and to have a piñata store.  What she likes about the Communal Bank is the terms of the loan and the responsibility.

loans.use: The purchase of additional merchandise for her business selling clothing

loans.name: Melba Cresencia

texts.es: Melba Crecencia es comerciante tiene una pulpería bien surtida desde hace mas de 10 años, cuenta con una clientela bien formada quienes se encuentran muy conformes con los precios y los productos que se encuentran a la venta en. Vive en la comarca mocoron con su marido y su hijo. Comenzó  su negocio en un lugar de su vivienda, hoy cuenta con un buen espacio para que sus clientes puedan apreciar la variedad de productos que ofrece. Ella es una señora muy trabajadora y sacrificada que gracias a su esfuerzo y su perseverancia ha logrado llevar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como productos de limpieza, lácteos, huevos, sopas, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Melba Crecencia is a merchant; she has had a well-stocked general store for over 10 years.  She has a well established customer base which is very satisfied with her prices and the products she has in stock.  

She lives in Mocoron with her husband and her son.  She started the store in a space in her home and she now has a good area where her customers can view the great variety of products she has on offer.

She is a very hard working, unselfish woman who thanks to her dedication and perseverance has managed to move her family ahead in life and improve their quality of life.

She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise like: cleaning supplies, dairy products, eggs, soups, detergents and basic grains.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia G. is from the village of Marannao. She is 50 years old. Delia is single. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Delia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Delia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: 65- Thôn 1 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Thuỷ C. Thị (132) is a 29 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Thuỷ is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 65 - Thôn 1- Quảng Hưng (18.1.65 Quảng Hưng).

Thuỷ is married and has 2 young children. To making a living, Thuỷ owns & operates a general store, selling food products in the local community.  Thuỷ has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Thuỷ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Thuỷ is requesting, for the first time, a loan of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. Thuỷ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  N. Thi Hái (133) is a 58 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

2.  N. C. Lệ Giang (136) is a 19 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

3.  C. Thị Nghệ (134) is a 47 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

4.  N. Thị Tươi (135) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her general store.

5.  N. Thị Cẩm (140) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

6.  N. Thị Hương (139) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

7.  N. Thị Lan (138) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

8.  N. Thị Liên (137) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her general store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Thuỷ C. Thị (132) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Thuỷ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 65- Thôn 1 - Quảng Hưng (18.1.65 Quảng Hưng).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thực phẩm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thuỷ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thuỷ kiếm được khoảng 2500000 VND.  Vào 2010, Thuỷ đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thuỷ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  N. Thi Hái (133) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

2.  N. C. Lệ Giang (136) là 19 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

3.  C. Thị Nghệ (134) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

4.  N. Thị Tươi (135) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

5.  N. Thị Cẩm (140) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

6.  N. Thị Hương (139) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

7.  N. Thị Lan (138) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

8.  N. Thị Liên (137) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, 40, is a member of the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco.

Luisa has a common law husband and three children. Her business is the buying and selling of tires in Cusco. She is requesting the loan to purchase more inventory for her tire shop. She is very happy with the granted loan and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in her tire business.

loans.name: Nifah

texts.en:
Nifah N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Nifah has a grocery store business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Nifah has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar cane. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Nifah hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Nifah hopes to buy a fridge. Nifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to read books.

loans.use: To purchase sugar cane

loans.name: Perlyn

texts.en:
Perlyn, 45 years old, has 10 kids to feed, clothe and send to school. Her eldest child is 24 years old while the youngest is only 2 years old. Perlyn's husband is also a farmer. They both work hard to earn from their farm. Perlyn also plans to start an additional livelihood to have better income for the family.

Perlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Perlyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Mrs. Hin K., born in 1943, is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a basket maker and a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She is a widow who lives with a child and four grandchildren. She wants to start a new cattle-breeding business, but her saved money is not enough so Mrs. Hin K. is seeking for a loan to buy two cows to start her business.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Patrona Márquez está renovando su credikiva porque requiere ahora mejorar mucho mas su cocina para ofrecer un servicio de excelencia a sus inquilinas, así ella correrá una pared y repellará las habitaciones que tiene arrendadas. . Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva “Estoy muy agradecida con las personas que me apoyaron en mi primer crédito Kiva, por confiar en mi y ahora por darme una nueva oportunidad”
Su anterior crédito lo invirtió muy bien hizo el desagüe de agua  lluvia, rellenó el patio y le hizo su plantilla, instaló un lavadero de ropa y una canaleta y esto le ayudó a mejorar su vivienda por eso ella está muy satisfecha.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Patrona Márquez  puede ingresar al siguiente enlace:http://kiva.org/lend/185306
texts.en:
Patrona Márquez is renewing her Kiva loan because now she needs to improve her kitchen much more so that she can offer excellent service to her tenants. She will extend a wall and plaster the rooms that have tenants. She sends the following message to her financiers from Kiva: "I am very grateful to the people who helped me with my first Kiva loan, for having confidence in me and now for giving me a new opportunity." She invested her last loan very well. She redirected the rainwater drainage, filled in the patio, installed flooring, and installed a wash stand for laundry and a drainage system. This helped her improve her home, and for this she is very satisfied.

If you want to know more about the story of Patrona Márquez, you can go to the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/185306.

loans.use: Improve her property

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S. is from the village of Villa M. Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 56 years-old. Aida is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling peanuts in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aida joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. Aida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Aida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Houenoussou 1 Group

texts.en:
The 16 entrepreneurs in this group live in the Sémé-Podji district of Cotonou, Benin's economic centre.  They run similar businesses, and also arrange social events together. This is their first loan with ALIDE.

Elisabeth (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1973 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital. She moved to her current location 12 years ago, and now lives with her husband Thomas and the two of their six children who are still at home. All of their children have been to school.  Since moving to Cotonou Elisabeth has run a stall selling food at a local park. This loan will enable her to purchase wheat, condiments, and rice to prepare her food for sale. Her aim in the long term is to build her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Helen H. works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from dried fish. 

Helen is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy new fishing boat for her fishing business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to improve her dried fish business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 58 years old and married with three children. Her oldest child is 36 years old.

Elsie is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 36 years. Elsie earns about 7,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Elsie works hard to support her family. She also wants to help send her grandchildren to school.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married to a farmer and they have three children. To help her husband with the household expenses, Mary sells cassava and plantains in Elmina, which is a fishing town in Ghana’s Central Region. 

To improve her earnings, Mary wants to boost her sales. She needs a loan from Kiva to allow her to purchase more cassava, plantains and other food items. She intends to reinvest any extra earnings back into her business for further growth. Ultimately, she wants to earn and save enough to put her children through university.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, plantains and other food items.

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni is 34 years old and is married. She has 3 children aged 12, 11 and 5. Her husband works as an auto mechanic.

Laarni owns and manages a sari-sari (general) store. She sells biscuits, bread and other products. She wants to sell gasoline because she said the location of her house is accessible to motorists. She also started a chorizo business and sells her product to locals.

Laarni plans to use the loan to purchase more items to sell, such as gasoline, and to invest in her chorizo business. Laarni hopes for her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, such as gasoline, and to invest in her chorizo business

loans.name: Delmy Aracely

texts.es: Delmy Aracely, de 49 años de edad, habita en casa propia con sus  hijos los cuales son todo para ella. Delmy  ha trabajado toda su vida para dar a su familia el pan de cada día que con gran sacrificio se gana. Ella posee una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de habitación, en la que ofrece diversidad de productos como: azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aderezos, galletas, condimentos, café, entre otros. Este lugar goza de mucha accesibilidad y prestigio ya que Doña Delmy se esmera por atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera cada vez que solicitan sus productos. Ella sueña con poder surtir su negocio para poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos. Esto la ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder abastecer su tienda con variedad de: frijoles, arroz, golosinas, cereales, verduras, bebidas, café, leche y de mas productos que son atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera obtener mayores ventas y por ende mayores ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Delmy Aracely, 49, lives in her own house with her children who are everything to her.  Delmy has worked her entire life to provide daily sustenance for her family; she earns it with much sacrifice.  She has a small store at home where she stocks a variety of products like: sugar, beans, rice, dressings, cookies, condiments and coffee, among others.  The store enjoys much accessibility and prestige because Delmy takes great pains to tend to her customers in the best way possible each time they request her products.  She dreams with being able to stock the store to provide even more variety of products to her customers.

This has pushed her to request a loan from INTEGRAL to stock the store with a variety of products like: beans, rice, snacks, cereals, vegetables, beverages, coffee, milk and other products that are attractive to customers.  She hopes to increase sales and as a result earn higher income that will help her improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; EL  socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La socia Yovanna; tiene 22 años de edad; la socia es soltera; la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de frutas, la socia tiene este pequeño negocio y se dedica desde hace 2 años a trabajar como comerciante minorista, la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de frutas al por mayor para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de frutas.

 La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Sr. de Tayacani". She lives in the district of Ocongate in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.

Her name is Yovanna. She is 22 years old and she is single. She is dedicated to the buying and selling of fruit. She has had this small business for the past 2 years, working as a retailer. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of fruits in wholesale to resell. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of fruits.

She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan that has been granted to her. It will help her to grow her business and to improve the quality of her life. She is committed to making her loan payments at on schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fruits.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 45 years old and married with 5 children.  With 3 children in school, Eva works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari Store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as snack food, soft-drinks and other groceries.  She has been in this business for 2 years.

Eva has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nueva Integración (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En el sitio Los Rosales en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Banco Comunal Nueva Integración. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio en general. Ellos hace poco y al conocer de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse  para poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La  Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo  y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Delia, tiene 46 años  de edad, está casada y de esa relación tiene cinco hijos tres de ellos independientes y dos de 18 y 8 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que tambien se dedica al comercio, vende productos tanto para el hogar como personales (planchas, licuadoras, zapatos, colchones, teléfonos, entre otras cosas), todos esos productos por el sistema de cartillas. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana deja a crédito y cobra cada domingo. Nos cuenta que en la actualidad quiere empezar también con la venta de toallas, ella lleva dedicada al comercio 8 años y le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar toallas y empezar con este nuevo negocio. Este es el primer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal,  es la presidenta y espera desempeñar una buena gestión en el grupo y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer.

Sus sueños son seguir en su negocio y tener buenas ventas.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Nueva Integracion" meets every two weeks in he locale of Los Rosales in the city of Portoviejo. They undertake various activities, such as agriculture, livestock farming, and general commerce. A short time ago, after coming to know the benefits offered by the institution, they decided to come together to access loans through Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner). It is their first loan cycle and they hope to perform well and to continue to work with the institution. 

Here we met Delia. She is 46 years old, married, and from her relationship she has five children. Three of them are independent and two are 18 and 8 years old. The eldest of these two is in high school and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband is a merchant. 

She is a great housewife and she is also a merchant. She sells products for the home as well personal use products (irons, blenders, shoes, mattresses, telephones, and other things). She sells items using the “cartillas” system (similar to lay-away; customer signs up for an item and makes small payments toward it until payment is complete and item is handed over). She works four days per week and she completes her sales on credit, taking payments every Sunday. She tells us that she wants to start selling towels. She has been a merchant for 8 years and it has gone well for her.

Her dream is to keep going with her business and to have good sales.

loans.use: to purchase towels.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Zaina has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for many years, and she works six days out of every week.     

Zaina sells her products at the market, retail.     She has requested a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of  sugar, cartons of salt,  boxes of soap and cooking oil The main business challenges for Zaina include  transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to   own a wholesale shop and also to own a delivery van.   

Zaina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann is a 55-year-old village woman who has a job as a vermicelli seller. She has run this business since she was single. Currently, she buys vermicelli from other villagers for a low price and resells it. She runs her business next to her house and earns approximately $1.25 a day. Her husband is a radio repairer in the village. This humble couple has four children, three of them are married and live in their own separate houses, and the other one is of school-age.   

To improve her family's living, Vann wishes to borrow some funds from Kiva in order to purchase additional radio materials. She and her husband are very grateful to all lenders who help her family.

loans.use: buy materials to repair radios

loans.name: Susana Eufemia

texts.es:
Susana Eufemia tiene 30 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de seis y un año de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Susana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, insumos, abonos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprarse una casa y tierra para poder aumentar el negocio.

Le gusta bailar y el deporte en especial el índor.
texts.en:
Susana Eufemia is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children (ages 6 and 1) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Susana is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Susana is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, farming supplies, composts, and fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to buy a house and land so that she can increase her business.

Susana enjoys dancing and sports, especially indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farming supplies, composts, and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Amurllo

texts.ru:
Амурлло женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Он четный, трудолюбивый и добрый человек.   Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает почти все виды овощи. Когда ему было 34 лет он начал этот бизнес и продолжает это. Таким путем он зарабатывает денег на содержание свою семью. Его супруга и брат помогает ему по посеву семена и переработки земли. Амурлло хотел бы получит займ в размере 7000 Сомони для покупки горюче смазочные материалы, минеральных удобрений и семена. Он заранее хочет, благодарит всех кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрение. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Amurllo is married and is a loving father of four children.  He is an honest, hard-working and kind person.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He grows almost all types of vegetables.  Amurllo started this business when he was 34 years old and continues it now.  This is how he earns money to support his family.  His wife and brother help him with planting seeds and treating land.  Amurllo wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 7000 Somoni for the purchase of fuel and lubricants, mineral fertilizers and seeds.  He wants to thank all creditors in advance for the support and help.

loans.use: to buy fuels and lubricants, mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité inició gracias a la Señora Estela quién contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su Barrio. El comité se Denomina Mujeres Luchadoras, en honor a que gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya tendrán una nueva oportunidad para salir adelante y cada una de ellas colaborará con los ingreso de sus hogares y brindarle a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Mirna, ella se dedica a la venta de bijouteries, lo que le permite tener un ingreso para cubrir sus gastos familiares. Ella es una persona, responsable, trabajadora,humilde con ganas de progresar en la vida. Cuenta que todo su sacrificio es siempre por su familia, ya que desea darles siempre lo mejor y de esa forma proporcionarles una vida digna y decorosa.    
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de canutillos, pinzas, mostacillas, perlas y otros insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los bijouteries que vende.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Estela who contacted her neighbors and friends in order to form a committee in their neighborhood.  The committee is called “Mujeres Luchadoras” in honor of the fact that thanks to Fundación Paraguaya they will have a new opportunity to get ahead and each one of them will contribute to her household income to provide their children with a better education and wellbeing.

One of the group members is Mirna.  She sells costume jewelry which makes it possible for her to earn income to cover family expenses.  She’s a responsible, hardworking, humble person who very much wants to progress in life.  She relates that all her sacrifice is always for her family because she always wants to provide the best for them, giving a life that’s proper and decent.

She requests the loan to buy beads, tweezers, wire, pearls and other needs supplies to make the costume jewelry she sells.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry making supplies.

loans.name: Farig

texts.ru:
On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione, posolok Ahmabeyli  vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Farig 55 let. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey.
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Fariga , on ochen blagodaren lenderam i Kive za pervuyu ssudu, on smog xorosho razvit svoy biznessa. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit yesho korov. Uje 12 let kak Farig zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Farig is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together with his family in Ahmabeyli village of the Fuzuli region.  He is 55 years old, married and has four children.  This is Farig's second loan, and he is very grateful to Kiva for the first loan because he was able to develop his business well.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy more cows.  Farig has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years and breeds cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Colle

texts.fr: Collé est une petite commerçante, elle habite dans une ville proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Elle s'active dans le domaine du commerce depuis 2 ans. Le but de ce prêt est d'acheté des marchandises comme (des lessives en poudre, des parfums, du savon) qu'elle va revendre en détail au marché locale. Ce crédit lui permet d'être en mesure de répondre à la demande des clients qui est supérieur à l'offre. Avec ce crédit elle veut augmenté sa marge bénéficiaire afin d'avoir une autonomie financière pour satisfaire ses besoins personnel.
texts.en: Collé is a small-scale retailer who lives in a town near the capital of Senegal. She has been selling goods for two years. Her intention for this loan amount is to buy merchandise (such as powdered detergents, perfumes, soap) that she will sell retail at the local market. The loan will allow her to respond to the demand of her customers which is presently greater than what she can muster. With this loan she wants to grow her profit margin so that she can have financial autonomy so as to cover her own needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 32 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Ronald has been working hard to manage his glass store, which sells cups, home decorations and other glassware. 

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more supplies for glass making and will help Ronald to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Ronald hopes that in the future he will be able to build rental houses. 

Ronald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ronald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for glass making

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his construction business, which sells timber. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber for resale, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more timber for resale.

loans.name: Duo Perlas De Cristo Group

texts.es: Duo Perlas de Cristo: este grupo esta conformado por Mayra Janeth,de 30 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos,ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones desde hace 5 años. nos comenta que es una actividad que le a gustado mucho y es una forma de ayudar a sus hijos,es por eso que ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para elavorar refacciones ya que en esta epoca es cuando mas se venden las refacciones,al igual que la siguiente socias esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para su negocio.
texts.en: Duo Perlas de Cristo: this group includes Mayra Haneth.  She is 30 years old, has two children, and has been selling refreshments for five years.  She says that she likes doing this very much and it’s a way for her to help out her children.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making refreshments because this is the season when they sell the best.  The other member is also requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Escolastica

texts.es: La señora Escolástica, casada con el señor Porfirio, con el cual tienen 3 hijos, y viven en el zona 6 D. mayo D. la localidad D. el Torno, pero que actualmente su esposo no se encuentra con ella por estar trabajando  en otro departamento, la señora vive actualmente con su hijo mayor D. profesión docente educativo la señora se dedica a la comercialización D. productos medicinales desD. hace mas D. 1 año y requiere del crédito para poder comprar muebles para  exponer sus productos, vitrina, estantes para su actividad actual , por lo cual ella agradece esa ayuda enormemente ya que le esta permitiendo crecer en su negocio y también mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Escolástica is married to Porfirio and has three children. They live in the "May 6th" neighborhood of Torno, but her husband is currently away working in a different region. Escolástica lives with her oldest child, who is a teacher by profession. Escolástica has worked for the last year selling medicinal products and needs a loan to buy furniture to display her products, such as display cases and shelves. She is grateful for this enormous help; the loan will help her expand her business and improve her life.

loans.use: To buy furniture such as display cases and shelves.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with ten children. Seven attend school and three have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a goat meat selling business, selling at the market to butcher shop operators in the area. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to cover a large market in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase goats and cattle for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cattle for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua lives with her husband and children. She sells meat pies and doughnuts at Ankwand near Elmina  

Efua is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, oil, and other ingredients that will enable her to fry larger quantities of food to sell. She hopes to build a snack bar with her profits.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, and other ingredients

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 33 years old and married with two children. For the past three years he has run a butcher shop to earn a living and has employed one person. He says his business is good because of limited competition.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Richard has been able to save his income. He has applied for a 20,000 KES loan to buy a cow for slaughter. He hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to  buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.name: Donato

texts.en:
Donavell is 17 years old and is the fourth of 4 children in the family. Her father, Donato as a member of Project Dungganon supports the family through his motorcycle transport and pig raising business in the Philippines.

Donavell is studying for a Bachelor in Elementary Education, and is currently in the second year of this four year course.

Donavell is borrowing Php 9,871 to pay for tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2013-14.

When she graduates, Donavell plans to be gainfully employed and help her parents to generate additional income.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Hello! Meet Magdalena, a hard-working, very honest and warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Kericho area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Magdalena is the proud mother of six lovely children that she really loves and adores and always protects. Magdalena’s upbringing was very challenging and because of this she promised herself that she would work hard and get out of the poverty situation. That is why she started farming 10 years ago and through farming she has been able to earn a decent income. Magdalena is the breadwinner in her family and this really pushes her to work hard so that her six children will have a bright future and also her parents will have a comfortable life. Magdalena is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticulture business. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Kericho but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Magdalena is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from horticultural farming, Magdalena will assure her children of a bright future and she will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan the promise of supporting small scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: to start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start business

loans.name: Lako

texts.en:
Ms. Lako Y., age 78, lives a life of subsistence ranching, raising a few heads of sheep and pigs in the village of Atchamé. The purely heirloom livestock can be vulnerable to disease. She is compelled to run her business herself to survive because there is nobody to take care of her. She must reorganize her livestock business while taking into account veterinary care. Then she may receive a good return on her investments and thus increase her income.

And so Ms. Y. is requesting a loan of $850 as backing that is as much financial support as it is technical. We must remember that she repaid her previous loans without any problems. The loan will serve to construct an enclosure to keep the livestock, to equip the enclosure, and to buy new livestock. The funds will also ensure regular veterinary care, so that the animals may be raised in a healthful environment. All of this will provide her with regular income.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 78 ans, Madame Y. Lako vit d’un élevage de subsistance dans le village d’Atchamé. Composé de quelques têtes de moutons et de porcs, le cheptel est purement traditionnel et vulnérable aux risques de maladies (pestes). Obligée de mener cette activité pour survivre parce que n’ayant personne pour la prendre en charge, elle doit réorganiser son cheptel en tenant compte des traitements vétérinaires afin d’avoir un bon rendement pour améliorer son revenu.

Dès lors, elle sollicite une somme de $850 pour son appui tant financier que technique. Il faut rappeler que les crédits antérieurs ont été déjà soldés sans incidents. Les fonds seront servis à construire un enclos, à l’équiper et à acheter de novelles têtes de bétails et à assurer les soins vétérinaires régulièrement afin que les animaux puissent se développer dans un environnement sain et procurer à Madame Y. des revenus réguliers.

loans.use: To construct a livestock pen, to buy new livestock, and to ensure regular veterinary care

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo is a hard working responsible man who lives in San Nicolas de los Garza in the state of Nuevo Leon. Gerardo is the only caregiver of his elderly parents who live with him. In order to provide for his parents needs while caring for them, he decided to open his own business selling food. His mother helped him by sharing her best recipes and cooking secrets.

Fortunately, his work has paid off, and his business has grown with more orders and new clients coming in every day. Gerardo is asking for a $1,200 loan which he will use to purchase the supplies that he needs, and to remodel his location. He hopes that by doing this he will increase sales and income. You can be a part of this growth. Gerardo and his parents thank you for your generosity and kindness.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Gerardo es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, vive en la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza, en el estado de Nuevo León. Gerardo vive con sus padres que son de edad avanzada y dependen solo de él. Para poder obtener los recursos que necesitan y al mismo tiempo darles los cuidados que requieren sus padres, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas, con ayuda de su madre, quien le comparte sus mejores recetas y secretos de cocina.

Afortunadamente, su trabajo ha rendido frutos y cada vez hay más clientes y pedidos, para impulsar su negocio, Gerardo solicita un préstamo por $ 1,200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que necesita y para remodelar el local, con lo que espera que se incrementen sus ventas y poder obtener mayores beneficios. Forma parte de este crecimiento, Gerardo y sus padres agradecen tu generosidad y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and remodeling

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov has been married since 1988 and has 6 children - 4 sons and 2 daughters. She started  a firewood-selling business in 2005. Her husband, on the other hand, is in the business of transporting merchandise for villagers and sometimes makes contracts for construction in the village. Their children are still studying in the local school.  
Pov has borrowed from MAXIMA twice in the past and is currently asking for a loan of US$1,000. She will use this loan to buy a motorbike and to purchase firewood for wholesale and retail in the village. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike and of firewood for wholesale and retail

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
K. Farhod is one of the active clients of MicroInvest. His business is trade of soft drinks, and he has his own shop in the bus station "Abreshim." He has been engaged in this business since 2004.

From the beginning, he sold a limited number of soft drinks. With loans from MicroInvest, he increased his working capital and expanded his assortment by including alcoholic drinks. Today his turnover is fast. He concluded an agreement with five-distributor firm that produces soft and alcoholic drinks for a long partnership. They are responsible for supplying their goods for sale in his shop. He says that his business is very profitable, and he has big plans for developing his business. In the near future, he wants to save enough money to open a bar. Currently he plans to increase the number of his drinks and he is requesting $1000 for this purpose.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Chy

texts.en: Mrs. Chy H., age 50, works with her husband on their farmland to grow and sell rice, crops, beans, and vegetables, earning about $2 each day. They have seven children: some who are farmers and some who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase rice, seeds, beans, and fertilizer to expand their crops yields and therefore increase their revenue. They plan to use the resulting income to reinvest in their farm and help finance their children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase rice, seeds, beans, and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in merchandise for the holiday season

loans.name: Ni Komang Sudarmi

texts.id:
Ni Komang Sudarmi started the pig farming business since she got married to I Komang Marwa. The reason for her to start this business was to get additional income to supplement her husband income who worked as a truck driver.

With 2 pigs at the beginning, Ni Komang Sudarmi was able to get a profit of IDR 150,000/ month (approx of US$ 16) which was very helpful to finance their daily living needs that cost them around IDR 15,000/ day (approx of US$ 1.6)

Ni Komang Sudarmi is hoping that with the loan money from Dinari, she is able to expand her business by buying another 5 piglets. The rest of the loan money will be used to buy the pig foods. She is put a high hope on this as her husband now is sick so her business is now the main source of income for the family.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sejak menikah dengan I Komang Marwa ,Ni Komang Sudarmi, telah menekuni usaha ternak babi untuk dapat membantu pendapatan suami yang bekerja sebagai sopir Truk. Dengan bermodalkan tekad dan ketekunan yang dimiliki Ni Komang sudarmi memulai usaha kecil yang bisa mendukung penghasilan suaminya itu. Usaha itupun masih dikembangkanya sampai saat ini. Dari 2 ekor ternak babi pada awalnya Ni Komang Sudarmi memperoleh ke untungan sebesar Rp 150.000,-/bulan , hasil yang menurutnya sangat berarti untuk memenuhi biaya kebutuhan sehari-hari yang mencapai Rp 15.000,-Hal ini juga yang mendorongnya untuk mengembangkan usaha itu ,walau dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari Ni Komang Sudarmi bermaksud membeli 5 ekor bibit babi lagi untuk mengisi 2 dari 4 lokal kandang yang di miliki. sedangkan sisa uangnya di pergunakan untuk tambahan biaya pakan ternak. Besar harapan Ni Komang Sudarmi dengan tambahan modal ini usahanya akan lebih maju sehingga hasilnya bisa mendongkrak perekonomian keluarganya , Apalagi saat ini suaminya sering mengalami sakit karena ke banyakan duduk sehingga harus beristirahat . Satu- satunya tumpuan harapan kelangsungan keluarga ini adalah dari usaha ternak ini ,sementara satu -satu nya anak yang dimiliki yaitu I Putu Agus sumerta telah menjalankan kehidupan barunya dengan membentuk Rumah tangga yang baru.

loans.use: To buy piglets (Membeli bibit untuk penggemukkan)

loans.name: Humay

texts.en:
In the picture, you'll see M. Humay's daughter. M., 56, worries about her future—and those of her four other children. In her village of Soltanabad, which is the southeast Saatli region of Azerbaijan, businesses are often passed down from generation to generation.

M.'s business is raising cattle to sell to farmers and butcher shops. She hopes to purchase more cows to breed, but doesn't have to money to do so. With a $500 loan, she will be able to build up her livestock so she can grow her business and help secure her children's future.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 35 years old woman from Hrid, a suburb of Srebrenica. She is not married and she earns money as a taxi driver. She can earn about 600 KM monthly. Fatima wants to repair her car so she can sell it for a better price. After that , she wants to buy a new car in order to improve services for her clients. She thinks that this loan, in the amount of 700 KM, ($550) will ensure her productivity.

loans.use: Repair the car.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima was born in 1958 and she is from a small village near the town of Travnik. She lives with her husband, who has  a full-time job, and his monthly salary is 500 KM. Fatima sells milk and cheese and she earns about 200 KM monthly.They have 3 children. This is her first loan and Fatima intends to use it to buy another cow in order to expand her cattle business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Silvia Veronica

texts.es:
I have a dry goods and stationary store in which I provide people with services making photocopies, assembling documents, credentials and badges along with other services. I have the team I need to complete these tasks and for this reason I am asking for a loan of $700. This way I will be able give my customers better service in terms of what they need.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Cuento con un negocio de mercería y papelería en la que brindo a la gente el apoyo en cuestión de sacado de copias, engargolar documentos, engargolado de credenciales o gafetes, entre otros servicios; cuento con el equipo necesario para llevar a cabo dichas actividades, es por ello que pido el préstamo de la cantidad de $700.00 dlls. Para dar a las personas una mejor atención en cuanto a las necesidades que los mismos requieran.

loans.use: To stock my business

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn I. is a 29 year old female construction worker in Kampong Cham. It is rare for a female to work construction in Cambodia but she works alon side her husband for the same daily wage of 2.50 US$. The couple has one young child who goes to school each day despite his parents' low earning jobs. Vorn I. wants her child to stay in school but knows the family needs to earn more money to make this a reality. She hopes to buy a motorbike that will enable she and her husband to work multiple construction jobs each day, thus increasing their earning power.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Rose Bih

texts.en:
Rose Bih has been a member of GHAPE for more than three years. She was motivated to join the organization by other members after she was maltreated by her polygamous husband. She was faced with the burden of taking care of her children alone, but after receiving a loan she was able to pay school fees for her children through the profits of her piggery and farming business.

Given a loan of $1000, she will start a new business of selling draft beer. There is a growing demand for this business in her area. She plans to employ two boys to sell beer, which will help her community since there is an unemployment problem. Rose plans to repay the loan in 24 months. The first repayment will be four months after the date of dispursement.

loans.use: to open a bar

loans.name: Amina's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Amina is 24 years old. She is married, and has one child, aged 2 months. Amina runs a salon and works in a hotel. She began in 2006, and begins everyday at 6 AM and ends at 6 PM. She earns a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Amina has successfully completed one loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is hoping to continue her business expansion, and increase the range of items she sells. She will also share her loan with a fellow subgroup member, who also sells clothes at her own business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business.

loans.name: Ajoke

texts.en:
Ajoke O. lives in Alagole, Ogun State, Nigeria. She is 56 years old and married with 6 children. Ajoke sells prayer items in her community. The demand for prayer items in her community is high, so she has lots of customers. She opens her prayer store daily. She makes even more sales on Sundays.

Ajoke has been in this business since the year 2004. Ajoke is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more prayer items for re-sale. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more prayer items for re-sale

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa, 27, is married and has three children between the ages of two and eight. She has run her own shop since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Arafa is looking for a loan to buy more commodities for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, a sus 38 años, es madre de 4 hijos, muestra ser una mujer  decidida y capaz de salir adelante, se dedica a la venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas) inicia este negocio, a razón de que su vivienda está en un lugar muy transitado. Todo marcha bien en su negocio, pero le falta acondicionar el espacio para la atención a sus clientes, ya que los atiende dentro o fuera de su vivienda. Su razón de salir adelante es por la mejora de su economía y calidad de vida, además de solventar los gastos de  sus hijos, quienes deben seguir estudiando y lograr ser profesionales. Solicita este préstamo para acondicionar un espacio para la atención de sus clientes, y una mejor comodidad para el desempeño de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Gloria, at 38 years of age, is mother of 4 children. She has shown herself to be a very strong woman capable of making it through. Her occupation is the sale of drinks (beers and soft drinks). She started this business because her home is located in a well travelled area. All is going well with her business, but she needs to renovate the space to give better service to her clients, serving them within and just outside her home. Her reason to keep going is for the sake of improving her financial situation and her quality of life. She also needs to cover her childrens' expenses. They must continue to attend school and become professionals. She requests this loan to remodel her space to give better service to her clients, and to make her job easier to manage.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel the space to better serve her clients.

loans.name: Mrs. Yom Vov Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of sixteen people and is located in Peak Reang Village Kandal Province. Mrs. Yom V. has been selected by the members as the village bank president. She is a 52-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a fisherman and the other is a soldier. She is a fish seller and can make a small income to support her family. Aside from this business, she is also a pig breeder. Since her pigs are growing bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to purchase pig food. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy pig food.

Mrs. An Rotana who is a group guarantor is also presented in the picture with the group members. This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term (EOT) loans. Three members have EOT loans and are not required to pay any principal on their loans until the very end of the loan term. The rest have monthly payment loans. EOT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. They allow loan recipients to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig food.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic R. got married when she was 17 years old. Marrying at a young age has not been a hindrance for her to have a happy family. In fact, it taught her to become productive.  

She is now 19 years old and her husband Rock John R. is supporting their family through his farm business. The young couple has a two-year-old daughter named Shane-Ann. Their family is living in a mountainous area of Old San Mariano. This is considered to be a dangerous place but they are not afraid to live here because they believe that God is with them all the time. 

Marivic is a very responsible wife and mother.  She engaged in hog raising to help her husband earn additional income for their family.  Her pigpen is located in their backyard. She also wants to have a store, which could be another source of income for them.

To further achieve her dreams, Marivic is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 which she can use for her hog raising business and in starting her sari-sari (a community based store). 

She hopes to have a better life as soon as possible for the welfare of their daughter and future children. “I don’t want my child to experience the hardships that I have been through. I am hoping that through my efforts, our life will be uplifted,” says Marivic. 

To have a better life, provide good education to her child and a comfortable house for them are some of her prayers and dreams for her family.   She believes that all of these will come into reality with their diligence and determination to look for possible opportunities.

loans.use: to be used in her hog raising business and to put up a small store

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano Isabela

loans.name: Berthe

texts.fr: S. Berthe est née le 5 juillet 1970. Elle s’est mariée avec ASSOGBA Noel. Ils ont 3 enfants, Jacques, 10 ans ; Carole, 8 ans ; Marthe, 1 an. Les deux enfants sont scolarisés et l’autre n’est pas encore en âge. Elle exerce son commerce dans la vente de divers depuis 3 ans. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter les savons de lessive et les boites de conserve. Elle achète ses produits a Dantokpa. Le crédit lui a permis de faire l’approvisionnement et de porter d’aide a son mari. Elle voudrait développer son activité dans le futur avec la vente de tissus.
texts.en:
Berthe S. was born on July 15, 1970. She is married to Mr. Noel ASSOGBA, and they have three children, Jacques, age 10 ; Carole, age 8; and Marthe, age 1. Two are in school and the third is not yet of age. Ms. S. has been doing commerce in various items for three years. With this loan, she is going to buy laundry soaps and canned food. She buys her goods in Dantokpa. The loan will enable her to stock up and to bring help to her husband. She would like to develop her business in the future with the sale of cloth.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps and canned food

loans.name: Pan

texts.en:
Pan B. is a 51-year-old resident of the Pursat Province of Cambodia Country. She is married, and she has eight children: five are single, while three are married and do not live in their family's home. To help pay their family's living expenses, her husband is working as a committee district adviser.

Pan, meanwhile, sells charcoal out of her house. Specifically, she buys charcoal from a supplier, and she later sells such charcoal to villagers (via retail or wholesale outlets) for a profit. In addition, she grows rice. Pan hopes to expand her business but she lacks the money to do so; thus, she is seeking a loan to add to her personal savings in order to be able to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: To expand her business and to increase her inventory by purchasing additional charcoal

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther es una mujer de 37 años, orgullosa de su hogar, ella vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposo en el barrio de Monterrey, Distrito de Independencia.

Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Catalina de Monterrey”.  
Interesada en saber más de su vida, nos comentó que inició su primer negocio en 1994 con la venta de ropa en una tienda ubicada en la cuadra 5 de la Av. Luzuriaga, trabajó aproximadamente cuatro años, en el año ’97 sufrió un robo de casi el 90% de su mercadería de su negocio, ella quedo muy desanimada con esta pérdida, sin embargo, perseveró con un nuevo negocio, ofreciendo pensión a los trabajadores de las Cías. Backus y Ferreyros en el tiempo que lo estaban construyendo.  Esto marchaba bien hasta que un día los trabajadores dejaron la pensión cuando se concluyeron los trabajos de la infraestructura y no cumplieron con el pago del consumo realizado.

Aún pese a esta mala experiencia María Esther no se dejó abatir fácilmente, nuevamente inició otro negocio, con la venta de abarrotes en Monterrey y que a la actualidad lo viene trabajando.  También tiene habilidades de cosmetología, es muy solicitada entre los pobladores de Monterrey.

Con este crédito de S/.1000.00, el cual pagara en 6 cuotas, podrá abastecerse de los siguientes productos: 2 sacos de azúcar, 3 sacos de arroz, 2 cajas de leche, 10 paquetes de detergente y otros productos para complementar el negocio.
texts.en:
María Esther is a 37-year-old woman who takes pride in her home. She lives with her husband and their four children in the Monterrey neighborhood, in the Independencia district. She is a member of the communal bank "Santa Catalina de Monterrey". When asked about her life, Maria Esther tells us that she started her first business in 1994 selling clothes in a store. She worked there for about four years. In 1997 most of her merchandise was stolen, leaving her very discouraged. She began another business, offering room and board to workers from a construction site nearby. This business was going well until the workers left after finishing the construction without having paid her in full. Despite these two bad experiences, Maria Esther started a new business selling groceries. Also, her services as a cosmetologist are in great demand among her neighbors. With this loan of 1000 soles, to be paid back in 6 installments, Maria Esther will purchase sugar, rice, milk, detergent and other products to restock and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products to restock general  store

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married and has two teenage daughters. He sells bicycles, spare parts, and other supplies at the hardware market in Berdyansk. He has  been in this business for twelve years. Oleg just likes selling bicycles. He offers his clients maintenance and spare parts. People value this kind of service and recommend Oleg to their friends.

Oleg would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase more supplies for his inventory. He will use the additional profit to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his inventory

loans.name: Kurbonboy

texts.ru:
Курбонбой бизнесмен по продаже очков , зонтиков и искусственных цветов. В сезон  о хочет увеличить ассортимент очков и зонтов.Его оборотный капитал увеличился за четыри года кредитования в три раза.Из этого можно сделать вывод , что займ он использует целенаправленно.Жизненный статус его семьи улучшился.
Курбонбой благодарен KIVA за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
Kurbonboy is a businessman who sells glasses, umbrellas, and artificial flowers. During his busy season, he wants to increase the variety of glasses and umbrellas he sells. He has increased his working capital over the past four years by taking out loans three times. From this, it is possible to draw the conclusion that he uses his loans well. His family’s standard of living has improved. Kurbonboy is grateful to Kiva for financing and support.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling glasses

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya S. lives with her husband and two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her two daughters are high school students. Narantuya runs a business selling baked goods. She started her business in 2006 by purchasing baked goods from a wholesale market and selling them at the stall she rented in a local market. She sells six types of baked goods, and the local market where she rents a stall is in an attractive location.

Her current business capital is 930,000 MNT and she sees a great opportunity to expand and increase her profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bakery products from the wholesale market.

loans.use: To purchase more bakery products from the wholesale market.
